description:
The service was fast and the employees were very friendly. I got the sweet and sour chicken, it was delicious!

I definitely recommend this place plus there's a lot of options.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I Like The Chicken Chow Mein. I HATE The Customer Service. 

The Delivery Driver Was The Definition Of Rude, When I Called The Restaurant To Report It They Had An Even Worst Attitude! I Will NEVER Order From This Place Again.
author: DaddyPrincess J.

description:
Updating my review a few stars, did not want to give up on this place as it used to have my favorite general's chicken.  It's been better the last few times I have ordered!  The last time I asked for more spicy and they did a nice job.   The dim sum options they have are pretty good as well.  I have not been in the restaurant in quite a while, these reviews are purely for delivery service and quality.

*****previous 2 star review*******
This place can be good if it could be consistent.  Last week I ordered generals chicken and a wonderful, spicy dish was delivered.  It was delicious.  Today I ordered the same and I got a dish that I think is chicken (could be pork) smothered in sweet and sour sauce with no spice at all.  It is the most sweet and sugary sauce I have tasted on chicken.  Could not eat it but fortunately Eat24 has refunded as they saw the picture and agreed it did not look like the right dish.

Was bummed as the chicken I had last week was great.  Consistency is definitely key
author: Kristine K.

description:
My co workers like this place because it's close to work and they rave about the beef chow fun. I said to myself, what the heck? Let's see what the fuss is all about. 

My beef chow fun was ALL noodles, literally no beef whatsoever. I thought maybe the meat was at the bottom so I dumped a bunch onto a plate.... NOTE! I think in total I may have found 3-5 very tiny pieces of meat!!

For almost $10, this left me not only hungry but pretty irritated! Definitely won't be back!
author: Sabrina J.

description: Tai Chi seemed like a promising place for veg-friendly Chinese food, but the food fell flat. The Szechuan Tofu was mushy (fried would have been better) and sweet--a strange combination of flavors and textures. The sauce in the Mixed Vegetable dish was unpleasant and the dish was underwhelming overall. I won't be back.
author: Christina M.

description:
3.5 stars:

Wait/Ambiance: no wait at all / hardly customers at around 5:30 pm on a Saturday night. This restaurant has a typical casual Chinese feel to it, no fancy frills at all. 

Food: I ordered the sweet and sour pork, which did not come with a side of rice but portions were quite large (I had enough for another meal later). For almost $17 with tax and tip, it's definitely much pricier than what you can get in Chinatown. However, given the nice location, it was somewhat forgivable, though maybe the ambiance could have matched the price? Objectively, the food was quite good, though I only tried the one dish. 

Service: Fast, nothing to complain about here.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Ordered some Orange chicken and rice for a friend and I. Gotta say not that impressed :-/  The taste/sauce was sorta okay,but some of the chicken pieces were hard,rubbery, and dry. Felt like I was chewing on cardboard!!!

Plus no chopsticks,only one measly packet of soy sauce and one fortune cookie. Don't think I would revisit.
author: Isabella A.

description:
I'm still mourning the loss of the old owners/chefs/recipes of Wok Shop on Sutter. They were my go-to exclusive Chinese food delivery for over 4 years. In my search for a replacement, to quote the great Bono, I still haven't found what I'm looking for. 

Just ordered this for delivery via Eat24. I'm rounding up to 2 stars due to the speed of delivery, the estimate was 60-70 minutes, but it arrived in 24 minutes.

We ordered the orange chicken, garlic chicken, and chicken fried rice. The portions are generous, that's about the only good thing. 

The chicken in both the rice and garlic chicken was thinly sliced, and appeared to be mostly white meat... but it was super rubbery, no thanks. Additionally the chicken in the fried rice was as pale as the rice, not sure how that happens. 

Garlic Chicken: had a brown sauce, I didn't quite pick up on any garlic flavor, although I saw whole cloves of garlic mixed in with the over abundance of water chestnuts. The sauce was also on the greasy side. 

Orange Chicken: I didn't have this, but my bf did. He said it was pretty spicy and didn't eat much of it.
author: Amanda F.

description: Not the same since switching owners a few years ago. Decent food, sometimes can be dry or old tasting. But quick service. Inside can be dirty at times.
author: E T.

description:
I just ordered from this restaurant and my delivery was late, the food not tasty at all and it had 2 hairs. 

When I contacted the delivery service, they said that the restaurant would collect the food, check if there were hairs and then issue the refund if I was telling the truth.

Insulting. 

Let's suppose that I had made the hairs up and that they weren't there. I still paid $20+ for a food I couldn't eat. It was soggy and not fresh.

I usually don't complain about food or service but this has been one of the most upsetting experiences I've ever had dining out.
author: Diana R.

description:
Got myself some comfort noms for the night ahead! Yet another review from this office worker.

Siu mai (pork dumplings): Slight (normal, expected) pork flavor, perhaps even a bit on the dry side but I like that better than oily.

Har gow (shrimp dumplings):  Skin was on the thicker side of things and interefered with the pairing with the shrimp. The shrimp filling was fine, although, again, on the dry side of things again. The skin on this tasted a bit perfumey-- as if someone had washed their hands with soap and then kneaded the flour, which is great, hygenic and all, but...not really a taste you want in food?

Shrimp with three kinds of mushroom: Well, they didn't skimp on shrimp in the dish, which is always nice. Still had a bit of soy sauce / oil on it, despite my healthy less oil and soy sauce pleas, but significantly less than normal. Shrimps were tender, not overcooked. Some were cooked to still be springy in your mouth-- just the way I like them. Green peas were not stringy.

A solid spot for American-style Chinese food.
author: Nicole H.

description:
HAIR IN FOOD.  Can I give 0 stars? 

Ordered takeout last night, was not crazy for the food (chicken had weird texture), but decided to have leftovers for dinner. Going to heat up pork fried rice and found a hair literally entangled in a clump of rice.

Never eating from here ever again, and neither should you.
author: Holly H.

description: After a recent experience here, I will not be ordering from this restaurant ever again. This is the 2nd time this restaurant has altered my tip amount after paying for delivery. If it weren't for Grubhub calling to confirm the unusually large tip, I would not have known this happened. Please BEWARE when purchasing from the restaurant.
author: W D.

description:
This place has good food, but they're prices aren't correct.  The food is much spicier and seems fresher than the Chinese food I am used to from DC.  They have good soups and entrées, but they charge extra for rice.  The location was easy to find.  

They website I ordered from had different prices.  When I asked the cashier about the bill, she told me it was through a third party or something to that effect, i.e. denying culpability of the price hike.  Well, okay, but how would dumbo-me as a customer know that?  My first suspicion was to think, "oh... the ol' bait-n-switch routine huh?", but it was probably a miscommunication.  

In any case, the proper thing to do would be to match the price and tell the webmaster or whomever to fix the price issue later, but the former at least was not done.  Just be aware of it if you order from them, lest you leave there like me feeling like a fool.
author: Ben G.

description:
Tai Chi is a consistently good spot for Chinese food be it eating in or getting take-out via Eat24. 

Delivery is pretty quick and efficient and they've never messed up my orders. The menu is pretty extensive with usual Asian-American faves like General Tso's but they also have quite a few more "authentically" Chinese dishes like black mushrooms with tender greens, spinach with bamboo shoots, and twice-cooked pork. Favorites here include the afore-mentioned dishes but I also like the Mongolian beef, three mushrooms and asparagus, and the Szechuan Chicken. Pretty generous portions ensures leftovers. 

All up a pretty dependable spot if you're tired and too lazy to cook. Place an order with Tai Chi and you should be set in about a half hour.
author: Jon L.

description:
Typical of Yelp reviews,  half love it, half hate it.  We like Chinese food and it was the closest place to us so ignoring the reviews we went there.   The staff was very efficient and friendly.   
We ordered the large bowl of hot and sour soup.   It was quite tasty, perhaps it could of been more spicy, and more than enough for two.   The Sizzling Three Ingredients was excellent.  Full of beef, shrimp  and chicken and cooked perfectly.   The vegatable fried rice was also very good.
This place seems like most of it's business is take out or delivery so the sit down area is Spartan but clean.  After the sticker shock of San Francisco restaurants we found this very reasonable.  We would definitely go back again.
author: Jeffrey P.

description: They don't skimp on anything at all. The best seeet and sour pork and walnut prawns I ever had.
author: A S.

description: Stopped by after a few drinks at the Cinch, had the potstickers.  AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING!  So juicy and loved the sear on the outside of the potstickers.  Sauce was great too.  I'd definitely come back here to try the other items on the menu
author: Ray P.

description:
Ordered Soup and some other food items from them.

This was my fist time and it was so good! Great quality and taste.

Was delivered on time..

Must try!!
author: Vik L.

description:
Well, the delivery nonsense continues.  The food is good but without reliable delivery it renders it all useless.  

I ordered delivery last night around 9:15 PM.  A 30-45 min time was given.  I waited and waited...nothing arrived.  So, after 10 AM I got my phone, which was charging, and tried to call them.  At this I noticed a text from the restaurant telling me to come downstairs to my doorman to get my food.  I was surprised since they always come right to my door---I live in a high-rise.  I called the doorman and was told the driver refused to go up to my apartment AND refused to leave my food with the door.  Instead, he left with my food! So, I rang the restaurant. No answer. They closed at 10 PM.  To top it off, they are processing the charge for the food they refused to deliver! I'm fighting the charge.  

This is the third time I have had issues with drives refusing to bring my food to the door from this restaurant.  I never have this problem with others.  NEVER AGAIN!
author: John B.

description:
Standard Chinese food
Restaurant needs a renovation
Service is good
Prices are decent
Nothing eaten was bad neither was it great so I scored it an average 3- stars
author: Noor S.

description:
Tried this place twice. First time i thought it was pretty good. I liked how they separated the walnut sauce from the shrimp so that it wasnt soggy. But i noticed the breading really wasnt that great. It looked like it was just tossed in flour.

I tried their house fried rice. I liked how the meat tasted like it was grilled. It comes with shrimp, chicken bits, meat, egg, peas, and carrots.

I tried the beef chow fun. It had these weird black sesame seed things that tasted weird. I didnt like the taste.

Overall, i dont like this place. The food is VERY greasy and ive had much better chinese food.
author: Lynn C.

description:
Good food for a decent price. I can never go wrong from ordering anything here, especially their lunch menu. Normally I order take out for lunch from their lunch menu and they prepare it quickly for pick up. I actually think that the take out portions are bigger than when you dine in. 

I decided to just eat at the restaurant for lunch one day and ordered the snow pea with chicken. The service is good and the servers were nice. Also, when you dine in during lunch, they give customers a complimentary hot and sour soup. I liked the soup. My snow pea with chicken was also really good. Not much I can complain about other than the fact that my dish did not contain a lot of snow peas.
author: Annie H.

description: Sichuan chicken is not Sichuan chicken at all. Gyoza is the worst I've ever had. Never ordering here again.
author: Jessica S.

description: We are here right now wt my lady . We were the first  nobody was here and we ordered. Would you believe my lady just got her order lunch special after 30 mins? I ordered my shrimp dumpling and the guy said it will take 10 mins I said it's ok . My shrimp dumpling was brought to our table ahead of the lunch special.... never again will I come here and  eat. Disgusting service!!
author: Florinda R.

description: Best Chinese food in the city love the lay at the front register always very nice and courteous the broccoli beef lunch special is the best deal in the neighborhood
author: Adam C.

description: Barely edible. That's what I received today, barely edible potstickers, won ton soup, and fried rice. You'd think these three BASIC dishes would be easily and readily made with at least a dash of flavor never mind the grease. You would be wrong to think that at this restaurant. The dishes all taste of old oil and stinky fish. All for a lovely total just over $30. All that in a city full of choices like San Francisco. Last time I go here. I tipped too on that take out order.
author: Gregory F.

description: Ate lunch here. Only tried one entree which was hot and tasty. No msg. Portion was good size for the price.  Parking was congested and meter street parking at this location Polk St. & Pacific Ave. Restaurant seating and restroom were relatively clean for Chinese restaurant.
author: Clifford W.

description:
Tai Chi is definitely consistent with their quality of food! My staples tend to be sesame chicken, chow mein and chow fun. If you enjoy these dishes, they tend to do them well here. I can't say if this is actually "authentic" Chinese food as many of my friends who are American born Chinese, or are actually from China, have consistently stated that, typically, Chinese food made/sold in America is not "real" Chinese food. That being said, this is some of THE BEST Chinese food I've had in San Francisco or in California.

I should note that I never never dined in the restaurant as all of my orders were solely for delivery to my home. They always get my order right and their delivery drivers are very kind and humble. So, overall, I would absolutely recommend that you try Tai Chi restaurant. Happy eating!  :)
author: Peter C.

description: Love this spot! great rainy day food.
author: Braydan Y.

description: generous portion. food generally consistent. extremely good value for money. waitress are helpful as well
author: Joseph C.

description: I love this place, i work near by and they always nice to me, very friendly servers and always welcoming. Food is always good they even remember my name, i love everything about this restaurant, dont listen to the haters, come to this place and also their service is very fast:) lots of love for this restaurant.
author: Rv Andrew V.

description: Tia Chi- I love it, Not just the famous General's Chicken, but the Chicken Corn soup, the braised​ green beans, Beef and snow peas, and House fried rice to name a few of my favorites.​ and they deliver! But don't listen to me- go try china town or panda- I don't care- its more for me.
author: Huong C.

description: No msg, and food is always cooked to order. My favorite is beef w broccoli, they actually use good amount of beef unlike other places. Garlic chicken is also really good. Service is always good as well.
author: Sunny s.

description: Super close to work. The potstickers are delish and hand made. The portions are huge! Sell half orders of pot stickers so that's a plus. Lunch specials are great. The curry lunch was good, but forgot the soup. I'll check back in with you all.
author: Lorenzo R.

description: Pot stickers were amazing!! The chicken had a weird texture. Everything else was ok. Definitely will come back just for the pot stickers. Also like that it was open late and the waitress was super friendly!
author: J M.

description: Fast delivery with great food at a great price. On the short list of delivery options for sure.
author: Geotron V.

description: Their hot&sour soup is very yummy. Also too, order their general chicken,  I promise you won't be disappointed!
author: Lala B.

description:
STOP ASKING FOR A TIP ! IT'S RUDE AND ANNOYING. YOU DONT ASK FOR MONEY WHAT THE FUCK DO YOU NOT GET ? 

PLACING ORDER: 3:30pm Sunday
I CALL and girl on the phone picks up and keeps rushing me saying number number, I'm like let me grab my card WAIT. DONT RUSH MY SHIT.

THE WAIT/DELIVERY: 
Dude calls me on the phone an hour and a half after placing order "I here." I'm like "are you going to come inside the building today ?" 
He walks in then points at the receipt saying "tip tip". I told him "you dont ask for a tip" he gets mad and walks out. Fuck that guy.

Got the won ton soup, they didnt say anything about mushrooms being in it but w.e. Felt like they over seasoned it a bit. Food was fine service was annoying AS FUCK
author: Marcos E.

description: Tai Chi is a much need Chinese food restaurant in the neighborhood of Polk. I came here on a sunny afternoon (just missed the lunch specials by one hour darn..) So I got my usual when I go to Chinese restaurant. I had the pork potstickers and the beef chow mein. The Pork potstickers are little on the greasy side but perfectly seared on the outside. One reason I ordered them is because they are homemade. Another reason is I like how you can order a half order (3) or a full order (6), especially because I wasn't too hungry. The beef chowmein was a little underwhelming. They were such a huge portion but I am not complaining about that, its about the flavor which was way overly seasoned with salt. I'd say if this was my only choice on Polk St I would go here but if I had choice i'd trek it up the hill to China Town.
author: Troy R.

description: Great first experience at this restaurant. The food was good and the service was fast!
author: Rhett B.

description:
Food is terrific, been eating here for over 10 years. More than that, these are good people.

Went to the restaurant in February 2017 after not having been there since November. When I walked in, the waitress ran to me with about $80 stapled to a restaurant check. 

Apparently the last time I was there I overpaid them. They knew that was too much for a tip, so they held the money until they saw me again.

Takes something to impress me, and that did. Will continue to go to Tai Chi for the food. Will be an evangelist because of their decency.
author: John D.

description:
I was a little hesitant about this place at first with 3.5 stars, but then I read some of the one star reviews that were given for sticky tables (roll eyes). 

This place is great if you're craving Chinese food. At lunch, if you sit down to eat here you get a free side of soup, and you always get a teapot of warm tea whenever you come in. The service is super quick and the food is warm and a lot more fresh than I would expect from a San Francisco Chinese restaurant. 

Prices are fair - $7.25 for their lunch special. Plate comes with a decent portion. My friend who works out too much and devours pounds of food was satisfied with their lunch portions.
author: Sophia P.

description:
It was Christmas and my boyfriend and I wanted some simple but delicious Chinese or Chinese American food. We got exactly what we wanted!
We ordered the Curry Chicken & Shrimp Fried Rice (highly recommend), Szechuan chicken, and Orange chicken (I know, we're basic) and it was a good sized portion, made with yummy flavors, and delivered by a very friendly driver! The lady who helped us place the order over the phone was also very nice.
Overall good experience if you're not expecting gourmet. Will certainly order from here in the future!
author: Yuliya Y.

description: Eww, was craving Chinese takeout fare. Did not like any of the dishes. Chowmein was overseasoned, General Tai's chicken had a funky eggy exterior and was toooo sweet, Kung Pao shrimp tasted stale. FAIL. Nice service though.
author: Aparna B.

description:
today ,suday everning ,on a father day. i order 30DL to take out.
It tast like shi...t.
Cooking not being consistant,..
author: Tony N.

description: WOW what a surprise to hear tonight from Tai Chi that they've blacklisted my account and wouldn't allow me after 4 years to try them again after the disastrous delivery they did in 2013. We're always trying to support our neighborhood restaurants always - do we give them the badge of courage for having such long memories?
author: Judi B.

description: I love this restaurant, food is fantastic! I've tried most of their dishes and been bringing people here or over a year! They are extremely fast with the orders, including take outs and delivery! Its for sure my favorite Chinese restaurant in SF.
author: Rodrigo F.

description: Food is very tasty, big portions so make sure you know how much you want to eat, overall good quality.
author: Lindsay K.

description: This place is awful. Right when I opened the bag from delivery I should have trusted my instincts. Everything tasted of bad old rancid oil, a flavor that I could not get out of my mouth for a long time. Never again will I order from this place. Gross.
author: Michael B.

description: Used to be the best Chinese restaurant in Pacific Heights 25 years ago...obviously much has changed. General Zsou Chicken, Mongolian beef, and singapore curry noodles are very popular but definitely not as tasty as previous chefs/years past. Boring white walls, poor service...sad to see it go downhill. (Giving it a bare three stars just for sentimental reasons.)
author: Sharen E.

description: I come here often for lunch and it's usually pretty good. But today it was disappointing. I ordered a noodle soup, and they usually put the noodles in a separate box so the soup doesn't soak into the noodles.  I guess they were lazy or cheap to use another box. The noodles were slimy and there wasn't any broth in it. Had to throw it away , it tasted like crap! The one star was for the lady. I like her, she's always friendly to me.
author: z a.

description: Great, entertaining servers. Great food. Great service. Great spot. There's privacy when u want it. Not too expensive. THANK U TAI CHI!
author: Cryss B.

description: They delivered wrong order, promised to fulfill my order but never deliver. Original order was 1 sweet and sour pork, 1 half Peking duck, 2 steam rice.  I was given 1/4 Peking duck, 1 steam rice, and 1 veggie fried rice. Still waiting for the sweet and sour pork Tai Chi..
author: Joonee K.

description: We ordered delivery from here and everything was HOT, fresh, and tasty! The wonton soup is no joke- it was absolutely packed with dumplings, pork, and veggies. We also ordered general tso chicken and pork lo mein noodles. We ordered using Yelp and though it estimated 40-60 minutes, our food was delivered in less then 20 minutes after ordering! The portion sizes were seriously huge- we could have ordered half the food and had leftovers, but we were happy because it was a good value.
author: Tiffany P.

description: I am still surprised this restaurant is still in business. Especially after such horrible service and there is no differentiation on their dim sum from other restaurants. Big plus was location
author: Todd G.

description: Way better than any Chinese delivery place in noe, mission, soma or any other place in the eastern part of the city.  Glad I found this place
author: Samir K.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE!  I don't know which is worse, the food or the decor. Part of the allure of a Chinese restaurant is the feeling you are in another place, both mysterious and exotic. Tai chi reminded me of a run down tenement building. The carpet is disgusting. The food is bland and overpriced. There was no POW in their Kung Po chicken. The fried rice was boring, too. The best part of the meal was the can of Coca Cola. Seriously, find a different place to eat!
author: Nathan H.

description: For decent Chinese food, dine here. Don't waste your money or time at Chopstick House, I mean Little Kitchen (can't keep up because the name changes every year) which is three blocks away because their food is pretty bad. I've lived in the neighborhood for a number of years now and have reacquainted myself with this restaurant. I was disappointed years ago and am happy to see that they've redeemed themselves. I always make a point to order their pork potstickers, very flavorful with the hint of ginger. I have ordered the chicken chow mein a couple of times but have discovered that the Hong Kong style is even better, $1 more but worth it. Some of my other faves: Mushu pork, green bean prawns. Will be trying more dishes in the near future and will update when I do so.
author: Kim L.

description:
Great go-to Chinese for both delivery and pick-up. 

The Wonton Soup and Mu Shu Pork are my usual go-to's and both are delicious, clean, and always fresh. 

The dining area is dated/worn, but it's not a problem if you have it delivered or pick-up!
author: Peter D.

description: If you check my review's this is the 3rd update I have given this place... They are back up to 5 stars.  I have come here several times since my last update and they are back up to par and swinging a 5 star review.
author: Deanna L.

description: Poor service. Sub par food. Do yourself a favor and find another Chinese restaurant in SF. We were disappointed with our experience and will not be back.
author: Marcia S.

description: One of my favorite Chinese places in the city, it's good, traditional, and consistent. Food is always hot, even if you order through postmates. Some items may seem pricey, but well worth it.
author: Sam W.

description:
Took this home. Food was excellent. Ordered pot stickers, Hunan chicken, and Chicken chow mein.
Very fresh and tasty food!! Friendly service!!
author: Sabine M.

description:
It is with great sadness that after eating at Tai Chi for over 30 years that we will never return. They say it is the same owners but that isn't true. The name stayed the same but little else. The food is not the same; smaller portions, higher prices and poor quality and taste. But most importantly is the fact that they now have the worst possible health/cleanliness score and we became ill after eating there today. 

Save your self from food poisoning and take your business elsewhere!
author: Gina P.

description: Fuck this place, don't waste your money. First, I asked the person who took my order if I could pay extra to get the chicken chow mien but with general t chicken instead of the regular one they use. She said no because it's not good that way. Like what? Who are you to tell the customer what they like? So I ended up getting the regular version which was extremely over priced. The noodles were bland as dry cold toast and a bit soggy. Also, they gave me a fucking spoon. How does one eat lo mien with a spoon?
author: Amber L.

description: Good food, great that they have delivery service. Bad that they forget to deliver part of the order.
author: Ruy C.

description: WOW! I was not expecting to have as good of a lunch as I did today. I just wanted a quick meal for cheap and what I got was so good I had a hard time stopping when I was full lol. The dumplings were not overly doughy, the dipping sauce was sort of average but over all would recommend. The true stand out was the general tsos chicken lunch special. You get soup, chicken and rice for 7.25. The chicken was perfectly crispy on the outside, moist on the inside (not over cooked), slight spice from a sprinkling of red pepper flakes was a good touch. It's not super spicy so if you are looking for heat maybe ask for spicy or order a different dish.
author: Sarah K.

description: Excellent Chinese food and fast delivery! It was nice to be able to order my food exactly the way I like it without feeling to be a nuisance. The girl on the phone was very accommodating and also made great suggestions. It took them less than 20 mins to deliver the order at my address. Since then, I order from them at least once a week and the result is always the same.
author: Ashley W.

description: Was looking for Chinese delivery this evening and found this place on here.  It was pretty close by and had a good amount of reviews and a decent star level.  The food got here 20 minutes earlier than the given delivery time, which was a great surprise, but I got another surprise also.  Two bites into the Szechuan Beef, I found a rather long black hair.  So disgusting.  I contacted Eat24 they asked for a photo and they removed the dish from the order.  Will never eat from here again!!!  And yes, that was me that posted the photo of the hair.
author: Jason B.

description: DISGUSTING. We ordered delivery and they forgot forks, napkins, and 2 of our items. I tried to call and explain to them the issue but they kept saying everything was there, um no it was not I know what I ordered, I also double checked my receipt to make sure. Also, the food tasted absolutely horrible. Do not order from here you will regret it.
author: Megan C.

description: I would strongly recommend NOT eating here. I am all for greasy Chinese food but I've never had food poisoning worse than I did after eating here. I called to notify them of this as a heads up, and after days of the manager avoiding me, I finally got in touch where she assured me they had never had complaints like this before and I must have a peanut allergy (not true). If you've read some of the past reviews I am certainly not the first person to experience this next level food poisoning - their health score (which she wouldn't tell me on the phone) is alarmingly low at a 76 - something I wish I had checked before ordering! Hopefully this review will help you avoid the miserable days that will surely follow if you eat at Tai Chi.
author: Anne M.

description: From a delivery perspective, Tai Chi offers a wide range of good Chinese "fast-food" as well as some more traditional dishes for a great price. I have a decent Chinese palette and can vouch that their food, even though low in cost, is higher quality and uses better ingredients than most low cost options. Portions are adequate and packed well.
author: Ed L.

description:
Just finished an INCREDIBLE order of pork pot stickers, general's chicken & pork chow mein.  The food was hot delivered up three flights of stairs.  Excellent, very large pot stickers cooked to perfect texture. The chicken was crispy outside, large pieces of flavorful meat.  Some spice but not over the top and candied to perfection. The chow mein (my favorite) was the just chewy enough thick Shanghai style noodle I live for.  The meat, nuts, vegetables & sauce were the perfect accompaniment to the dish.  

I shed a tear when U-Lee across the street closed a couple years ago, but Tai Chi has definitely filled the void.
author: Richard P.

description: Wanted to update my review. They have increased their delivery time to the expected wait time and also are better at communicating any delays. I really do enjoy the food and an thankful they are turning delivery times around.
author: Britni S.

description:
Fantastic! 

Dined on a strong recommendation from friends I trust. This place was no disappointment. 

The chicken fried rice was spectacular. The orange chicken was amazing. 

Our four kids loved it. 

All the food was fresh and perfectly cooked and completely authentic.
author: Allison B.

description:
We've been ordering from Tai Chi for the past year and a half and like another Yelper mentioned, it's kinda gone downhill and hit and miss sometimes.  Our favorites were Mongolian beef, kung pau tofu, and sometimes the hunan fish.  The beef used to be delish but these days resemble boiled beef in runny sauce.  

But here's the deal, after a year and half of it's-OK-Chinese-food-Friday-night-take-out, I ordered the Hunan fish and kung pau tofu this Friday past and came down with a bad case of food poisoning 8 hours later! Like it wiped me out and I was bedridden for 24 hours!

I called them yesterday to let them know and after a bit they said they would give me a store credit to which I said, "I'm never going to order from you again" - I mean, would you? So, they refunded me my $22.83 - I know, small check but hey it's the principle that counts.

After that the girl said, "We use fresh ingredients that are delivered daily" - honey listen, whatever you say along this vein is going to hurt you more because if you truly do use fresh ingredients and someone got food poisoning, then that means your food handlers did not practice good hygiene, OK? So pick your battle, should I call the Dept. of Health to let them know then? 

And this food poisoning was no just upset tummy thing, I'll spare the my fellow Yelpers the gory deets.  I'm just saying...

Try at your own risk!
author: Favoloso M.

description: My to-go Chinese food spot :) cashew chicken and shrimp fried rice are awesome
author: Carla P.

description:
Very good Chinese delivery. They are open late for deliver which is awesome. Has a blend of authentic Chinese food as well as some American Style Chinese food staples. 

It is the only place I've found that has crab Rangoon. These ain't your mommas crab rangoons. They are the best I've had. The general tso is also excellent.
author: William A.

description: I come here very often since I live nearby. This is better than average Chinese food at great prices and portions for the area.
author: Andrew X.

description:
Tai Chi is my go to spot for Chinese food. 

Tai Chi is simple easy and cheap for this neighborhood. The people are always nice and friendly. I noticed the warning on the font page but I order Tai Chi once or twice a month and I have never had issues with food poisoning or anything like that.

Obviously there is better Chinese food out there. But if you're looking for easy, tasty, and well priced, then this is a great great spot!

Spicy green beans and Generals Chickens are my favorites.
author: Justin P.

description: Decent chinese food, fried rice is good sized portion for take out
author: Bonnie S.

description:
I'm actually not sure why there are many bad reviews here. This place seriously serves the best Chinese food especially their CHOW MEIN and PORK SIU MAI!!!

Never been to the place because we always have our food deliver to us ever since we found out about this place. Delivery is quick, they usually say 45 mins to an hour, but sometimes it only takes 20-30 mins. They have a $15 minimum for delivery which is about the average. I recommend using the grubhub app for getting orders from them! 

I loooooove how their food are still hot when it arrives and how they really packed the chow mein in the box. Such a small box but it serves 2-3 people. Their food is also not greasy FYI. Lol 

We order at this place usually once a week and they sometimes give us free stuff like sesame seed balls which is also delicious, fresh and warm!

Highly recommend this place for food delivery! :)
author: Mia O.

description: I've tried several Chinese delivery/take out spots in the neighborhood. Tai Chi has been solid. Fast turnaround times, good prices, and consistent quality. The shrimp and green bean dish is on point!
author: Eddy Z.

description: Very average food. Would not return or recommend. Orange Chicken was terrible and the spring rolls were tasteless.
author: Kiara M.

description: My husband and I were looking for a different restaurant when we were passing it..., I looked it up on yelp.., and we decided to try it.., This place is off the hook! Excellent service and food! Cannot believe people gave this place 3 1/2...
author: Sandy B.

description:
First time trying the food from here.

I ordered a Shrimp Won Ton soup and the house fried rice. Neither was good at all; the soup barely had 3 won tons and 3 shrimps, like nothing else in there. The rice felt old and the beef in it was burned, like it was probably from the week before. They ruined my appetite, and it was $18 wasted. 

The delivery was quick, but that was the only good thing.
author: Valentina P.

description: Good Pork fried rice, sweet n sour pork, egg rolls, Mongolian beef! Never been before so our first time here. Great service and pretty clean Restaurant. There are plenty of typical 'Chinese dishes' to come back and try.
author: Kirk M.

description: I ordered a Mongolian beef with extra rice added. Never got my rice. This restaurant is trash and their delivery service is slow. Waited for an extra half hr for my food without any updates. Wouldn't recommend this place. And plus the food had a raw chicken breast and delivery person was extra rude, dropped out food on the ground and left. It is my first time encountering this situation
author: Darren M.

description:
Finally found a restaurant where I can order delicious Chinese take out! 

Found the restaurant few months back and have been ordering ever since. I usually order 8 pieces shu mai and pork chow mein. 

Their chow mein is so delicious, I absolutely love it. It's the best take out I've ever had! This place is definitely our go to when my girlfriend & I don't feel like cooking or after a night of drinking. 

#bestChineseFoodEver
author: Robbie P.

description: Ordered at 9 pm. I got fried wontons and beef chow fun. Prices were reasonable. Food delivery came in 20 minutes, very fast! I expected it to be rushed but the beef Chow fun was hot and delicious. The fried wontons were crispy and okay but it probably wasn't my thing. Food portions are just right. I would definitely order from this place again.
author: Amy L.

description:
The Generals Chicken.  Gotta have it. I'm a slut for orange chicken and the hostess gave great advice to try The Generals.

-The Arp Darp King
author: Spencer B.

description:
OK, so I DID give it 5 stars (because of the food, NOT the service). As an SF native, I can unequivocally say THIS is the best Chinese in town, bar none. We stopped in for lunch & people who came in AFTER us got their food BEFORE us!! Even worse, MY dish got served to a table 2 tables away & the dummy ATE some of it before realizing it wasn't THEIR's!! Naturally, they removed it and took it back to the kitchen. Meanwhile, my wife eats her food & I wait again for a re-do on mine.
Now, ANY other NORMAL restaurant would've apologized and taken MY order OFF the bill, right? Nope, not THESE guys. Waiters pretty much have a grump look on face, and obviously the kitchen DOESN'T know how to do orders in sequence of placement.
But, again, the food IS phenomenal, comes to table HOT, and generous portions.
author: Lance G.

description: Only Chinese restaurant I've ever seen that didn't include rice with their entrees. Also didn't bring all of our order, or any utensils. The food was not particularly good, and the seaweed salad was...I don't even know what that was.
author: El B.

description: Staying at the Hyatt a few blocks away. I ordered through the eat24 online app in 5 minutes and it was delivered to my room less than an hour later. Food was fantastic and hot
author: Justin L.

description:
After moving to the US for about a month, i started craving Chinese food, not real Chinese food though, I wanted American Chinese food!  I searched up places that serve crab ragoons in SF and found Taichi with some good reviews. We also ordered the beef fried rice, hot and sour soup, sweet and sour chicken and tofu.   Crab ragoons were good but could've done with more cheese.  I loved the sweet and sour soup though.  The flavor was perfect with the right amount of white pepper for a bit of a kick.  Everything else was good as expected, especially the beef fried rice.  

The service was good as well.  My water was always filled and they seated us and took our orders promptly.  I think this is a good place for a casual dinner with a group of friends or family as they have larger round tables.  The portions are quite large so we took a lot of the food home for the next day!
author: Gwingie L.

description: This place has such good Chinese food! Everything I've had has been amazing! I definitely recommend the mushu chicken with the pancakes and plum sauce! Super tasty and not expensive! Very quick as well!
author: Jazlyn H.

description: I really love this place! Great food and super fast deliver. Decent prices as well. Very nice and accommodating.
author: Netta W.

description: Terrible quality food. Everything tasted like very cheap food. I don't plan on eating here again. Hunan empire blows this place out of the water
author: Peter S.

description:
Wow, did they really change chefs? Tai Chi got a restaurant face lift, however the food is suffering. 

I used to LOVE the hot and sour soup. After my experience last night, it is pretty obvious their food as changed. The soup smells like Chinese herbal medicine and does not taste quite the same anymore. Their potstickers are so doughy it was hard to bite into. No bueno.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Awesome Tomato Beef Chow Mein!! If we lived in SF, we would come here often.  Lunch specials are affordable and filling! Garlic Chicken was especially good with quite a few whole garlic cloves. Mmmm.
author: Adrienne B.

description: Ordered through Eat24 and it came within 30 minutes! I'm always glad to find a close go-to for delivery when I move to a new neighborhood. I ordered the lunch Orange Chicken. This came as literally just rice and chicken, so I can't say if it comes with sides or soup for eat-in only. The chicken was just the perfect amount of breeding, white meat chicken, orange and seasoning, and spice. I do not like when the sauces are so thick or sweet it just drowns the dish. Tai Chi orange chicken is great! I also ordered wonton soup, veggie chow mein and pork pot stickers. The soup and chow mein have a variety of fresh crispy veggies (mini corn, bamboo, Bok Choy, carrots, snow peas, mushrooms,celery, green onion, cabbage, wow!) and were both great. The chow mein was not too greasy and the noodles were the perfect texture.  The pot stickers tasted very fresh and flavorful. Everything came in giant portions and arrived hot (although I do live close). Looking forward to the next delivery!
author: Michelle W.

description:
My experience here started out decent, and continued to get worse and worse as the meal progressed. I started with eggplant as an appetizer, and it was actually really good - cooked well, with a great sauce. I'd definitely be happy to get it again.

Waited a bit too long for my entree, Szechuan style tofu. When it finally came out, it didn't taste exactly like szechuan tofu is supposed to - they got the sauce wrong somehow. My friend also ordered a pork dish, and even though there was no indication on the menu about it having anything other than pork, it actually came out with much more tofu than pork! Pretty disappointing. He said it also didn't taste that great.

Finally, when we were waiting to leave it took forever to get the check. And then it took ages just to get my credit card swiped. I think this place needs some more staff and some better organization
author: Amaresh S.

description: We were staying at Argonaut Hotel, and the wait for Uber was close to an hour because of a concert that night.  Went on Yelp and read the reviews. I was very pleased with our order. Probably the cheapest meal the 5 of us have had while being in San Francisco by Fishermans Wharf. 5 different dishes from vegetarian to meat dishes and they were delicious. We even had left overs. Dumplings were so good. Met them down in the lobby. Delivery was right on time. Very friendly, I look forward to ordering from them next time.
author: Katy B.

description: I got delivery from here not expecting much. The food was some of the best Chinese food I have had ... and a delivery. The orange chicken and spicy green beans... take my money. Wish this place was down in LA
author: Eric N.

description: General Tso chicken is the best town. Delivery is always super quick, especially in Pac Heights area.
author: Lee S.

description: Ordered via Seamless over two hours ago. I've called the restaurant three times. First was told that the food was almost ready, second time I was put on hold and forgotten about, and the third time I pointed out that the food was supposed to be delivered an hour ago and the woman hung up on me
author: Christa S.

description: Pot stickers are on point...been here 3 times now and I really enjoy all the dishes that they have.
author: Joseph R.

description:
We tried them for home delivery the other night and ordered a selection of the usual fare.

With the exception of the asparagus beef, it was all "very good" - we had mu shu pork, veggie chow mein, sweet and sour chicken, wonton soup, pork pot stickers and egg rolls.  The asp.beef was "ok" - a bit soupy for our taste but the beef was very tender.  

One doesn't expect perfection on delivery because things sit around a bit.  But all in all Tai Chi is a great value, with quick delivery, a smile and decent food.  We'll do it again.
author: Ed B.

description:
Tai Chi is our go-to Chinese delivery place! Delivery is fast, faster than the expected time, and the food comes warm :). I highly recommend their salt and pepper pork ribs and chow mein! Also, if you're a fan of those glazed chicken/pork dishes, get the sesame chicken or sweet and sour pork. Tried their mango and orange chicken before, but they weren't my favorite. General Tso's is okay. The sesame and sweet and sour are really yummy though! (We order from here a lot so I've tried them all haha)

They even sometimes throw in some free sesame balls :O.
And occasionally a $3-5 gift certificate attached to the to-go bag, yay!
author: Hannah P.

description: Damn, this place was starting to become a good place to order food. But today, I order the "General Chicken" lunch special. Everything was ok at first. After I finish eating my lunch. Went back to work. And start noticing my stomach starting to hurt. At first I thought I had too much and that could be the reason why. But as the hour went by. I'm constantly having to use the restroom. Not your average number 2's, but more like 3 and 4 of using the restroom.  I think I have mild case of food poisoning. Hate to sound all nasty for viewers. But this place gave me the runs. Just straight liquid and long minutes on the toilet. Hate to give this place a one star, but they need to get their act together and make sure their food is properly cook. Smh
author: Eric T.

description: Ordered general chicken and dumplings. Food was good. But the delivery guy was really annoying keep asking me for tips.
author: Daisy L.

description: This was my first time ordering from tai chi and I was rather disappointed. Delivery time estimate was 45-60mins but since the restaurant is only about 5 blocks away, I assumed it would be faster cause that's been my experience with other closeby restaurants. I checked in using the eat24 app about 30mins into the order and was told it had left the restaurant. It took another 45mins before I called the restaurant and then the food arrived 5 mins later which suggests they only sent it after I called despite the earlier report. I received the delivery after an hour and 25mins in total. I could have flown to LA to get a meal in that time! I didn't get an explanation or apology and the food wasn't good enough to make up for the wait either. The 3 stars is for the benefit of the doubt. I'm telling myself the service can't always be like what I experienced today.
author: Zephani I.

description: Best delivery experience I have had in a while. Good food, good prices, quick delivery were all super positives, and on top of that the delivery driver was polite and helpful. Definitely a new favorite place.
author: Devin D.

description:
My go-to delivery spot for Chinese (live in North Beach).  The food isn't anything to write home about, but it's still good.  I do really like their dumplings and pot stickers.

What I love about them is that they deliver QUICK. If you live within a mile, you'll usually have your food in 30 minutes or less.
author: Barry B.

description: This place has hit rock bottom. Used to be my go to for Chinese but today's order was terrible plus it took 90 minutes for the food to get to me. Stay away.
author: Scott K.

description:
Unfortunately, my son loves their chow-mein, otherwise, I would not order from there anymore. Their dishes, like many have said in previous reviews, have slowly declined in quality and flavor. That is a fact.

There is a silver lining though, their slow delivery (I've been waiting for almost an hour and a half for my food) and the mediocre food has left me venturing out to other restaurants more often and have found some pretty good ones!!

But at this point, I'd rather make my son a Cup-O-Noodle than deal with Tai Chi anymore.

Sorry, son.
author: Eva D.

description:
When we last left our wayward chewer, she was digesting some very large pork ribs from this joint. 

Today I went in for lunch, and as I perused the new menu, I noticed many of the prices have gone up significantly. Sole in black bean sauce, $13.50 from about $10.50 not so long ago. We're all being slammed folks. Vote for you-know-who!

I do appreciate that over the years they have been putting energy into beautifying the establishment. It was high time. I'm sure they're doing really well, but this is no longer a cheap lunch (unless you get the cheap lunch plate).
author: Roxmarie M.

description: I've been coming here since 1988 and try to make it once a year or so.  I got hooked on the General Tso's chicken and had it once again....it never disappoints!!  Since its Chinese New Year I decided to make my annual trip today.
author: David F.

description:
Normally I don't allow myself so much Chinese food, but it was pouring this weekend and I didn't have any real food in the house. After browsing grubhub for a little while, I couldn't find anything else I wanted so for the second time in a week, I ordered Chinese delivery. 

If you go to Tai Chi's website, their online ordering system directs you to eat24. I'm not sure what the difference is between eat 24, seamless and grub hub, but eat24 said free delivery and had more coupons, so I went with that.

I ordered:
Eggrolls - 2 stars. Different than any eggrolls I've ever had with a thick, bubbly wrapper.
Sizzling rice soup - 2 stars. Still on the hunt for a rival to Little Shin Shin. This was not it.
Mushu chicken - 4 stars. Yummy! The plum sauce seemed a little watery though.
Sweet and sour chicken - 3 stars. Not bad, but not great. 
Free gyoza that came with order - 4 stars. Heck yes for free and delicious things.

Delivery in about 50 minutes, driver was courteous and professional.
author: Rachel E.

description:
We recently ordered delivery from here for the first time. My parents got a somewhat ambiguous spicy veggies-and-rice dish and an order of the pork dumplings and hong kong style noodles. The noodles were INSANELY good and the other two dishes were just decent. Also, they forgot the sauces and the free pork bun we were supposed to receive cause our order was over $20. ):

All together, we dropped $30 including tip. 40 minute delivery time and decent food. I'd definitely do those noodles again, but maybe nothing else.
author: Cecilia A.

description:
Ordered takeout tonight. Excited and anticipated my delivery. Waited a while but that's ok. 

What bugs me most of all is Taichi's Delivery service. They ring you - tell them to dial you and you'll buzz them in and it goes on and on and on. They just don't seem to listen or something but it bugs me. :( Frown Face to that! 

Ok, moving on. The food was cold - the White Rice was luke warm and the Pot Sticker had a strange bumpy coating that I've never seen or tasted before. 

It all went down ok but wasn't worth $23.00. 

Sorry Taichi but you aren't what you were before. Not coming back.
author: Patrick K.

description:
Dear New Ownership,

Your prices have gone up +25% across the board and your food quality has gone down +50% across the board.  General Tsou's Chicken, your signature dish, is now dry with the incorrect ratio of ingredients resulting in a sour-ish mixture of red sugar sauce instead of what used to be a well-balanced mixture of sour and red sugar sauce.  My entire family no longer wants to eat at your restaurant.  However, if you fix it, we might be back.  Good luck!
author: Joseph M.

description:
Not bad. Fast and easy. I got the sweet and sour chicken and beef fried rice.

You can pass on the fried rice. Its very bland and you really can't taste much of anything. Save your money and grab some of that white rice cause it taste the same lol. 

The sweet and sour chicken was pretty good. I like that they added green peppers to it.

Very large portions so it was good for the price.
author: Bobby K.

description: I heard good things about this restaurant, so I ordered delivery and got the wrong order the first time. Then I reordered the food. I got the Singapore noodles and they tasted only of curry. No other flavor. My roommate ordered chicken with Chinese broccoli. She said it tasted just like skin in fat. She had three bits and threw it in the trash. We also ordered 2 brown rices and only got one of them. It was undercooked. Then we also got the pot stickers. It tasted like chemicals and bitter. I have nothing good to say about this place
author: Jaryn K.

description:
The General Tsao's chicken was only decent, and the dumplings were still doughy (not cooked long enough) and gross. 

They are off their delivery game in a big way. Where are my sauces? My chopsticks?  Also, be aware that when you order delivery, rice isn't included with their main dishes.

Altogether lackluster. I would skip it.
author: Meg N.

description:
I wish I could give negative stars! Absolutely horrible!!! 
-pot stickers: tasted cold, previously frozen and raw. 
Sesame chicken: dry lumps of fried crap covered in tasteless goo.
Fried rice: just gross no flavor. How do you screw up fried rice?!??
Service is nice though, they're nice people they just need help in the kitchen.
author: Maria P.

description: I swear, every time I come back from a trip, I always crave for chinese food. Maybe, because majority of Chinese food have free deliveries. I don't know what the reasons are but Chinese food it is. I've ordered many times from this place but the last one, the food was simply, what's the word, oh yeah, HORRIBLE! The beef broccoli smelled spoiled and it tasted disgusting. The curry Singapore noodles, was less to be desired and the beef fried rice, we won't go there. It's a shame really because the only good thing about this place is the quick delivery.
author: Kathy T.

description:
There was a time when I didn't want to tell everyone about Tai Chi. It was so good that I feared it being over run and impossible to get in.

Wow. That has changed. On my last (several) delivery orders, I threw out food.  I've got a cast iron stomach and can handle variations but these meals were plain gross.

Even the dipping sauce was toxic and fishy. The last beef dish I ordered was beyond bad; why the rancid fish overtones - or was that fish?  Where are you storing your food?

They owe me about 2 cases of soda for all the forgotten ones (on deliveries) and the General's chicken used to be made with big, juicy pieces of chicken breast. Now you're asked to pay more for "white meat chicken", but I assure it's not generous pieces of breast meat anymore.
This was their signature dish that put them on the map 20 years ago. Up until about 5 years ago, it was ok - more or less

I've ordered about 7 times in the last 2 months. I've been tossing out for more food than I've consumed.

1 star for the KUng Pao dishes, but it's not enough for me to keep coming back.

So long my old friend.
author: C S.

description: I had given up on Thai Chi a couple years ago. Whenever they changed ownership. Had 4-5 terrible orders in a row. Watching the Ws game. Thought "what the heck"? Got potstickers, shrimp wonton soup and General's chicken. Soup and potstickers rocked. Chicken not as spicy as I'd like, but wow what a difference. Guess they'll get a spot back in the rotation. Hopefully not a fluke.
author: Brendan W.

description: Tai Chi delivers.  Friendly. Fast. Hot.   The food is fresh, tasty and well prepared.  All I know for sure is, Tai Chi has a wide variety of food and everything I've ordered, from General's chicken to beef fried rice and pot stickers have always been satisfying.  Excellent choice if you need food delivered.
author: Jeff W.

description:
YIKES -- 20% PRICE INCREASE!

Tai Chi Restaurant has been my go to takeout restaurant for years now and I order from Tai Chi at least twice a week. I've always appreciated the good food and reasonable prices. No longer. 

I had quite a shock tonight picking up my order -- Tai Chi has increased prices 20% across the board -- a major jump. A 5% or 10% increase to keep up with the cost of living I can understand. But 20%? That's too much. It's too bad. I predict this will cost them an equal amount of business. Time to find another restaurant for takeout.
author: Brian M.

description:
I was craving Chinese food last Saturday, so my friend/soon to be boyfriend Will suggested Tai Chi. 

We ordered the chicken chow mein, an order of potstickers, chicken fried rice, and sesame chicken--all delicious dishes. The cherry on top--the potions are huge, so one order of something will feed a few people.

I will definitely be back here when I am in Nob Hill (hopefully with Will).
author: Justine G.

description: the noodles were soggy and delivery took 2 hours on a quiet weekday night.  definitely not ordering here again.
author: Leo C.

description:
Came here randomly on my way home from work.  Ordered general chicken and fried pot stickers.  The food came out quick and fresh.  The sauce was a bit thick on the general chicken.  There was a special sauce that came with the pot stickers was on the oily side and didn't offer much flavor.

Overall the restaurant is a little dank and outdated, but for a standard Chinese restaurant it did the job.  A lot of people were coming in for take out.

**Found it a bit annoying.  Took home some left overs and they put everything in a separate box.  3 boxes for 1/4 cup of brown rice, 5 pieces of chicken, and 2 pot stickers.  Really... that's a lot of paper and a hassle to reheat.  Just put in one box or one multi compartment container.  I was cussing and mother nature was crying!
author: Alan H.

description: Great food, horrible service. Twice now, I've ordered using Eat 24 and the food doesn't get to me until 3 hours later. I'll call and check the status on my order and they just put me on hold and don't pick up again. Absolutely ridiculous.
author: Caitlin E.

description: What happened to this place?  It used to be really good, now it's hit and miss.  We used to order from Tai Chi once a week, but the last few times the food quality has been all over the board.  Last time it was great.  Tonight it was almost inedible and we ended up throwing most of it away.  We've called them a couple of times to provide feedback since we really want them to survive, but the quality issues persist.  On balance, it's average, and that means that it's soon going to be off our list entirely.  A shame really.
author: Xaman E.

description: Used to love this restaurant and came here although it's not near where I live. Went on Christmas evening. It was terrible. Nothing like I remember. The wait staff appeared like they were on speed. The Orange Chicken sauce was gooey. Can't even remember what else we got because it was so unmemorable. Boring white walls, poor service...sad to see it go downhill.
author: Sue F.

description:
Last night my friend took me here for a little dinner and conversation. 
I have eaten here many times before there remodle and always enjoyed there food.
THE Employees are very polite and friendly.up until your order arrives I give them a five star for that! that being said it all goes back to the same experience s of before the remodeling. 
Food is Good but not  great. Many times just way too much sauce.
When its time to leave and this is a big one! No more tea, beer or drinks , all is  empty , plates finished and still infront of us.  its not only been 10,15, or twenty minute but 45min to a hour too get even a glance for the check. Ladies at front chit chatting or taking phone orders...doesnt matter if its buzy or slow... most irrating.. only if you go out of your way can you actually settle up your bill.  This is just Ridiculous.
Very Disappointing. DATE BREAKER FOR SURE.
 My friend was on a hour break and wanted to treat  me out for dinner, as food excites me.he ended up giving me the bill money because he couldnt wait any longer.Our  the server vanished for 25minutes. I waited another 20 .....ughh
I drop the service from five to three after food arrives.
Best bet is To Go Only from now on!
author: Connie B.

description:
It pains me to write this review as I have been a loyal customer to Tai Chi for over ten years! When I lived in the city, I would eat here numerous times a month, ALWAYS delicious food and I never went anywhere else; even when I moved to the Peninsula I still would make the trek to Polk & Broadway to get the best Chinese food, hands down! When I moved away from the Bay Area I still would go to Tai Chi EVERYTIME I went to the city, it was a given with my family, they knew that within any plans that we had that involved the Bay Area, we would HAVE to go to Tai Chi. I recommended the restaurant to all of my friends and family and everyone loved it! Last year in October, when I went to the City to a concert with some friends, I introduced them to the magic that WAS Tai Chi and they too agreed how delicious it was and the best Chinese cuisine that they have ever had. This past summer, when attending a concert in Mountain View, my friends and I made the detour to San Francisco to enjoy Tai Chi.....here's where the nightmare begins.....
     Upon entering the restaurant I immediately noticed a change in the décor, the menu's had changed, (horrible grammar and spelling mistakes), and I also noticed the shrine in the back by the bathroom. I thought, okay, this is cute; however when we sat down to our sticky table, I knew something was up. I pulled out a Clorox wipe to wipe down the table, right when our server arrived, she saw what I was doing and looked pissed, but like I'm going to eat on a dirty table and she did not offer to clean the table. This set the tone for the service we received as the server came back and forth with a tight smile and was not very friendly. I ordered my usual chicken fried rice, General's Chicken, and the delicious Garlic Chicken! My friends ordered fried prawns, shrimp fried rice, and kung pao chicken. After a lengthy wait, which I knew was strange because the restaurant was not that busy and usually our food arrives very quickly, a dish was put on the table that looked like mushrooms, and bell peppers covered in a gooey brown sauce. I asked the server what it was and she said garlic chicken, I said "no, this is not garlic chicken," (as the garlic chicken that Tai Chi is famous for is delicious chicken sautéed with garlic and accompanied by wonderful broccoli florets, there is NO sauce on it and definitely NO mushrooms,) I said "is this a new recipe?" And she said "no" and I said, "I'm sorry I don't want this, this is not what I expected." The server grabbed the plate and stalked away. After some time the rest of the food was brought, I immediately noticed the difference in the chicken fried rice, (one of the things I loved about the fried rice at Tai Chi, is that it is not fried too dark, it's actually really light in color,) the rice that was set in front of me was the right color but it had huge chunks of chicken that no one bothered to chop up and it looked really rubbery and had an odd taste to it. My friends had similar complaints about their food , like it did not taste right; one of my friends had come there with me previously and she too even noticed that the food was different. The only thing that tasted the same was the Genera's Chicken; which was great! However, the meal was already ruined for me and I was really disappointed in the horrible service that we received as far as our water not being refilled, having to flag down servers, and having to go ask for boxes and our check.
     I left the restaurant so disappointed and confused and after seeing the YELP reviews with experiences similar to mine, I understand that the new owners have really dropped the ball and have made a huge FAIL of what Tai Chis USED to be.
      DEAR NEW OWNERS OF TAI CHI RESTAURANT:
NEW PAINT, DISHES, AND SHRINES DO NOT ENSURE THE CONTINUED SUCCESS OF YOUR RESTAURANT, THE DELICOUS FOOD THAT LONG TIME CUSTOMERS OF TAI CHI HAVE COME TO KNOW AND LOVE, DOES! I WOULD SUGGEST THAT YOU GET IN CONTACT WITH THE PREVIOUS OWNER AND THEIR CHEFS TO TRY AND BETTER UNDERSTAND THE QUALITY OF FOOD THAT PATRONS OF THIS ESTABLISHMENT HAVE GOTTEN USED TO. OTHERWISE YOU WILL CONTINUE TO LOSE LOYAL CUSTOMERS/FANS AND YOU WILL REALIZE THAT ALL THAT MONEY POURED INTO THE DECOR SHOULD HAVE BEEN SPENT ON BETTER INGREDIENTS AND CHEFS. ALSO, BRING BACK THE OLD GARLIC CHICKEN, IT WAS SO DELICIOUS! I AM ONLY ONE PERSON, BUT I HAVE BEEN A LOYAL PATRON TO TAI CHI FOR OVER TEN YEARS, AND I AM SAD TO SAY, I WILL NEVER GO BACK THERE.
:-(
author: Tessa M.

description: We order from you all the time and now you say you don't deliver to our address?!?  They you say that your delivery area hasn't changed?  Horrible service.
author: Joe Q.

description: Ordered delivery from here tonight.  Overall we were really disappointed.  It took 90 minutes to get the order.  When we finally got it they had forgotten our sodas and had to back and get them.  Got everything unpacked and realized that even though we ordered egg rolls and fried wontons they only gave us one sweet and sour sauce and it was small.  There was no rice in the order!  The generals chicken and the sesame prawns were overly battered and bland. They left the tails on the prawns.  The only saving grace was the Mongolian beef, it was very good.  Was expecting so much better for San Francisco!  The only reason I gave this 2 stars was because the Mongolian beef was so good.
author: Erika K.

description:
I have yet to stray out and try a variety of dishes from this restaurant, but the fried rice and wonton soup are both quite good.

I live nearby and only get take out.  The decor of the actual dining room is very minimal.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Wow. What is with all the recent fake reviews?  Some Chinese restaurant in the area must be pissed that Tai Chi is open again and stealing their business and is trying to defame Tai Chi.

First of all, Paolo M., know your facts first before you make a statement saying that a restaurant closed because of health code violations.  The restaurant was sold to a new owner because the most recent owner, Chris, RETIRED from Tai Chi and they were closed for renovations.  In fact, the original long-time Tai Chi chef who took a 2 year hiatus has been brought back by the new owner, hence the renewed deliciousness.

We got take out there tonight and it was like having the old Tai Chi back.  We ordered our usual General Tsao Chicken, green beans, and it was perfect.  I also didn't get a post MSG headache!! woohoo!  Portions were huge - we even had leftovers.  Excited to have our favorite go-to Chinese comfort food open again!
author: Joanne L.

description: I work nearby and order take-out from here frequently. My go-to's are the general tso's chicken, chicken wonton soup, and mongolian beef. Their General Tso's is one of the best I've tried.Crispy pieces of fried chicken covered in a sweet and spicy sauce. Ask for less sauce as too much makes the chicken soggy. The chicken wonton soup has large chunks of white meat chicken, bok choy, and about 6 to 8 large, meaty wontons. Not bad for $8 and portions are big.
author: Elaine L.

description:
I was in the mood for some good ol' chinese food. Being new to the area, we weren't sure where the heck to order from for delivery. We searched google, and sorta grub hub, and randomly selected this place.

Pretty awesome.

On our menu:
Won Ton Soup
Veggie Chow Fun
Chicken & Green Beans
Hunan General Tso's Chicken

I loooved the chicken & green beans. full flavored, cooked perfectly, sauce was just the right thickness.
And when asked "how spicy", they actually know what spicy means, so one dish was super spicy to me lol, but the bf loved it and loved the fact that they knew what spicy is. 

quickly delivered, and reasonable price. hopefully another star to come when we try it again down the road.
author: Abigail W.

description: Came here a few times the stuff is good but I called today saying I don't want black bean sauce on my food and said it again before I hung up and still ended up getting black beans on my food...
author: David M.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out for delivery last night because our usual spot was closed. To our surprise, this place was great! 
we ordered the general's chicken, mixed vegetables, hot and sour soup, and the shrimp bao. It arrived a half an hour before the estimated time and it was pipping hot! We were expecting the shrimp bao too be a little weird because it is generally a very fresh dish that can get weird easily but it was very tasty. The chicken was crunchy, the vegetables were fresh, we are definitely going to order here again!
author: mackenzie e.

description: Sorry Tai Chi, but despite all the good reviews this was No Bueno! I am giving an extra star just because they were nice. I ordered the spicy chicken wings (which were not spicy) and it was just a pile of crumbled, broken up bones. I like to think of myself as sort of a Wing Connoisseur so I was super sad about this. I also ordered the cilantro shrimp dumplings (which sounded delicious) but were also super disappointing. The outside of the dumpling was so undercooked it was gooey and I just had to say something this time. They took it off the bill since it was inedible. Sorry Tai Chi, I really wanted to love thee!
author: VeeMaria L.

description: Order through Grub Hub at 6:37, estimated arrival was 7:35. Called at 8:22 to see what the hell was going on. Lady answered the phone said we are busy and said they could get the food to me in another 30-40 mins. On top of that, my charge went through on my credit card. No effort on their behalf. Hundreds of other spots to choose from
author: Matt G.

description: This place was surprisingly SO good. It's hard to find really good Chinese food anywhere but when you stumble upon one it's worth mentioning. The General Tso's Chicken was spot on. The fried rice & chow mein were both fresh and full of flavor. It's been awhile since I've had good Chinese food and this hit the spot. Plus super fast delivery to my hotel. +++
author: Britnee G.

description:
Was craving Chinese food..
So I yelped around the area saw the reviews and went to try Tai Chi.
I order two lunch specials
Beef Tofu and Chicken w/ Mushroom and broccoli: 
All the dishes looked the same like they just threw in a ton of soy sauce! Where is the flavor of the chicken or beef or the vegetable?
lunch came with a hot & sour soup:
The soup was dark from the soy sauce and the flavor was just black peppers for the spice also the soup was cold!!!!
So disappointing...
author: Lor L.

description:
Like others have noted, there must have been a chef change here. I didn't know that - the place isn't HORRIBLE now, but it's your pretty standard Americanized Chinese spot now.

Why did I order from here before?...The Oyster Sauce Beef dish. Growing up, my grandma would make this for me, and Tai Chi's used to taste EXACTLY like her's. I have never found a place that made Oyster Sauce Beef that tasted as good as her's except for Tai Chi. The velvety texture of the beef, covered in sauce on top of some rice. Now no more.

No more, "just like grandma used to make." It was a dish I could order to bring me back - a warming, comforting dish. Now that it doesn't exist any longer I wish that I had paid closer attention to how my grandma made it.
author: Kyle L.

description: They had delicious food. We ordered the General Tso's chicken and the Chicken Chow Mein.  We enjoyed it.
author: Manda S.

description:
Horrible service and liars.
I ordered dinner tonight. After 20 minutes the delivery time I haven't received anything so I call the restaurant. They tell me the delivery is on its way, it's just late because of traffic (it's monday night...).
After 20 minutes still nothing, and then I receive the automatic text message from grubhub saying that the order has just been prepared and it's out for delivery!!!!
I received the order 50 minutes later the estimate time, and, as if this was not even enough, my fried rice with beef was just a bowl of white rice with two pieces of beef, 4 peas and 2 pieces of carrots.
I ordered from here few weeks back and the order was late too, even though not 50 minutes like this time.
I will not order from this place ever again and I really suggest other people to do the same.
I even left the tip in advance because I paid with my credit card.
author: Carolina Z.

description: Solid Americanized Chinese food. Service is fast and as a pleasant surprise, the quality of the ingredients and meat seems to have improved in recent months.
author: Nolan S.

description:
Whoa.. cheap Chinese food in the valley of Russian Hill/Nob Hill.

I was a little sketchy. I went with a friend who doesn't eat a whole lot and food recommendation is not one of his strongest links, but he came through.

I gave our waitress my first test: I ordered in Mandarin. The general rule of thumb is if you have another language on your menu, gosh darn you better speak it. I've been to Chinese restaurants and they don't speak the language (Mr. Chow)... I walked right back out.  This place, she passed.

Test #2: Did you serve free tea? Not just a pot of tea, a pot of FREE tea.... also passed

Test #3: flavor.. solid, quantity.... good portions, price..... cheap, variety... plenty.. passed

Test #4: MSG.. I wasn't too thirsty after the meal... also passed.

You did very well Tai Chi, it's time to start Kung-Fu!
author: Dave K.

description:
Being literally around the corner, I was in search of a chinese delivery place because everyone should have one ready in case hunger strikes. I went with Tai Chi because of generally positive reviews on Yelp. The health rating provided by Yelp was a little scary.....but I bit the bullet and ordered what seemed to be the best dish - the General Tso's chicken for lunch. Delivery was almost 5 minute after I ordered through eat24, rice was just right, the chicken hot and crispy. This is one of the better general Tso's I have had..not too sweet, and has a nice tangy bite to it. I can see why people like it. I also ordered the walnut shrimp. What a let down. It was just battered shrimp on a bed of broccoli with a little side cup of straight mayo. True walnut shrimp should be a blend of mayo, honey and condensed milk. I ended up tossing the mayo sauce. 

All in all I think this place is pretty good, but you have to get the right dishes.
author: Jolie N.

description: Good, reliable Chinese take out in the Russian Hill area. I'm pretty much a creature of habit when it comes to Tai Chi. We invariably order some combination of hot and sour soup, broccoli and beef, tofu and mushrooms or pork-fried rice and none ever disappoint.
author: Jay D.

description: Love their chicken corn soup!!! It's super yummy. Also they have great Thai ice tea, one of the best I ever had. Never went inside the restaurant though, we always order for delivery but definitely love their soup
author: Anna L.

description: Seriously the BEST egg rolls and sweet and sour chicken I've ever eaten. Service was pretty good too.
author: Zachary W.

description: Literally the best Chinese I've ever had (eat in). It's always steaming hot and the sizes are enormous! We always order too much and the final cost is always underwhelming! We eat here three times a week!
author: Aleks W.

description:
Hunan Mongolian Beef - This was very good Mongolian Beef with very fresh ingredients. It could have been a touch spicier but that is a mild complaint.

Hunan General Tso's Chicken - The Tso's Chicken was excellent and it was a very large portion of all chicken. I really enjoyed it. Like the beef, I would not have minded it being a touch on the spicier side. If it had been, it would probably of been the best General Tso's chicken I've ever had.

Steamed Rice - Light and fluffy.

My fortune was "An admirer is too shy to greet you."
author: Mark D.

description:
Who da thunk this side of Russian Hill would have a worthwhile Chinese restaurant? After all, this is the strip of Polk that boasts Nick's Crispy Tacos and Miller's East Coast Deli. But sure enough, here is Tai Chi to save the day for Russian Hill residents and the rest of us willing to brave the 19-line to come here.

It's a good-size space but unassuming, not offering much on decor. Energy seems wisely placed on the food, and judging from the number of paper bag orders on the counter, they must do a booming take-out business. Jamie W. and I came here as we were strolling toward Fort Mason. We went for two standbys - a hefty Mongolian Lamb dish for $9.50 and the $8.50 Three-Ingredient Seafood Chow Fun, which was a bit too oily for my taste.

In case you're wondering, the three ingredients were prawns, scallops and I think some kind of whitefish. The portions are generous, and there was no brown sauce to be seen on anything. It all tasted fresh all things considered. I would put this one on par with Red Jade on Church. Its just good to know that a little exploration yielded a viable option for good Chinese food.

FOOD - 4 stars...liked it and was surprised I did
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...on the sparse side, not much to the place really
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...fast enough, friendly enough
TOTAL - 4 stars...I'll round up for the portions and the freshness
author: Ed U.

description: Our go-to cheap Chinese place in the city.  So good!
author: Jimmy B.

description: I ordered beef chow fun, it was the worse I've ever had. Dish was cold and noodles tasted old. Clearly was not like many other places I've ordered from. This place is declining since changed ownership. Won't come here anymore
author: Eva N.

description: One of the best delivery options in the Russian Hill / Marina area.  Food quality seems much higher than most other places.
author: Nick W.

description: A huge disappointment.  Noodles with prawns and snow peas had six of each and a gargantuan amount of noodles.
