The iron skillet steak was soggy and "medium" spicy was overly mild in the noodles and too much in the steak.  The "vegetable fried rice" was mere steamed than fried.  Excessively expensive for so so food
author: Gena M.

description: My husband found a dirty cloth in his egg roll. Need I say more.
author: Nicole F.

description: I'm very pleased with this Chinese restaurant. Often times I don't get great service at Asian restaurants, but I must say this experience was different. I have nothing negative to say.
author: Gem T.

description: This Chinese restaurant has been around for a while.  They changed the menu about 3 years ago and it is now better than it was, which was always very good. The dim sum is great (cooked to order) and the soups are great!  All the dishes have flavor and made with fresh ingredients. Service is good and prices are fair. Best Chinese in Marina, Russian Hill, Pac Heights.
author: Allan B.

description: Bad customer service. Walked in to have lunch and literally sat there for 5 minutes without anyone assisting me. I did not get water or tea or even asked if I was ready to order. People that came after me were assisted,so I walked right out.  Maybe just a bad day, because ive been to this restaurant before and never had that problem.
author: Jennifer R.

description: I work very close by and I happen to order lunch to-go from these guys every 1-2 weeks. I am a fan of the spicy beef noodle soup, although the other dishes I have tried from them were all solid. The only dish that could use a little help are the pot stickers. They are a bit doughy. Other than that the food is delicious, reasonably priced, portions are good and service is fast and very friendly (the woman who usually works the front always remembers me, which is not very common). Solid chinese take-out.
author: Katie S.

description: After serving in the Peace Corps in Africa It is pretty hard for me to get sick from eating.  Tai Chi Restaurant, however, managed to find a way.  I've had amoebic dysentery and malaria before, and am no stranger to the war crimes one's digestive system is capable of... but I'd thought/hoped those days were behind me.  Thank god for my old bottle of Cipro.  So If you want to commit bathroom genocide worthy of violating the Geneva Convention, Tai Chi is your place.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Watching Mrs. Doubtfire in our San Fran hotel (yes, that is right, we sure did) rather than venture out to actually see the sights (long day of walking, don't judge), we were craving some Chinese take-out.

PROS:
1. Free delivery! They apparently deliver to lots of San Fran districts.

2. Good food. I got mongolian beef and the twin got walnut prawns; sauce came on the side, so not soggy. 

3. Huge portions! Seriously, two people could share one entree. The twin said at every other place she's ordered the prawns, it only comes with 12. Here they give you 18 of them.

4. Cheap! Just $23 for two entrees and an order of brown rice. The brown rice was just a buck (in Seattle, it's like $3+).

5. Fast! They said 30 min. wait time. They were at our hotel in 15.
author: Victoria C.

description: Got the spicy chicken with basil for dinner Food tasted like hoisten sauce or oyster sauce. Ended up getting food poisoning at 2 in the morning. Puke couple of times and still felt terrible in the morning. Don't eat here.
author: Alex Viet T.

description: super fast deliver, that was nice. taste was so so but made both my wife and I sick that evening. I am shocked that it had so many good reviews. Really heavy and didn't sit well...in our stomach. We ordered a beef show fun and chicken chow mein.
author: Stefo C.

description:
what was I thinking?
feeling too lazy on a warm sunny Sunday afternoon to walk over russian hill to chinatown, i was craving some beef noodle soup & dumplings. should have trusted my instincts which told me not to go to a chinese restaurant where the menu is completely in english with no chinese characters.  we ordered:

1. green onion pancake
- crispy, okay but no layers like the taiwanese street food, more like the northern chinese flatbread

2. spicy beef noodle soup
- spicy as promised but completely americanized with the addition of carrots
- not sure what cut of beef was utilized 
- taste was okay but once again, did not resemble or taste like the taiwanese dish

3. singapore rice noodles
- salty, chicken powder does have a touch of msg
- ample portions of chicken, shrimp & fried egg

4. shanghai baby bun
- lots of gristle in the meat, tasted funny

the only thing which resembled the chinese equivalent was the singapore rice noodle which ironically is an american dish.

the redeeming quality of Tai Chi was the service from the waitress.  She was polite and took the time to partition out the beef noodle soup into individual portions (service usually only found in higher end chinese restaurants)

2 stars for the food, 4 stars for the service = 3 stars overall

my tummy is still churning 6 hrs later from indigestion.
author: Catherine A.

description: I ordered delivery, and had the green onion pancake and garlic eggplant appetizers and the general tsao's tofu entree. The green onion pancake and garlic eggplant were decent, but the general tsao's tofu left a lot to be desired. The tofu was airy and the sauce was thin and incredibly spicy. The price was okay, and the delivery time was reasonable.
author: J S.

description:
So I had a hankering for the General's chicken and thought why not try Tai Chi again?
I have to say, it was surprisingly good, reminded me almost of how it used to be back in the day. Not sure if Tai Chi's is under new ownership but something has changed for the better. I'm curious to hear what other long time fans have to say.

Besides the General's chicken I tried their appetizer of pot stickers, nicely done, perfect really. The surprise hit for me was the Emperor's Chicken Salad, the sauce was a bit too much like peanut butter for me so I added a dash of sesame oil to lighten it up and it worked perfectly.

The Mu shu veggie was another hit.

Tai Chi, I think we might get back together!

"Reunited and it feeeeels so gooooood!"
author: David P.

description:
I don't know if this is worth writing a full review over, but I came in here to grab something quick.  I ordered the Curry Shrimp and Chicken Fried Rice, paid them, and stepped out to handle some errands.  I came back, picked it up, and hopped into my car.  Before I escape, I tried it out and...it was pretty damn good.  Like...way better than I expected.

I got two meals out of it, and felt pretty good about the decision I made, with Yelp's help.  I can't talk about the in-restaurant service (even though the cashier ladies were really nice to me), or how the other food is, but that Curry Fried Rice...get me some of that.
author: Robert S.

description: The food from ere I always delivered quickly, correctly and hot. The drivers/delivery person is always courteous and smiling.
author: Patricia C.

description: Terrible service. Lied about a delivery guy "getting lost" and not showing up almost an hour after the end of the delivery window. Then they said they sent new food and it should be there in 5 minutes, then said that they actually didn't send anyone and they'd make some fresh food to send out. In the end they said to request a refund from Seamless and hung up. What? Never ordering from them again.
author: Adam C.

description:
I've never actually eaten in the restaurant ... just take out and delivery ( a little embarrassed admitting I order delivery from a restaurant that's only 2.5 blocks from my apt). 

As many folks know, I am NOT a fan of the Chinese restaurants in SF.  Tai Chi is one of the few Chinese places I'll order from.  In my opinion, they have the best hot and sour soup in the city.  It's a nice balance of vinegar and white pepper.  The vegetable chow mien comes with large chunks of veggies and flavorful noodles.  For an extra two dollars, you can also order your chow mien with cantonese style noodles (the really think and crispy pan fried noodles).  The beef chow fun and mu shu shrimp weren't bad either.  There are several other dishes I'd like to try, but I often play it safe by ordering what was listed above.  If I ever find the courage to venture beyond my safe dishes, I'll be sure to update!
author: Dina H.

description:
Tai Chi sorely needs to get its act together on paying attention to customers' requests and delivering its food. I've often had simple requests ignored -- including a cup of mustard, keeping sauce on the side.

But it's the spotty deliveries that are most aggravating. Most recently, on a Friday night, I was told to expect delivery in 60 minutes. It took three calls and two hours to get my food. Two assurances that the food would be here soon were false. When the General Tsao chicken, rice, and egg rolls finally arrived, they were lukewarm and my sauce-to-the-side request hadn't been met.

If this sort of thing had happened once, it could be overlooked. But that was the second time in a row my food had been grossly late, and these weren't the first times. I've also found that items I asked for were missing on numerous occasions.

As for the food itself, I've experienced widely varying results. I've liked the green beans, egg rolls, and kung pao shrimp. The doughy potstickers are unappetizing, and the General Tsao chicken was a bit like saddle leather.

I've been strangely loyal to this place for a few years, while the food and delivery service seems to have deteriorated. Next time, I'm trying someplace else.
author: John C.

description:
Stopped by the other night and yet again there General Tao Chicken is the best!!

Its a little whole in the wall place that's certainly nothing fancy, Yet they serve up the most exceptionally ,mouthwatering General Tao Chicken Ever!! Thick, chunks of crispy chicken, drenched in a sweet, yummy out of this world General Tao sauce that is.... so,so bad... yet oh so good ( I prefer not spicy)We also ordered the Honey Walnut Prawn's that night, which was ok but nothing exceptional.

I usually get there lunch specials.Soup that comes with lunch is nothing special,actually has kinda of a funky taste (to me anyways) Which I actually skip  and wait for my sinful dish to arrive.... :)

From the few dishes I have tried here, there General Tao Chicken is the best and I pretty much stick to that.

Prices are not bad; service is not top notch though, I really don't care, for all I want is my General Tao!!
author: Shannon H.

description: I had an array of the vegetarian options but the star dish for me was the Vegetarian Chow Mien. The noodles weren't dry or overly greasy and lots of bigger cut veggies, slather it up in hot chili oil and soy sauce and you're good to go! I'd also recommend the vegetarian potstickers they are fluffy with a great crunchy fried texture.
author: Josie C.

description: Food was tasty,  but I'm 2/2 on painful food poisoning. Those are not the odds I like to play with. I want my sick hours back.
author: Kyle S.

description: Very nice. The Mu-Shu was delicious!  Friendly people, very attentive and accommodating.  Wasn't fond of the mango chicken but everything else was great!
author: Carmen R.

description: The gf and I used to order from here on the reg because they delivered. We stopped when one of us inevitably ended up w/ Chinese Bathroom Syndrome ('CBS') later that evening. This food is very, very average tasting as it goes.
author: Adam H.

description:
Best Chinese delivery in the Russian Hill/ Polk St area, hands down!!

I almost always order the Chef's special Szechwan Minced Chicken.  It comes with these lettuce cups and is oh so tasty!  I'm not sure exactly why but the Duo Teh (potstickers) are absolutely addicting.  I'm salivating as I'm typing this in fact.  These are my two go-to dishes and everything else I've tried has been pretty tasty too.  With the exception of the vegetarian fried rice, it's a bit bland.
author: Little M.

description:
My wife (and now daughter) and I have been going to Tai Chi Restaurant to eat for over 10+ years now when we are in San Francisco.  It's not the place we always go to eat at when we are in SF, but, we go here a lot.

I always order the General Tso's Chicken, which I love.  Their other dishes are also great, but I have ALWAYS ordered General Tso's Chicken every time I go here and usually get an order of take out to bring back home.

Great place to eat, price is decent, service is good.  I will be coming back for many more years whenever I am in San Francisco.
author: Julian E.

description:
WARNING, WARNING WILL ROBINSON:

I would give this new version of Tai Chi zero stars if I could. They are under new ownership and new chefs yet their eats24 menu has not changed nor has the notes from other patrons.

What I ordered I had ordered before they had closed (and now I see they closed due to their health code score) but nothing was the same. The food was inedible. Was it really beef or maybe cat? That's how bad it was. I did not eat any of it nor will EVER order from here again.
author: Paolo M.

description:
Unfortunately my 25 year history with tai chi is over. New ownership. Not the same. Where is the old chef so I can order great Chinese!

Detonated in north beach and starving.

Suggestions for better Chinese?
author: Sue H.

description: Visiting the city & was looking for some good food that delivered. Based on the reviews we decided to give it a shot. Amazing! So glad we did. It was delicious! We ordered orange chicken, house Chowmain & some egg rolls. The noodles & chicken were sooo good. Food was piping hot & on time as well. Made our lets stay in and order something in a great move!
author: Kristy B.

description:
I've been enjoying Tai Chi since I moved here in the 80's but they've changed hands and are really going downhill.  The last four times I've ordered for delivery at a specific time (like ordering at 4:00 for delivery at 6:30) they've not read the order and delivered as soon as they got the order.  They've been nice about it and redelivered but still.....

And the food's just not as good.  Egg rolls have little meat in them and the crust is soggy.   Seems the amount of and quality of the meat in entrees has been reduced a lot.   Too bad because Tai Chi was an institution of quality.  Not any more.

Two stars now.  Not awful but there's much better out there now.
author: John L.

description:
WARNING - NOT THE SAME PLACE SINCE THE RECENT RENOVATION, MAY BE NEW MANAGEMENT, COOKS, ETC

Bad experience all around:
1) my order that was supposed to be ready for pick up in 10-20 min took 40 min.  I arrived after 20 min as suggested and proceeded to have to stand around for another 20 min.  Wasn't offered water, no apology, just how they are doing business since the renovation I guess.
2) clearly ordered "no bell peppers" in black bean chicken order, only to get home and find the container full of bell peppers.  After returning to the restaurant with the bell peppered dish, it took another 25 min to have it replaced.  No refund, no discount, and no apology.
3) coconut rice was essentially paste
4) General Tso's chicken was cold

Extremely disappointing because this was our go-to Chinese place for the last 2 years.  WILL NOT BE RETURNING!
author: Joe C.

description: Awful delivery performance and cold food as a result. Don't order for delivery or risk my two hour wait of last night. Chow me in was boring and general Tsao chicken was the worst
author: Robert K.

description:
Considering I live two blocks away I should have reviewed this place a long time ago.

I like their $6 lunch specials. I'm particularly fond of the sweet and sour chicken.

It's a good value and tasty food.
author: Carlos A.

description:
I'm not sure how to flag Tai Chi as closed.  Yep, they are no longer in business. 

Our previous experience with their food had been mediocre. Food tended to be inconsistent and overly salty for my taste.  But as of the beginning of 2013 it's gotten worse. Now I see why, they were closing anyway and probably didn't put as much effort into their food.  Reading the health report didn't reassure me much either.
author: Dima L.

description: Somone in the office was raving about ordering food from here . They have lunch specials, it's inexpensive, and they deliver...so we tried it. Food arrived really late and didn't taste very good. Plus, the packaging failed in how it was packed. Tried it a couple months ago, probably won't ever try it again.
author: Lily K.

description:
This place has become my go-to for Chinese delivery.  Not only is the food great, but the people who work there are awesome.

The other day, I got locked out of my apartment, so I ordered from Tai Chi while waiting in the lobby for the locksmith.  The guy delivered the food, but when I asked for chopsticks or a fork, he apologized and said he didn't have any on him.  I was slightly annoyed (more at the fact that I was locked out of my apartment than at him or Tai Chi), but I said it was fine.  To my surprise, he showed back up at my apartment a few minutes later with paper plates & utensils.

Awesome food & even better service.  I've never actually dined in the restaurant, though, so I can't speak to any of its aesthetics or quality of service while dining in.
author: Bryan G.

description: My daughter and I ate here both nights we were visiting San Francisco.  We enjoyed vegetable potstickers, veggie fried rice and General Tso's tofu the first night.  Our second dinner consisted of vegetable eggrolls and three mushroom tofu with steamed rice.  Prices were reasonable, our waiter was pleasant, efficient and appropriately attentive.  I wish we had a Chinese restaurant like this where I live on the east coast.
author: C B.

description: The delivery was fast, but the food was awful. Avoid the stomach ache.
author: Daniel W.

description:
It's fine - not great, not bad. The delivery came within the promised time range (30-60 min.) on a Friday night around 8, and I do appreciate that they're open later than some delivery places. The shanghai spring rolls were quite large - there's 2, and probably half of one would be a normal-sized appetizer for one person. The vermicelli, minced carrot and mushroom, and chicken were somewhat bland but the whole roll was nicely prepared - they had punctured the plastic delivery container so that the rolls remained crisp. 

The braised green beans were fine but lacking a bit in flavor as well - they had a bit of a sheen, so I imagine they had enough fat, but maybe they just needed a bit more of something salty. I liked the mu shu but I'm not too picky about that dish. The fried entrees probably fared the worst, although maybe it was our fault for picking 2 - general tso's chicken and sweet and sour pork. Not bad or anything, just not the guilty pleasure they can be. Seems like a reliable fallback but I'll be trying out a couple of other Chinese places for delivery before settling here.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Haven't eaten in the restaurant or used delivery but the take out was easy easy. You can either order online or call and speak to someone who is intelligible and friendly. 

Food was ready within the time specified (15 min) and they had me in and out of the restaurant in less than 5 minutes. 

Got the vegetarian potstickers. Pretty good. Even better with the accompanying sauce. Also tried the vegetarian chow mein. Also very good  and the veggies were fresh. If you are a vegan they have Chow Fun as well. 

Great neighborhood find. Thanks yelpers. Wouldn't have tried them without reading the reviews first.
author: Heather L.

description: Great price, fast and good. I always have the green bean with beef. Lunch time is great value lots of the main dish with rice and the daily soup!
author: Michael L.

description: Fast and really friendly service! Genuinely enjoyed our waitress and her recommendations. Inexpensive, tasty, and looking forward to my next meal: Mu Shu Pork and crispy noodles w/ beef! Definitely my go-to Chinese on Polk St.
author: Victoria B.

description:
If you want a near death experience, go ahead and place your order.

If food poison is your thing, then this is the spot.

I grabbed take out 2 days ago and this place took me out for an entire day.

I was in pain and I missed work; but at least it was spiritual experience because I was on my knees praying to the porcelain god. 

My toilet and I are now closer because of you Tai Chi restaurant.

I prayed to it, sat on it, and as the day wore on we cuddled.

Do yourself a favor and stay away.
author: ian A.

description: Apparently, some have low standards for their Chinese food.  I had been going to Tai Chi for almost 20 years and stop by when I'm in the City.   A few months back was shocked to see they closed, but re-opened to all new menus, spruced up look and new owners.  They told me it was new owners but the same chef.  Well, after 2 try's, I give up.   The Generals Chicken has definitely changed for the worse.  Probably putting all the money into improvements and not ingredients.    It now tastes like something you buy pre-packaged in the Supermarket!.
author: David M.

description:
I've only had food poisoning a couple of times in my life and Tai Chi delivery was one of them. It probably shouldn't have come as a surprise because in my past experiences with Tai Chi I noticed the vegetables looked past their prime (e.g. yellowing on the broccoli) and the taste and smell of their shrimp always seems to be off.

The only silver-lining here is that I do know the place was shut down for a couple of months before reopening a few weeks ago. It looks like they did some remodeling. Perhaps they cleaned their kitchen and hopefully start getting fresher food!

Good luck. You're going to need it if you order from here!
author: Brian W.

description:
Using the internal Chinese martial art technique of Tai Chi is not necessary for kids and me to ship my wife away on her business trip. But dining at the Tai Chi Restaurant is another form of method to help ease stresses and various ailments, now that wife is away. Am I being haughty?

Whenever I pass by and look at the inside of this place, this restaurant looks like a studio to do an actual Tai Chi course. That's not a bad idea. 

For our appetizer, we split an order of Chinese-style green-onion pancakes. The $3.25 deep-fried and flakey appetizer had an overpowering taste of onions fried up similar to a side of Naan bread.  

I had a craving for a plate of Mongolian Chicken over rice. For $5.95, you get the leanest pieces of chicken meat with chopped scallions, onions and bits of dried chili peppers in a spicy sauce with a heaping scoop of rice. For a guy who loves spicy food, I find my tasty rice plate tolerable enough for anybody .i.e. my kids who can't stand spicy food and enjoy the rice plate without the spiciness interrupting their taste buds. 

The kids split an order of the General Tsao Chicken over a heaping scoop of rice. For $7.50, you get chicken pieces fried up covered with a tangy sauce. This rice plate is classified as a spicy dish, I had a bite of their chicken and their shared plate is perfectly tolerable enough for my kids to eat and enjoy, even with continuous refills of iced water by the attentive waiter and waitresses. 

They also do delivery services here, but only within the Russian/Nob Hill area. Credit cards are accepted. (You expect my kids to pay).

This restaurant is a favorite of Yelp, Zagat and CitySearch, with their respected stickers posted on the door.

(My review is one of their favorites).
author: Matt G.

description: Fast delivery even on a weekend. Kung pao is hot hot hot. Hot sour soup was wonderful. I should have gotten rice to absorb some of the heat of the Kung pao but its great anyway.
author: Heather W.

description:
We ordered delivery this evening and the food was outstanding.  

Furthermore, it was delivered in 10 minutes. 

Will definitely order again and recommend to our friends.

David E
author: David E.

description:
Under new ownership and the food suffered greatly! It was awful. Greasy, undercooked and slimy. I was a loyal customer for years! We will never order from there again 
FYI they always deliver the wrong order as well. Sad but true
author: Hilary R.

description:
I wish I had read the recent reviews before I ordered from here tonight.  Tai Chi used to be my favorite Chinese restaurant, but the food I ordered tonight was terrible.  Not just mediocre, but completely inedible.  We ordered chicken with broccoli and the minced chicken with lettuce cups (which they forgot to bring and we had to call them again to bring it).  The chicken in all of our dishes was limp and rubbery. The sauces had no flavor.  The food overall looked very unappealing.  

Why did the old owners / chef leave???  I want my old Tai Chi back!!!
author: Melissa L.

description:
These three stars? Purely sentimental.

It would not be too far from the truth say that it all began over mediocre delivery Chinese from Tai Chi. And for once, I can't recall at all what we ordered or how it tasted or even how long it took to arrive. If you know me, you know that says a lot.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Oh Tai chi; since 1989, when I moved to SF, I loved your generals chicken and string beans... then you expanded and slowly went down. I had some mild revenge in my stomach from time to time but I kept coming back for the two dishes. This Sunday past, was the LAST TIME. 

Oh f**k me was I paying the price, maybe I'm older and I don't have a cast iron stomach but really it's probably the fact that you don't wash your floors, kitchen surfaces, windows, (your hands?) and are using yellow dyed chicken from tyson (not certain). I don't know and I don't care any more.

Your food tastes good, but really i wish it was good clean food. It's not and I'm not gonna be blinded by wishful thinking and ignoring the obvious. 

I do like the younger people at the counter.. They are very nice. Unlike the cooks which are always grumpy and scowling. Maybe that's the problem...who cares... it's over!
author: Nik D.

description: The only reason why i wont give this place 1 star is because I honestly enjoy the food i order, mostly orange chicken. However, the customer service here is awful! Ive been here many times, and not once does the waiter check on me or my group, i have to get up and ask for things myself or get things i need- its just extemely bad customer service. If this place had amazing customer service, or atleast decent- Id go alot more and give it 4 or 5 stars.
author: Mike L.

description: Fairly decent food but they could do better. Dined in recently and ordered the Basil Chicken in Plum sauce. A little slow on the service and when the meal came I had more string beans than basil or chicken. I think there was maybe one or two pieces of basil none which fused with any of the other flavors in the dish. Probably could have done without the string beans altogether. The other veggies in the dish were also under cooked and over cut making it almost impossible to get a bite of all of the ingredients in one grab with the chop sticks and the plum sauce left a lot to be desired. I think you guys could do better. They did have a good assortment of beer but overall they need to raise the bar a bit on the whole experience and then I think they would do very well. I'll check back here in a little while to see what happens.
author: Cody W.

description: This is my favorite Chinese delivery place. I've never eaten in, only gotten delivery. It's exactly what you want when you think standard classic Chinese dishes you grew up eating. Great general tsaos chicken, chow mein, egg drop soup. Delivery has never disappointed.
author: anna s.

description:
I had Tai Chi take out for dinner last night and it was pretty good! I'd go back for sure....I'm not a "fan" (4 stars) yet, because I like to have ethnic food a few times before knowing for sure that it's not gnarly, but... so far so good! I'll come back and up the rating after I've been there a few more times. 

Their chicken and string beans and mu shu chicken were pretty tasty.... ok maybe 3.5 stars worthy. 

It's just hard to give them a higher rating when I havent actually been IN the restaurant and am not familiar with the friendliness of the staff...
author: Jodie B.

description:
I first went to Tai Chi in the fall of 1978 with my late Sister Rita and Brother in law Michael. I had not yet moved to the Bay Area and had come out for a job interview. It was a transitory period and during my first delicious Tai Chi meal I was amazed at the spiciness of their General Tso's chicken and hot and sour soup. We ate there the Friday night before my job interview.  I got the job, moved to the Bay Area, and had found a new favorite restaurant and favorite dish. Over the past 36 years I have been here dozens of times with lots of folks. For the most part, my friends agreed that this was indeed a special place. I have thought if I were to have my last meal on earth, Tai Chi's General Tso's chicken would be on my menu. Many a time when I found myself at a different Chinese Restaurant, I would order this dish and be disappointed. It simply paled in comparison to Tai Chi's.  Tonight was my first time back since the change of ownership and I am Happy, I am *thrilled*to announce that Tai Chi is as great as ever! Moist, delicious and wonderfully spiced. The Great Tradition continues!  Bravo new Owners! Thank You!
Jonny W y Heidi
author: Jonny W.

description:
I love this place! 

I have yet to have eat there, but from pictures it looks welcoming.

I had family who had driven into town late, all they wanted was some great Chinese food in San Francisco. 
I shopped around and found that Tai Chi was open and delivering! 
The food got to my house with in 20 minutes! I was shocked!
The entrees were HUGE! There were three of us with awesome left overs for two days!
The food its self truly is amazing. I actually just placed an order from there right now because my mouth will not stop watering.
author: Jessica R.

description:
A few things you need to know about Tai Chi's food.

1.  If you want healthy, low-salt, low-fat, low-oil, lightly-seasoned, lovingly-crafted Chinese food?  This aint it.  This is for your I-have-an-urge-to-mow-down-on-some-delicious-American-style-Chinese-food-gimme-gimme-om-nom-nom!  What Tai Chi does right is marrying sweet+piquant in their sauces.

2.  Unlike so many Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, Tai Chi has a surprising array of pretty good tasting entrees.  I dig that!  Don't you get tired discovering that a restaurant can only seem to make one, maybe two dishes to your liking? 

3.  This is NOT one of those San Francisco Chinese restaurants that seem to use the same sauce base in every single  dish.  Hooray!

Onward to reviewing the food!

Appetizers - SKIP.  I've tried to pot stickers -- the filling is fail.  Steam dumplings? Same.   I've bitten into the spare ribs -- unremarkable.  Egg rolls?  Nah.  If you must have your dumplings? I'm telling you, pass and order another entree instead.

Soup - I don't order soups, sorry.

Entrees.  Some of my faves:

1.  Hunan General Tso's Chicken:  the classic, Chinese-American dish done to perfection by sparing not one calorie to ensure ultimate flavor.  No veggies, just deep-fried meat in a scrumptious sticky-sweet and savory sauce. You'll wanna spoon the goopy sauce over rice, it is crack-sauce;  extra-crispy batter, tender chicken chunks *ask for white meat if you don't like thigh meat* -- and for delivery, they do make an effort to keep the chicken crispy by popping open the corner of the container. Alas, the pieces on the bottom will get soggy; nothing much can be done. Do not expect this to reheat crispy.

2.  Orange Beef:  Another veggie-less dish (unless you consider orange peel a veggie?) dry, slices of beef with an almost crispy mouth-feel submerged in a tongue-coating, spicy, savory brown sauce.  Eat side-by-side with the General Tso's for the ultimate, oral-gasmic experience.  Heads-up for the slices of orange peel, they can impersonate slices of beef (especially when reheated) so pick em out with your chopsticks, trust me you do not wanna bite into one.  Same for the many chili peppers - you'll wanna push those over to the side or pick them out.  Another, licking-it-off-your-plate sauce.

3.  Shredded Pork With Brown Sauce:  strands of chew-licious pork with crunchy strings of bean curd in a subtle, pleasant, not-spicy brown sauce.  A nice departure from the flavor-bomb sauces I mentioned above.

4.  Shanghai Chicken:  if you're not familiar, this dish features chunks of chicken in a tangy brown sauce with toasted pine nuts on the right-side next to chewy, tender seaweed on the left.  Eric's makes it drier, probably healthier too, but Tai Chi gives you more sauce.  Comes with thigh meat unless you ask for breast.

5.  Spicy Chicken with Fresh Basil:  perhaps better known as Spicy Chicken with Crispy Basil, this is the well-known Thai-spiced delight featuring slices of white meat chicken, crunchy red and green bell peppers, sweet Thai basil in a succulent sweet-and-tangy sauce.  Perhaps your favorite Thai restaurant does it better but it's well worth ordering at Tai Chi.

6.  Dry Braised Green Beans:  a piquant dish -- definitely not for a mouth that can't take much heat.  Toasty garlic and pepper seeds tossed over crunchy beans, it's simple, it's great.

Wrapping up this novelette by offering some criticisms:

Kung Pao [AnyProtein]:  unremarkable.  The peanuts aren't ever toasted to concentrate the flavor and the sauce is much too subtle so that the bell pepper flavors dominate.  For mind-blowing Kung Pao, try Andy's.

Noodles:  I've had the Chow Mein, the Chow Fun, with black bean without... the noodle texture is fine but the flavor is very average. Noodles are not a strong suit of Tai Chi.

Mu Shi [a.k.a. Mu Shu]:  not offensive, but not particularly surprising - it's just ok.  

Tender Greens with Garlic Sauce:  was okay at the restaurant but the greens lost alot of their texture upon delivery.  It comes in the white garlic sauce, not the brown.

***
TL;DR version:  What is Tai Chi about?  Extremely tasty, sweet-and-tangy sauces that DONT all taste the same and a surprising number of yummy entrees set Tai Chi apart and above from your typical, American-style Chinese restaurant.  
Perhaps not the healthy choice but you will enjoy every calorie.  Really.
author: Ben S.

description:
Wow. I was surprised that every review wasn't one star. I wasn't attacked  by rats and I didn't actually get sick, but I think that is the only reason I would give it one star. They DO serve food there. I only popped in because the line at Nick's Crispy Tacos was too long and it had been awhile since I had good Chinese food. Sadly, it has still been awhile since I have had good Chinese food. 

My meal was terrible, my companion's meal was terrible. It did come out quickly, but everything was somehow both bland and over salted. How do you ruin shrimp chow mein? Ask the people at Tai Chi, I'm sure they can tell you. Anything with sauce apparently comes over cooked with too much sauce. With a hot tsunami of crappy sauce. I'm all over MSG and still, couldn't finish it. My taste buds didn't want me to finish it. Even though I was pretty hungry. We declined to take our food to go. It was so bad, I would rather leave hungry and reject the food I already paid for. I rate this place below the place I went to years ago (now closed) that actually had a rodent run through the joint while I was eating my dinner. That place, up until the lone rodent marathoner sighting, actually had tasty eats. 

As I was leaving I noticed a canister among the bottles and foodstuffs that had caught my eye once or twice while I was eating, upon closer inspection I saw it was Tinactin. As the can explained, it is used to treat jock itch and foot fungus. I'm not sure how to wrap this up, but to say in a city with thousands of restos and a street with a number of spots in both directions, there is no reason to eat at Tai Chi. Even if you do have athlete's foot since they can apparently help you out right at the counter.
author: M. M.

description: This place is awful. They're always late on deliveries - some times taking an hour and a half (I live down the street) and whenever you call and ask where it is, they always say the driver is on the road. The driver is obviously not on the road.
author: Edward Z.

description: It had been a long time since I'd eaten here so I didn't realize it was new ownership. I still ordered general tso's chicken which is what I had craved as it was the best in the city (by the previous owners that is). Unfortunately it was just okay. It was spicy but lacked the crisp and overall flavor of the best they were once known for. Service was fast and clinical, no personality which I'm okay with but won't make a point to return unless it just happens to be very convenient.
author: Jim L.

description: I love Tai Chi and it's the only delivery Chinese food that I eat....always hot when it arrives and fresh tasting!
author: Mark Taylor - L.

description:
I ordered takeout from Tai Chi last night - my roommates love it.  We got the orange chicken, beef broccoli and combination chow mein.  The combination chow mein probably wasn't a good call - as my roommate pointed out, it's the chow mein of leftovers.  And it kind of was - a little bit of chicken, beef, squid, shrimp, scallops...I don't know what else was in there.  I was expecting thin, crispy Hong Kong-style noodles, but I ended up getting thicker noodles.  It wasn't bad, but I don't think I'd order it again.  The orange chicken and beef broccoli were good, but the orange chicken is deep fried....which makes it a bit heavy.

All in all, they deliver quickly and serve pretty decent food.  It's definitely not the best Chinese food, but pretty darn convenient.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Happy Chinese New Year!  I was at home sick today, but I wanted to celebrate the holiday by eating as being sick never once affected my appetite - uh uh!  I had some take-out menus in a drawer, and I consulted Yelp to see which one would be a good choice for me.  

Tai Chi rated high and most people on here seemed pleased with the food and the delivery service - so Tai Chi it was!  I ordered the chicken with black bean sauce and red cooked eggplant - they both came with rice and a dumpling on the side (lunch special $4.95 each).  Yumo!!  I ate happily & heartily and celebrated the New Year in my own way.  

My food was delivered within 20 minutes (I'm close).  The only thing I worried about was that I had to repeat my phone number and address to the girl on the phone because she didn't seem to get it right.  I wasn't too confident that she got it right, but in the end, she did!  Yay!  

And please note, on the menu I have, it says that the $4.95 specials come with fruit, rice and soup, but due to environmental laws and the use of styrofoam cups, the specials now only come with rice and a dumpling on the side.  The girl on the phone said they printed so many of the menus that they "didn't want to waste" them and used them even with the mis-print.  She apologized.    

But after all is said and done, I give it a 4!
author: Maile N.

description: This is the second time I've eaten here and it's really not good. The first time was okay but this time the tofu was barely cooked so it tastes disgusting and the sauce is extremely thin.
author: Emily Rose P.

description:
Favorite Chinese delivery in the city, only one I will order from. Order online, eat24hours.com 

We order the same thing every time (click Re-Order) 
Try: Shrimp Fried Rice, Pot Stickers, and Sweet & Sour Pork... All very delicious! 

Good portions, good prices, good food!!
author: Jennifer L.

description: Too expensive and "Americanized" for my taste.  I prefer the places on Clement St. or even Chinatown.
author: Anthony L.

description:
One of my all time favs in SF. I have been going there for 3 remodels now. 
try the generals chicken, it is a winner. as well as the iron plates. 
it's been there a long time, and the new owners are trying to harvest more money from the customers than back in the day. but I am still going to have to eat their chicken in the future.
author: ric n.

description: Going here for 30 years. It isn't same :( general tsao was icky couldn't finish it was like it was made with karo syrup. . Huge bummer. Won't come here again.
author: Marianne L.

description:
Shrimp War Won Ton Soup after a horrendous flight from 80s-weather to cold SF weather surrounded by screaming children = heavenly.

We sat down in the half-empty restaurant (it later filled up) and I was surprised that it didn't have the typical tacky Chinese paintings and artwork tacked up on the walls.  Disheartened by a lack of things to look at, I decided to concentrate on my food, which was pretty much amazing.

Spicy broth, whole shrimp and pork wontons made for an amazing, belly-warming meal.  4.5 stars - I like shrimp in my wontons, along with the pork - but these were pretty damn good.  Pretty decently priced, although I've seen bowls of wonton soup that were a few dollars cheaper.

We also ordered the "tender greens in garlic sauce," which turned out to be under-sauteed bok choy in a thick garlic sauce, and we decided that it would taste better if we dumped it back on the wok and fried it up some more.  2 stars :(

It took us three tries to get some water (go figure, it's free), but we did succeed in the end, although they never came by to refill.  The fortune cookies came unwrapped, so I was a bit hesitant to touch them.  I cracked it open anyway, and found out, via the slip of paper, that I needed to take a vacation in order to experience adventure.

Will definitely be returning again, though not for the fortune cookie!
author: Tori S.

description:
We have been coming to Tai Chi since the very first owner started this place, continued coming here with the second ownership and now we came here this
evening for the first time  to try the food under the recent new ownership.
  
We ordered the Westlake soup with White Chicken and Braised Green Beans and brown rice.We are only giving both dishes 3 stars because both dishes were on the "too salty side", especially the green bean dish.  

The soup was not as thick as it previously was, and didn't have the big chunks of egg white in it and only very tiny pieces of chicken meat in it - with one pea in the whole order but they had added some little carrot squares. It was good, but not great as it was prepared with the previous owner.  The braised beans were fresh and very green but the taste was not as good as the previous owner prepared them. The sauce was way too salty.

I can understand that the owner who has different cooks now, will not be able to
get the exact taste as the prior owner did and that the new owner is contending with
long-time customers who want the food to be the same as it was and it's the prerogative of the new owner to make some changes...but he better use caution in making changes.  It's a real dilemma and I think they need to focus on not making the dishes too salty and include a plentiful portion of ingredients to each dish.

To be fair, we want to give them a couple of more tries. This is a very critical time for these new owners.....they better move fast to get their food in order. The two previous owners had a gold mine going on here and it would be a shame to not have the
same success. I truly believe they should get some of the previous cooks back
to get the recipes back on track.  Time will tell.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description:
Always a pleasure from Tai Chi. Sure it is your typical greasy Chinese food, but I still love it. The couple times I've eaten in, it's decent for the price range. The food is always warm, without being too gooey (a common fault at Chinese restaurants, when they overpower their dishes with tapioca powder). They stuffed pepper appetizer was so hot and delicious. 

My typical flu-day order-in: pot stickers + hot and sour soup. I have not had hot and sour soup as authentic as Tai Chi's, and I've been searching for quite some time. It is simply delicious, just the right amount of heat and vinegar. 

Makes me want some more now...
author: Fiona S.

description: For the price, it's great! Portions are pretty big ( I've only ever gotten take out though) and the food is legit. I don't like the peanut sauce that comes with the green onion pancake appetizer though, but that's just preference!
author: Kristina B.

description:
I also don't understand why Tai Chi continues to get good business and good reviews. I have lived around Polk Street for two years, and have consistently been disappointed with their food. Whether it's take-out, dine-in or delivery, I always read yelp reviews thinking that their 4-star rating must mean something, and it just means that you can't always trust yelp. 

We got one order of potstickers, two orders of steamed dumplings (mushroom and meat), and one order of scallion pancakes with peanut sauce (dry, probably frozen, then pan-fried). 

Horrible. Save your money. If you want chinese food, go to Wok Shop Cafe a few blocks away (they also deliver) on Van Ness. If you want other asian food, go to Little Thai right next door. Polk Street is full of good food, don't waste your money on Tai Chi.
author: Eric C.

description:
Despite what seems to be a recent onslaught of negative reviews, we had a perfectly pleasant time at Tai Chi, and would definitely recommend to others.

We ate in, so I can't really comment on the takeout/delivery service, but the service in the restaurant was excellent.  The waitstaff was friendly and efficient, and my water glass was always full.  The restaurant itself is nothing to write home about (beige floors, beige walls, beige tables), but whatever, I'd rather have low prices than fancy decor.

We ordered the Chef's Special for 3, which is essentially a prix fixe that includes tea, sizzling rice soup, eggrolls, a shrimp & veggie dish, hunan beef, general gao's chicken, and rice (I believe the price is $15 pp).  First of all, the portions are insane.  You will NOT leave hungry, and more likely than not, you will leave with leftovers.  

Second of all, if you come wanting Americanized, flavorful Chinese food, you will be satisfied.  I see a lot of people complaining that the food here is too greasy - I didn't feel the same way - especially compared to Andy's down the street.  I'm not saying it isn't greasy - it's Chinese food after all, people - but it's not overly greasy or comparatively greasy.  

Each dish was tasty and well-received by all members of our dining party.  They packed up our leftovers at lightning speed, and we went on our merry way, happy and full customers.

** EDIT TO ADD ** Best dish I've tried so far at Tai Chi is the House Special Eggplant - incredible!  Someone else posted a photo if you want to check it out :)
author: Allison B.

description:
ordered take out.

the orange chicken (don't ask why i got it) wasn't that great. tofu/snowpeas/mushrooms was delish, so was the tomato beef chow mein.
author: Ameer N.

description:
food
chow fun = very tastey, not that big prtion, black bean interesting flvor

SERVICE:
good they kept refilling our teapot

ATMOSPHERE
pretty casual

8.17
author: Angela L.

description:
I've been looking for good Chinese delivery in this city for years now - especially since Eric's nor Eliza's deliver. Will definitely order from Tai Chi again!!

The food was fresh and delicious, affordable, and on time.

Walnut Prawns - the dressing came on the side so to not "sog" the fried shrimp.

Sweet & Sour Chicken - nice pieces of meat (not a strangely textured one in the bunch!) and a lighter breading than usual. Complete with onion, green pepper, carrots, and pineapple. Classic S&S Chicken.

Spicy Green Beans - cooked perfectly (not mushy) with a good amount of spice.
author: Jen W.

description:
I'm surprised this place doesn't have better reviews!  It's absolutely the fastest delivery (of anything) in SF.  I've often received my beef with broccoli and spring roles in under 15 minutes and the food is consistently fresh and tasty.  

Also, unlike most Chinese take-out I've tried in SF, there's nothing bad here.  You know the problem, some places can't figure out noodles, some have no idea how to cook beef, and others MSG the hell out of everything.  Tai Chi just rocks day in and day out and it definitely sates your craving.  

The real secret though is to drop by for lunch.  They have a special that's about $6 (with tax) for your favorite dish with soup, tea, and rice.
author: David K.

description: There is bad and then there is Tai Chi.  Ordered grilled salmon and my friend ordered chicken.  His food came a full 15 minutes before mine.  I finally got deep fried salmon that had been frozen.  Dry, horribly greasy.  Waitress did not speak English.  Harsh fluorescent lighting made for a terrible ambiance. The worst meal I have had in years.
author: Kevin M.

description:
My gf got very sick the night after we ate here. Don't know for sure if it was the food, but we can't think of anything else it could have been. She was violently ill for 18 hours and then completely fine the next day.

It gets 2 stars b/c I enjoyed the food and didn't get sick :)
author: Chris  F.

description:
We ordered from this restaurant because we are new in town, and needed someone else to cook one night.

I really, really wanted to like it....but no. Sadly, the dishes were soggy, the meat too fatty, and the sweet and sour sauce a disturbing hot pink color.

The only passable food items were the giant, crispy egg roll, and the fried rice...though even that was bland. 

An hour after we ate, we both got stomach aches. 

I really, REALLY hate writing bad reviews, but this one has to be done.
author: adrienne l.

description:
So places actually charge for rice?  Guess I am just a San Fran Chinese eating rube, because back home on the ranch (NYC) I can't ever, ever recall a main course not automatically coming with rice, unless that dish was made out of noodles. I also can't recall ever paying $11 for a dish of take-out Chinese, but I am willing to learn about your West Coast customs.

My dish was pretty solid & of course I got 2 meals out of it.  Had the House Special Eggplant.  It was a bit on the sweet side, but basil-rific & the shrimp seemed fresh, chicken was plentiful.  Tea tasted particularly good, perhaps because I was wet & freezing.  Staff took my order & then left me alone, much appreciated.

Still can't help feeling like I was duped.
author: Talia R.

description:
Pretty solid.  It took about 45 minutes for delivery.  That's perfectly fine with me since it was pouring rain and I didn't have any umbrellas in the house.

The chicken & almond chow mein was really good.  The added crunch from the almonds was a nice addition.

I ordered the General Tso's chicken after reading so many good things.  I'm sure it's good as far as that type of dish goes, but I think I'm just not a fan of it.  

There are a lot of interesting sounding things on the menu.  I am looking forward to trying more.
author: S. Y.

description:
Mediocrity, delivered.

Yelpers seem to love this place, and I'm almost hesitant to post a review after one bad experience, but I feel compelled to say that this is not fantastic stuff by even my low standards of Chinese cuisine.  

We were in the mood for delivery, so we ordered a wide variety of food - chow mein, sweet chicken, beef, rolls, and everything was just kinda, I don't know, blah.  The noodles were an unusual color, the beef was fatty, the chicken was delicious -- but came cold.

Did I order the wrong stuff?  I'm not likely to order again to find out myself.
author: niero g.

description:
So, I'm up at 9:15pm wanting to order some delivery and what sucks is most places close at 9pm and luckily, Tai Chi opened til 10pm with free delivery!!!!! **heaven lights shine upon me**  Another super bonus was that you can order online!! **angels singing in the background** You KNOW people as lazy as I am appreciate the online ordering especially when you get almost no reception in your apartment.

We ordered the hot and sour hunan soup ($5.50), kung pao shrimp ($9.95), young chow fried rice ($6.95), and the three ingredient seafood chow fun ($7.95)  

Reading the previous reviews, I was expecting the delivery person to be rude dot come but he was quite friendly.  The food also came within 20 minutes. 

Onto the food. ZOMG the hot and sour soup was so perfect!! sometimes it's too sour or what not but this soup was the perfect balance of hot and sour and had a nice hint of the bambooy leek flavor that made me want to go buy a beer bong so i can hot and sour soup bong all of it so I wouldn't have to share.  

The fried rice was so DELISSHHHHHHHH.  It had that perfect flavor of what fried rice should taste like, not too bland but not too MSGish salty.  Also, it had that perfect hint of spiciness because we ordered it hot but it didn't overpower it where I want to drink 10 gallons of milk in 10 seconds.  

OK, but the 3 ingredient seafood chowfun did not do it for me. I mean, I think i just made the mistake of ordering it because I thought it'd be like regular chow fun but it wasn't.  I mean I can appreciate the flavors even if it's not my personal liking, but the chow fun noodles were all stuck together too so it was super, extra bland.  I'll probably never order this off the menu again but I mean their menu is huge and sounds delicious so I'd definitely go back or order delivery again!
author: Anna C.

description:
You can do better.  

DO BETTER.  If your expectations for Chinese food are low, and all you want is some greasy food to coat your stomach after a weekend of boozing, then yes, you can eat here.  It will serve that purpose.  

If you want something that's going to tickle your palette, check out recent Yelp reviews of other venues.  There's got to be someplace within walking distance of your abode that will end in a happier ever-after for your stomach.  

My failing was that I neglected to look at the most recent reviews of this establishment.  Always sort reviews by date!  Restaurants can change a lot over time, and what was great a few years ago may be quite poor now.  

Good luck.
author: Ashley L.

description:
I ordered for delivery & the person that answered the phone was very inexperienced. What a terrible experience. She kept putting me on hold to answer another phone & it was so noisy there she could hardly hear me. The first thing I said was that I wanted to order for delivery but I was looking at an old menu. Meanwhile, I was unaware that it was under new management & a new menu. I ordered the Shanghai spring rolls. She asked me if I wanted the half order of  2 egg rolls unaware that a full order was 4 egg rolls.  I wanted  to order something under the Chef Special. I told her I wanted the #7, " Young Tse River Prawns ."  The Shanghai spring rolls were huge & you get a nice side salad. They were the best egg rolls I've ever tasted. I knew this place was under new management when I opened up the egg rolls box & found 2 mediocre small egg rolls. What a disappointment! Also,  the Young Tse River Prawns as I explicitly ask for instead I got  #7, Salmon w/Asparagus In Black Bean Sauce, from the new menu. It's a good thing we like salmon & asparagus. It was just OK. 
The only good thing was that they give you an abundance of food & the delivery was quick.
author: Lyle C.

description: Tonight I found a cooked thumb-tack in my chow mein. You can see it in photo number 19.
author: Max B.

description: Not a big fan of Chinese food, but this small joint really makes me day-dream about delicious  beef and broccoli, Lemon Chicken, Black bean sauce on tofu, and really good dimsum !The last time I was there, we basically just looked at the page on the menu with pictures and pointed to 3 dishes.  And it was still soooo goooood. You can probaly come here and order anything and it won't let you down. Must try this local Nob Hill secret, but don't tell anyone!
author: Alison F.

description:
What a bummer.  This place always seems to have so much business when I've walked by.  Well, I will never try again.   From first smell of the place, I was turned off.  I wanted to walk right out, but after much decision making, we couldn't turn back now.  The food tasted just as it smelled, greasy.  The meat in the Chow Mein just tasted old while the General Tso's Chicken was dry, hard and crusty.  

Where can I find decent Chinese in this city? I've lived here for more than 5 years now and haven't found anything note worthy from Chinatown to the Sunset.  I just want something FRESH for once.
author: Valerie L.

description:
I've tried a lot of Chinese food places in the city and this is definitely the best I've had. I'm not quite sure what makes it so much better than other places but it's definitely my favorite. I had veggie chow mein, general tso's chicken and egg rolls.  All were amazing....hot, flavorful, crispy.  The chicken was a mix of sweet and spicy.

I was also full after 1 serving and did not go back for more...could that mean no MSG?  Any Chinese place that doesn't leave me hungry after 10 minutes is going to be at the top of my list.

Minus 1 star for the decor...because of it...it literally took me three years to walk in the door and try this place.  Now I don't judge though and I will be back for more...much much more!
author: Gemma S.

description:
Ordered from here about 3 times now. HUGE portions, relatively high quality Chinese food! Quick delivery. :) Super convenient, easy-to-use online ordering with Eat24Hours.com. 

There was a small mistake with my 3rd order, but not a big deal.

Will definitely order from Tai Chi again!
author: Amy D.

description:
Like another reviewer here, I wouldn't even give this ONE star, for the same reasons. They were closed for a good while for remodelling, since a new owner took over. My husband and I have had many excellent meals from there, both eat-in and take-out over the period of years what with living a block and a half away from Tai Chi and we would even go there when we were visiting from elsewhere(we lived out of state for 12 years and then returned). Anyhow, they recently re-opened, and appeared to have the same menu with a few additions. Ever hopeful and glad to see that they finally re-opened, we went there this evening, along with a visiting friend. Such a bad experience with the combo of bad service, bad food and bad ambiance that we cut our meal short after eating the first appetizer, cancelling the rest of the order when the green onion pancakes(which used to be excellent)appeared to be a greasy pile of I don't know what that none of the three of us would touch. Fortunately we were able to get out of there with only having to pay for 2 beers and one appetizer, the "fried prawns" which were greasy and flavorless with an overly sweet sauce that came on the side. The whole experience was so bad that we were RELIEVED to get OUT of there. 
I truly hate to write a bad review of something if it doesn't deserve it, but in this case it deserved it and I did this as a public service.
author: Cara L.

description: Americanized? Whatever.  The salt and pepper prawns are sooooooo good.  The dry braised green beans were cooked perfectly.  This place uses lots of fresh veggies in their dishes, and that in my book makes it great. I am craving more.
author: Eebee H.

description: The service here is pretty terrible, but I've learned to overlook that with many Chinese restaurants.  In this case, there were enough strikes that I can't give the place four stars.  Don't get me wrong though.  The food is very, very good and I would probably eat here again.  I ordered the Curry Seafood Bowl.  It was absolutely delicious and contained huge scallops and a generous serving of various other seafood.
author: Paolo D.

description: Ordered delivery, food was cold when it arrived an hour later. They forgot soy sauce and chopsticks...and also our drinks. Hunan soup was tasteless, dumplings were subpar, as was the fried rice. General Tsao's was decent though. $40 for bad chinese - ouch
author: Douglas S.

description:
I love this place. I get delivery or pick up (the decor is somewhat depressing, so I'm not sure it's a place to eat in at, that said, whatever floats your boat). 

The service is phenomenal. I order online at Market and Taylor and it's ready when I arrive. Stupidly easy, and the food is great, as are their deals. Order on "eat24hours.com" and you'll get a free serve of Gyoza, or spicy chicken wings. Order the Gyoza rather than the wings. The Chef's special Szechwan Minced Chicken is brilliant. I'm about to go pick some up now.
author: Samantha W.

description: I wish I had reviewed my old review because I got the egg rolls again and thought they were terrible.  Everything we ordered was pretty bad across the board.  The noodles were overcooked and the green beans were eh.  They also didn't deliver our food with any sauces, WHAT???  Don't think I'll be going back.  Time to find another spot for take out.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
No MSG!  Hooray for that. 

I have been off Chinese food for more than 10 years.  Hard to believe that living in San Francisco, I have probably eaten chinese a total of 2-3 times over the last 10 years.  Its all because of the use of MSG in so many places.  Even when they say no MSG, I have been made sick after eating from certain places since I am pretty sensitive to it. 

The food was tasty and fresh.  It tasted "clean"...not too salty, not too oily.  Great value for what we got.  2 apps, 2 dishes with tons of good quality meat and seafood for only about $37 including tip! 

Plus there are enough leftovers for almost 2 more meals!!!

Fast and efficient service is a plus.  
Thank you Tai Chi for bringing Chinese food back into my life.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Yes, the home delivery was fast but the food was really pretty awful! The honey walnut prawns were pre-frozen shrimps not prawns. The war won ton soup was so chili hot it was inedible. The velvet chicken was fresh and actually good but by the time I got to it, I had lost my appetite.
I pretty much have decided Thai-Chinese restaurants in general have trouble being focused enough to be good at one or the other.
I really hate to give a bad review, but I hope it gets back to Tai Chi and they improve.
author: Janice P.

description:
Service was really slow.  It seems that they focus on getting to-go orders out first, and then worrying about their customers dining in.  We waited for over 30 minutes for a food.  I am happy to wait 30 minutes in some restaurants...but for Chinese??

Food was not particularly good.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Tai Chi is the best cheap Chinese around Russian Hill Neighborhood.  I love this place.  The food is realiably good, the service is great for take out, deliveries are FAST!  

Price - reasonable

My favorites:

Shanghi Chicken Spring Rolls are the best I've ever had.  your 1 order of $4.50 comes with 2 BIG rolls (inside has vermicelli, minced chicken, mushrooms, carrots etc) and includes two dipping sauces and a side salad.  It's a meal in itself if you're in recession spending mode.

General Tso's chicken supposedly is their #1 dish is pretty much the same as everyone's general chicken, nothing particularly special but I can tell they do not use MSG. 

Chicken with Fresh Basil is very tasty, not too salty and they only use white meat - it also has green beans for texture and red peppers to spice it up.

Lamb curries and other lamb dishes are also very tasty.

Walnut Prawns - delicious as always, crunchy and lightly battered

Note to health conscious folks, they serve BROWN rice, yay!!!
author: Cathryn C.

description: I used to order takeout from this place alot. It's pretty good Chinese food that preserves some of the authentic flavors and culture while nicely blending in flavors that suit American palettes
author: Amy M.

description: Tai Chi has delicious food that tastes way more healthy than all other chinese deliveries I have had. They are prompt and fairly inexpensive. We order the BBQ Pork Fried Rice, General's Chicken an Chicken Egg Rolls. It's really good and only $25. Give it a shot .
author: Chris M.

description: This place use to be great. However since the renovation it went down hill. They have forgotten orders, gotten our order wrong, and generally been disappointing. We are now looking for a new Chinese place. Such a shame as this was out go to, and one of my favorites....
author: sarah r.

description:
I live in Russian Hill so finding good Chinese food is challenging; however, Tai Chi is my favorite restaurant to order delivery from.  

1) Super fast service, generally under 30 min.
2) Delicious food at economical prices

I love their Emperor Chicken salad!  No one makes it like they do, its with fresh greens, nicely portions of shredded chicken and the dressing is divine (There's a kick of horseradish). Many items on their menu is great tasting but recently I've discovered a few menu items that made me take the time to post because it's that good and I have to recommend the:

1)  Smoked Tea Duck.

2)  Spicy Chicken with Fresh Basil (There's also fresh string green beans and red bell pepper with generous pieces of chicken in an addictive spicy sauce).

3)  Garlic Chicken (Again, generous portion of chicken  but roasted garlic, Yum!).

4)  Lemon Chicken  (They actually separate the warm lemon sauce from the crispy chicken so it arrives crispy and you can dazzle yourself).

I have not been disappointed with any experimental orders, the vegetables are fresh and the food is really good so it's a good risk.  ;-)
author: Sheila W.

description: Been eating here for nearly 30 years. What a shock. So disappointing. Generals chicken was sugary and syrupy. They changed the nice chicken chunks and almonds in the chow mein to pounded chicken strips. The Szechwan broccoli was broccoli stalks with the leaves... No florets. Hard to write off a place after so long but that drastic a change to quality is hard to over look. The flavor that you expect and crave just wasn't there. I already wrote this, but it was genuinely disappointing. I feel like it was just another let down in the food industry taking advantage of people's loyalty.
author: Emily A.

description: Ordered broccoli beef and chow mein for delivery. Broccoli was slightly undercooked, chow mein was pretty overcooked, veggies were plain and boiled. $20. Delivery was within the promised window.
author: Travis S.

description: i have been to Tai Chi over a 100 times in past 20 yrs. and was disappointed to see what has become of my favorite Chinese restaurant. The food is not at all the same. The General Tso's Chicken was so overcooked it resembled KFC popcorn chicken. I have had pain in my bowels for two days since my visit. i will miss that yummy General Tso's Chicken at Tai Chi. Service was fine and the restaurant is clean, but the food sucked.  i will never go back.
author: C M.

description: agree  with all of the recent posts -- been going to Tai Chi for 3yrs!  my go-to chinese... went yesterday, thought something was amiss.  all of the comments over the last few days underscore my poor experience..   will try Eliza's next week - i hear good things
author: seth t.

description:
No frills appearance, but a solid menu.  The highlight was the first item in the "house specials" section, an eggplant dish with chicken, shrimp and vegetables in a mildly spicy plum sauce.  Not something I had before but a really nice combination of flavors.  The black bean sauce is very good as was the vegetable chow fun.    

Try the tempura shrimp-stuffed jalapenos.  Good stuff.  

It's a good value, with none of the entrees we ordered costing more than $10 and generous portions.  Overall a more interesting menu than one might expect for this type of restaurant.

Based on some of the reviews it sounds like they may not be the most consistent restaurant in terms of execution, but other than unpolished service, the food was good and not particularly greasy and the bathroom was clean.
author: Adam B.

description: Best Chinese delivery I've found.  Extremely delicious, big portions, and very fast delivery.  Their fried rice, & general tso's chicken, and crab cheese cake are especially good.
author: Jason T.

description:
I LOVE Thai Chi!  It is good, "clean" food.  My favorite thing about this place is that the veggies are always done just right - no soggy broccoli wilting in a puddle of sauce!  I have never eaten in the restaurant...it's in my neighborhood but it's not appealing in terms of ambiance.  It's my #1 choice for delivery, tho.  Hands down my favorite Chinese restaurant in the city.  

Favorite dishes:  Vegetable Fried Rice.  I chose brown rice and it's not what you typically expect of brown rice - it's fluffy, not gummy and there are HUGE chunks of vegetables in it, not diced up little bits.  Tofu & Chinese Vegetables is really good and so is Shrimp with Broccoli and the Braised Green Beans.

Hint:  Order on GrubHub.com and it always comes faster than call-in.
Bonus: If you DO call in, there is always someone who is proficient in English to talk to!
author: Truthie M.

description: So I tried this vegetarian dish with fried tofu, friend gluten bean curd, mushroom, fungus, baby corn, and bamboo shoot ("Lo Han Chat"). It was flavorful but overall mediocre. However, I'm increasing my rating to 3.5 stars because of the great service I received last night. The waitress spoke great English and was friendly and efficient. My food arrived piping hot after a barely noticeable wait, and no one rushed me despite it being 15 minutes to closing. The best part was when the bill came - only $9 total for the aforementioned dish and a side of white rice!
author: Suany W.

description:
Based on all the yelp reviews and the ease of ordering online, I decided to give Tai Chi a shot.  Food was solid, though the hot n sour soup was not the best I've ever had.  Chow mein was good and ruined my table (my fault, not the chow mein's), AND they have brown rice!!  Hell yeah; this way as I'm eating my battered, deep fried, sugar coated meats I can pretend like I'm being healthy or something.
I will totally order from here again.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I love this place and have been coming here for years!!! Amazing Generals chicken, crab wontons, and spicy green beans. Amazing food, great price, hidden gem!!!!
author: Nicole G.

description: What great food!  Wish I would have known about this place the other times I have been in San Francisco.  I will be visiting them again and again.
author: DJ D.

description:
Chow mein - yummy!  Great texture for the noodles and delicious both warm and cold

Black bean beef chow fun - I liked the black bean.  Could be a little bit saucier.  Not good cold.

Crab rangoon - delicious!  Not as small (in quantity and size) that I imagined.

Chicken basil eggplant -  not as greasy as I thought.  Delicious eggplants.  Would've liked it better if the chicken was NOT battered and fried

Sweet and sour chicken -  my brother loved it

Wor wonton soup - tasty and great re-heated over and over again

They've never disappointed me when I order for delivery.  They come on time, I've never had problems with my dishes.  I would definitely order from Tai Chi again!

Their fortune cookies has sucky fortunes though =)
author: Walerz B.

description:
Whoa

i love Tai Chi!  But not tonight.  Im hioping thi8s was a one time fluke.  The beef was not what Im used to.  the pot stickers really sucked.  

The beef is usually very good. Not tonight.
author: Ryan L.

description: Delivery was fast. Food was great. We had Chinese curry, orange chicken, sweet & sour chicken and potstickers. Very very good food. We were all stuffed & happy. They even allow you to ask for paper plates and plastic ware. Would recommend!  They delivered to us at the Ritz Carlton San Fran.
author: Colette M.

description:
I've never written a review before.  Perhaps the food could be better at the restaurant, but the takeout was nothing short of horrible.

Our stomachs hurt and the taste was pasty.
author: Ignacio F.

description:
I went to Tai Chi after reading lots of good reviews. It was a total disappointment. Our food was an abomination. It was greasy and excessively salty. 

I went back and looked at the reviews and it was only when I sorted them by date that it became clear. Most of the recent reviews are one or two stars. So that's a lesson to us - always sort by date.
author: Joe M.

description:
They have the fastest delivery service in San Francisco.  I think the chef cooks in the car en route to my house.  I was hungover today and I didn't want to go out.  Went on yelp to see what was good for delivery.  Tai Chi popped up and I wanted to give them a try.  The only reason why they get 5 stars is because the delivery is very very fast.  I was groggy and I needed some food quick.

General tso's chicken is the best..........everything else was just so so.

potsticker............too doughy ( san tung is still the best in this dept.)

chicken and brocolli.......brocolli was a little too done but tasted good

Chow mein.........nothing special to talk about. I've had better

General tso's chicken rocks

I'm still surprised how fast the food got to my house.  I don't think I could've done it any faster if I picked up the food.  My fellow yelpers weren't lying when they mention their quick response time.  A great cure for a hangover!!!
author: jason g.

description:
The spring rolls at Tai Chi are so big and long- if I were single, I'd date them.  But they always come so quickly!  Okay, that was lame, but I couldn't resist.  Anyways...  You get two gigantic ones per order.  They were okay, but not great.  They contained carrots, which I associate with lumpia and glass noodles, which I associate with Southeast Asian rolls.  I thought the sweet and sour sauce was nice, but the vinegar had some weird taste/smell.

I love their seasonal asparagus dishes.  They don't overcook the asparagus at all.  I couldn't do any better myself.

The General's chicken is pretty good.  I'm a huge fan of sweet, syrupy fried chicken dishes.  The quality of Tai Chi's isn't ideal, but it's as good as you're gonna get these days.  Very few nasty bits.

I love that they have brown rice 'cause Boyfriend is on a diet and will eat little else.
author: Lauren C.

description:
These guys deliver the best Chinese I've had.  Hot, fresh, tasty and arrives (at our place, around the corner) in under 15 minutes.

They're in the Michelin Guide and they deserve it.

Try the dry braised green beans -- to die for.
author: Ari G.

description:
My chinese of choice:

a. best quality and flavor for the price.
b. a really lovely eggplant special (with chicken, shrimp, fresh basil, etc) and trust me, I know eggplant.
c. they'll happily make any dish for you- just ask. I got an off-the-menu, perfectly cooked string bean and garlic sauce dish that was mighty tasty.
d. the best delivery service EVER- patient, friendly, polite, easy to understand phone people and super quick delivery.  
e. and yeah, the General Tso's kicks ass. order it now. 
f. now i said!!

disclaimer- if you want a cool, ambiance-rich restaurant, don't go here. The restaurant is small and stark. go here, or better yet, order delivery, if you're like me- more about the food than the glitz.
author: Britt W.

description:
Been coming here for over 20 years.

  Hands down, the BEST 'General's Chicken.' There is no point ordering it in any other restaurant. I stopped trying because it just ticked me off when some lame, bland chicken dish showed up and I'd be pining for Tai Chi's version. Get that, a Coke, the dry braised green beans, steamed rice & pot stickers to start - done. Astoundingly perfect meal.

  Years ago, I had friends razz me mercilessly for another choice of (their words: bak gwai / gwai lo - "white ghost" / poseur) Chinese restaurant but all was forgiven when they tried the General's Chicken here on my recommendation. Killer, killer food.
author: Dustin M.

description:
4 stars with 250+ reviews can't be all that bad, right? Well thanks again Yelp... you have found us a winner!

Ordered online through their website, was given a wait time of 45-60 minutes and it arrived at almost exactly 60 minutes. Not too shabby!

There was a LOT more food than we expected. We ended up ordering enough for 4 people when we only needed half of that. And for less cost than we would normally pay for 2 regular sized plates of food.

Pretty good selection of vegetarian dishes too. Eggrolls were a disappointment, but the pancakes were delicious! The veggie chow mein was very good, the hot & sour soup was good and *amazingly* really warm (had to use oven mitts to pour it), the mu shu was pretty good, but the crepes fell apart instantly when they touched the food.

The only caveat I have is that after I finished eating, I spent a good amount of time in the restroom. But I can't be certain it was from the food, so I am not going to let it affect my review here. But noted just in case.
author: K. C.

description: 2007: I have been eating here on since college and the General Tsaos Chicken is the best anywhere (crispy with brown suger, garlic and spice). Also try the string beans. There are several jewels in SF, and this is one of them. I can name about 20 places with one dish each, and there is no where better to get the Tsos anywhere. Believe me, I've tried. Its even better cold the next day. And don't knock it until you've tried it. I'm not a fan of cheap wine, but you can get a carafe for about $10. if you're into that. Beware, the parking is the worst, but you can grab a spot on the corner for about $5-10 depending on the night.
author: Adam X.

description:
LOVE Tai Chi.  LOOOOVE Tai Chi.

Lightening fast delivery (I believe their record is under 10 mins from hanging up the phone to my door).  Cheap.  GOOD.  What more can you ask for?  I eat here nearly weekly and have been raving about it for years.

You do need to know what to order, as some things are mediocre.  When you hit one the good ones though, it's near impossible to beat this place.  Shanghai chicken spring rolls (best I've ever had, esp. with the vinegar), hot and sour soup, mu shi, mixed vegetable deluxe, Mandarin Velvet chicken, General Tsuo's chicken (when I'm feeling decadent), steamed veggies and tofu (when I'm feeling ascetic) are all fantastic.
author: Jenny S.

description: My husband wanted a fish. You know, those whole fish on a plate with scales and all? Frankly I think this is a disgusting habit of his but I said fine, as long as they deliver. So came our fish and my Hunan chicken. Fish good, chicken ok, fast delivery great. I would order again.
author: Drea L.

description:
DELICIOUS - and not too greasy at all!

When I have Chinese food I always feel like that judge on Iron Chef, you know the one who has the exact same response to literally every single dish she tries, "hm, I like it, but, it's a bit, oily, I think." Then when she finally tries something that isn't oily, Martin Yan responds with, "hey good job, this is the first time she hasn't said that this isn't too oily!"
