Anyhow, that's what Martin Yan would be saying in my response to this delivery. It really wasn't oily at all and the sauces were all delectable. We had the General Tsao's shrimp - MMM. The Veggie Chow Mein - MMM, surprisingly good! The Veggie Delight - finally a flavorful sauce on a normally bland dish! And best part of all, their Hot and Sour soup ROCKS. It's exactly the flavors you crave when you want Hot and Sour soup.

After trying other spots around the area, there is no need to search anymore, this will be our go to spot for sure.
author: Abby Z.

description:
I have been coming here for 20 years, easy.
This place has been consistantly delicious, and consistancy is key, for any restaurant. Fresh Fish, different sauces, very nice staff.
the ONLY thing I have to say, and it is important, is that the chicken in the "Generals Chicken" dish, which is thier siganture dish,  is  becoming very scant. I have noticed this change,  this past year. Very little chicken and alot of breading. So that needs to be addressed.  I don't mind eatting high carbs once and a while but its getting a little heavy. Other than that............yum ! 
One other thing, I wish they would serve..Chinese Broccoli !
Thank you Tai Chi for the hangover cures, the rainy sundays, and the lonely lunches where you have made me feel at home.
author: MaryAnn S.

description: My favorite Chinese place. Why not 5 stars? Taste has been too hit or miss and the recipes have changed (switched from dark meat to white meat in their chicken fried rice). Had them 2 days ago they seemed to be back on track, but still miss their old prep.
author: Antonio G.

description:
Eh.  Food was plentiful and delivery was quick.  Other than that , nothing special.  The spinach in my soup tasted as though it wasn't washed (eww) and the broth was really bland.  Decent egg rolls, extra crispy just like I like 'em.

Can someone please PM me with the name of some good Chinese delivery to Nob Hill?  Thanks!
author: phil h.

description:
I know the MSG era is over, but it's hard to believe when you discover the addiction that is Tai Chi.  Just when I think I've mastered my cravings, I find I've dialed in again.  

Like a friendly neighborhood dealer, my teenage delivery boy shows up in 10 minutes with my latest obsession -- General Tso's, Szechuan Minced Chicken or Beef & Asparagus.  

Chinese Food Eaters Anonymous, anyone?
author: Nicole G.

description:
I'm writing this as I scarf down a plate of food... 

I have officially found thee BEST Chinese food place in San Francisco! 

I decided to use them to cater lunch for my office after reading great reviews on Yelp about how delicious their food is. The previous times I've catered Chinese was from Jade Cafe and Shiso, the first one failed and Shiso was eh.... However, this place, from the moment Joe (staff member) walked in the door with 2 boxes of the food, I knew we were in for a treat. The smell was... AHHHH Mazing! Here's what we ordered: 

Steam Rice 
Pork Fried Rice 
Broccoli Beef 
Orange Peel Beef 
String Bean Chicken 
Kung Pao Chicken 
Mixed Veggies 
Tofu and Eggplant 
Vegetable Egg roll 
Vegetable Dumplings 

All of it, every single dish, was yummy! My favorite was the Orange peel beef and the monstrous egg rolls! Oh! I cannot say enough! 

Also, for those of you who are responsible for catering for your office, the cost for 2 trays of each dish which was ordered for 40 people came out to $430 with tip&tax. That's really cost effective @ $10.75 per person. And, BTW, people are coming to me now and telling me how kick ass the food is... so yeah it speaks for itself.
author: Eclectic C.

description:
Tai Chi was pretty damn good take-out.  If you don't want to get your lazy ass out of the house, then you should definitely call Tai Chi.  Great Chinese! I ordered the combo chow mein, beef fried rice, garlic chicken, and sweet and sour pork.  It was all really good, the only thing i may change up is the garlic chicken--it was good, but not great.  

Also, they deliver pretty timely compared to other places (about 45 mins.) and they got the order entirely correct!  Good price and quality.
author: Danielle J.

description:
Eriely fast delivery... but over all the food was just okay. I ordered crab rangoon, curry chicken and Mongolian lamb. The crab rangoon was the highlight of the meal but the curry was pretty bland and the Mongolian dish wasn't spicy.

*If you are going to give this place a shot checkout the 20% discount they offer if you order through delivery.com
author: Thel D.

description:
So far so good! Again, an east coaster here... was craving some General Tso's chicken! 
This place is the best so far!! Order of General Tsao's and Rice came to under $10. 
Food was pretty damn good, nice and crispy, thick sweet and spicy sauce. 

The funky bleach/dirt mop water smell is what killed it for me. Packed up my food, and brought it home... still sooo good tho!!!

Now if I can only find a Chinese restaurant that is as good as anything in CT, NY, or NJ?! Anyone wanna go in business with me? LOL

If anyone knows where to get the fat egg rolls from (NY STYLE?) stuffed with roast pork and cabbage and other ancient Chinese secrets.... let me know!
author: Matthew Z.

description: I really love Tai Chi.  My favorite is their General Tso's Chicken.  And the portions are plentiful!
author: Flo S.

description:
O, sad day
A trusting dog, led astray
Help...
Yelp...
Why do your 4-stars so betray?

We tried Tai Chi for the first (and last) time yesterday.  I'll give it one star for arriving hot, and one for the restaurant name.  The scallion pancakes were something else... deep fried sheets of noodle stuff with no scallion flavor.  The potstickers were doughy and flavorless.  The General Tso's was pleasantly spicy, but really sweet, and came with none of the usual broccoli that provides some break from the fried chicken grease.  The Mu Shu pork was the best thing we ordered, but by the time I tried it, I was so sad, it couldn't possible have changed my opinion about anything.  I even threw away the leftovers, as I couldn't bear seeing them again today.

I hate being a negative voice, but that's how it is sometimes.  Alas.
author: Joshua B.

description:
I got turned on to this place by local that saw me wandering around chinatown looking for a place to eat.  By far  THEE best Chinese food I've had. I hit this place whenever I'm in SF...you can have a huge belly expanding feast for under $20 for 2 people.

I dream of General Tso's Prawn's
author: Edgar R.

description:
I waited to order from here a few times before writing a review because I was so uninspired the first time around.

It also took three attempts before I could finally sample the Tempura Shrimp Stuffed Jalapeno.  They had been tempting me ever since I first saw them on the appetizer menu, but whenever I placed an order for delivery, Tai Chi was sold out.  Maybe they need a new kitchen manager.  Worth the wait, they reminded me of a better variation on the bar-fare mainstay, the jalapeno popper.

I would avoid any of their salads.  I tried both the Tea Smoke Duck and the Seaweed Roman salad, but neither impressed. The Seaweed Roman salad in particular was bland.  Tai Chi would be better off sticking with the seaweed salad standard.

I also tried the Pumpkin Chicken, looking for some new flavors, and I would comfortably recommend it to anyone. At the same time, it's not going to be a new favorite.

I still haven't tried any of the prototypical Chinese delivery items (like General Tso's favorite), and I may upgrade my Tai Chi rating when I do.  For now the restaurant's attempts at culinary creativity haven't wowed me.  My estimation is Tai Chi has fast delivery and good enough food.
author: Ben B.

description: Not so great these days.   And always good to check the SF Department of Public Health food scores, for any food place: http://dph-extranet2.sfdph.org:7777/pls/eeop_htmldb/f?p=132:1:4457519519677560::NO:::
author: H. G.

description:
Well, I've found my new Chinese delivery place. The name is Tai Chi and it's delicious.

After slugging through plenty of other sub-par options, I feel I'm somewhat qualified to call the General Tsao's chicken here some of the best in the city (for delivery, at least). Salt and pepper chicken is also excellent, as is the chow mein. I'm actually not a big fan of their pot stickers, but that's certainly not a sticking (get it?!?!?!) point.

Delivery is usually pretty fast, and you can order online through delivery.com -- another score for the social introverts!
author: Chris M.

description: We were starving after partying all New Years Eve and into the following afternoon but even in our state, we were not able to enjoy the food. The Lemon Chicken seemed like it was made out of wood chips, the Braised Green Beans were discolored and fatigued beyond recognition. The chicken dish with basil (forget the name) was almost edible but the chicken tasted strange and I could feel the onslaught of MSG that it brought on. The one saving grace was the Pork Chow Mein, which was edible- the pork tasted fresh, which is not always the case with Chow Mein dishes. We also got Veg Fried Rice which was edible as well, this dish wasn't offensive- that's probably because it tasted like nothing. Delivery was pretty quick- about 35 minutes.
author: Gosia L.

description: Had been a long time since I last went here and I recalled excellent General Tsao Chicken.  My memory was correct.  This item is rendered stupendously at this establishment.  Big quality pieces of mostly white meat, not too heavily breaded, perfect sweet-to-spice ratio, and nice portion.  Also had oyster beef with broccoli and pork fried rice (lots of pork in here), both very nice.  Cost $13 per person, was reasonable for the enjoyment.  Fortune cookie was not the best quality, but will still in the upper echelon.
author: Marc S.

description:
It's always nice to come back to San Francisco because the Chinese food is absolutely unbelievable! The generic fried meats and sauces go right out the window and suddenly I am introduced to a world of freshness and authenticity that is deeeelicious!

Tai Chi does a good job of putting together some consistently flavorful dishes. It's always crowded every day of the week, so that defintiely validates their cooking. My favorite dish is Curry Lamb that blends the perfect amount of curry with tender lamb and zucchini and onions. Over white rice, it is heaven!
author: Christina N.

description:
Yummy!  Fast delivery!

The spinach and bean curd soup is less than desirable, but the Red Eggplant is magnificent.

Look for their valpak coupons if you live in the neighborhood because its definitely an added bonus to get the dumplings : )
author: Lindsay T.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos was closed for a private event so Tai Chi seemed like a very reasonable consolation prize.  So disappointed that it didn't live up to my memory.  

The service was really lousy.  The food, except for the green beans was only ok.  We ordered smoked pork, pumpkin chicken and those awesome beans.  

One word summary: meh.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Very good "chinese" food, with quick delivery. Somewhat greasier than 
I would like, but always, consistently good. Stupid cheap lunch menu.
I couldn't really wish for a better neighborhood Chinese spot.
author: Max R.

description:
The main reason to pick Tai Chi is consistency.  The food always arrives in under 30 mins, is always hot, and always tastes like it did the last time you had it.

Sure some of the dishes aren't the greatest, but for American-style Chinese in the vicinity of Polk St, nothing beats it.
author: Chris C.

description:
This may be the only 5 star rating I will ever give!  This place has the best General Tsuo's Chicken ever ( I think the sprinkle coke on it)!  The rest of their dishes are outstanding as well.

Portions are big and delivery is very fast.  They just had a price increase, but they are still very reasonable.  If you live in the area, this MUST be your go-to Chinese delivery.
author: Steve M.

description: Great General Tsao's chicken and mediocre beef dish.  I heard they were great back in their hay days but have since fallen by the wayside.  The restaurant also lacks atmosphere but it's a hole in the wall Chinese restaurant so I didn't really care.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
Tai Chi = Most irrelevant name ever

BUT, they've got killer dishes that make em' my most favorite Chinese place to hit up in the city. Now I'm usually not much of a fan of fried foods, but what really made me reconsider, is Tai Chi's Deep Fried Drumsticks that come w/ a side of sweet & sour sauce and makes my stomach sing! Other tummy pleasers are their Chicken Chow Mein w/ slivered almonds (YUM!) and their General Tso's Chicken. I ordered these 2 to-go recently and they lasted me for at least another 4-5 meals! Hot damn.

Their free delivery service doesn't hurt either.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
The food is the best Chinese I've had through GrubHub delivery (have made a few dozen orders the past year from around 10 Asian places). The Mongolian Beef is really good... (the savory/spicy style rather than the sweet style) as is the classic Gen Tso's Chicken. The chow mein options are also great... my fave is the Almond Chicken version. The plastic bag says no MSG, but there is so much umami going on that I don't know if I believe them... don't really care either way... it's delish (and I LOVE MSG). The delivery guys are pretty nice too. Second time I ordered from them I missed the delivery b/c I was in the shower and they came 30 mins ahead of schedule. Both the driver and restaurant tried calling me at home and on my cell and left messages. When I finally got a hold of the driver he offered to return to the restaurant and redeliver. When he showed up I was apologetic and he just said "no problem" ... doubled his tip for the trouble. The low threshold for free delivery ($12) is another reason to love this place. My prior favorite Asian delivery (Feng Shui) raised theirs from $10 to 15 recently. Boo. Tai Chi is my new go-to delivery restaurant. 

Their fortune cookies have unusual fortunes. My favorite so far is "You have a charming way with words. Send an email to a friend." lol
author: Shawn C.

description:
Got this delivered to my house and $40 later I was thinking that I should've ordered pizza instead.  Once I got my order, I didn't know that I had to tell them to provide utensils and napkins.  Wouldn't they do that anyway?  It's a delivery order!

Anyways, here's what I ordered:
Salt & Pepper Shrimp - Not bad, but when it's not super fresh, the shell-on shrimp isn't crunchy and it becomes hard to chew through.  Note to self, never order this delivered and eat this at the restaurant.

Beef Fried Rice - Living next to China town, I've definitely experienced better.  The beef slices were huge in this fried rice.  No depth at all...

Hunan General Tso's Chicken - Best item from yelp reviewers, I don't think so...  I've had better flavored chicken dishes from Panda Express!
The chicken wasn't soft and flavorful.  The chunks had way too much fat on it and some pieces were so hard to chew though again!  Probably an item better served in the restaurant as well.

Hot & Sour Soup - Best item that I ordered!!!  Great flavor and super hot!  Just the way I like it.  Awesome amount of egg and mushrooms!  A+ for this!  If I ever ordered from here again, it would only be the soup!!!

Anyways, 2 STARS for this place as it does read "Meh. I've experienced better."  And that I have.  My personal experience from delivery from here isn't a good one.  Others have had better experiences, lucky for them!
author: Limzer L.

description:
Ahhh, Tai Chi.

Good memories with this place when I lived in SF for two years.

I'd recommend it for nights where you don't have time to cook and just want a hearty Chinese meal.  It's not classically done - if you put Panda Express and a Classic Chinese restaurant in a blender, you'd get Tai Chi.

Reliable, quick service (they deliver within 15 minutes - what the hell?)
and flavorful (sometimes too much)...

Enjoy!
author: Nelson W.

description: Have ordered form here a couple times recently. The prices are too high and the quality of the food has gone downhill. The pot stickers and the Generals Chicken are not worth the high prices. I am disappointed since this place use to have my favorite Chinese dish. I won't be back.
author: Kenny J.

description:
This place is definatly a cut above your average neighborhood "Chinese" restaurant (I use the term sparingly because my best friend lives with a Chinese lady and let me tell you, you won't be finding the food she cooks on the menu). The portions are fair as are their prices. Everyone raves about the General Tsao Chicken and I have to agree with them. I prefer most of their fried rice dishes as opposed to their chow mein. The noodles are usually just a tad too greasy for me (this is all about taste mind you; I mean, I'm not exactly coming here to eat for my health you know?).

Oh yeah and I give the staff credit for taking my order 15 minutes before closing one night and having a lively conversation with my drunk ass while I was waiting for my to go order to be ready. This all started because I walked the wrong direction on Polk one night foreging for food. But that's a whole other story...
author: Veronica G.

description:
Finally, a place where I can get 'old' style General Tso's chicken. By this, I mean full of fatty goodness and not stir fried. I've missed this kind of Chinese food. I know it's not good for me, but I really didn't care as I stuffed my face last night. 

This place delivered fast--so fast that we were shocked when the knock came at the door. Food was hot and tasted really good. We got crab cheese cakes--AKA crab rangoon--very good, smaller than the same thing at Ho's, but actually tasted like crab. (vs. Krab). They had very tasty brown rice--seemingly a rarity around SF. We also got the hot and sour--which did have quite a few tofu cubes, so don't worry too much about that. Pretty sour, not quite as hot, but tasty.

Negatives? Well, I can't quite put my finger on it. It wasn't the best I've ever had, but it's definitely one of the better Chinese experiences I've had lately. Better than Ho's, better than Brandy Ho's, better than Tsing Tao, better than Bamboo...I guess that I'd recommend Tai Chi without hesitation, but maybe mention that it's a bit over the top and let the person figure out what that means!

12/20/08--UPDATE. Ordered again last night and it was rather disappointing. Had the worst chow mein I've ever eaten. Got the combo chow mein and it was repulsive. We actually threw it away it was so bad. The meat, if you can call it that was fatty and odd tasting. Not at all what I was expecting. I'd rather have Ho's house special chow mein any day. Also tried the shrimp stuffed jalapenos. It is actually exactly what I expected but not really all that tasty. I guess I'll stick to general tso and crab rangoon.
author: Denise L.

description:
Wandering up Polk Street in search of chinese food, this spot stuck out as a potentially goodie.  I'm still waiting on Rincon Hill to gain some restaurants that are both affordable and open in the evenings and weekends, so I often hop on Muni to see what I can find in other San Francisco neighborhoods for dinner.  Anyway .... the menu offers a nice selection of spicy chinese dishes. 

I ordered the mongolian lamb, and it came out of the kitchen very quickly - delicious! A generous portion for $9.50, and it was flavored very nicely. 

Brown rice for $1 was wonderful - I'm going to have to go brown more often.

Diet Coke was only $1.25 for a can - a fair value in my opinion.

My companion (wink) ordered a seafood chow fun - it was also pretty good, though a little "sloppy" - wet and hard to maneuver.  Still, two pretty darn good dishes.  I'll definitely keep this place on my short list for days when I'm near Russian Hill and I feel like Miller's East West Deli may be a little too much sandwich for the time.
author: Jamie W.

description:
My new favorite place for cheap, greasy, bad-day-at-the-office Chinese food. The food is really pretty good, prices are low, staff is friendly and helpful, and it's never crowded enough to have to wait. Their veggie to meat ratio is great, not like some places that give you a few chunks of chicken and eight heads of broccoli. Try the Mongolian beef - it's amazing. 

Only drawback is their take-out/delivery tastes nothing like what you get when you eat in. I was pretty disappointed.
author: Beth M.

description:
First time customer, tried the Kung Pao Chicken. Good spice, heavy on the peanuts (which I like) and in general, good flavor. Not something that left me floored, but easily something I could enjoy more than once. All in all, food was probably a 3.5.

Service was super quick, though, and for that they get nudged to the 4th star.
author: Chris C.

description:
Awesome combo: bold flavors, huge portions (sometimes the containers don't even close!) and quick, friendly service makes Tai Chi the best bet for Chinese delivery around these parts.

I like the shrimp with braised green beans and the pot stickers. YUM. and the fried rice is so cheap--under $5.
author: Macheeks ..

description:
Having lived in San Francisco and then Novato for 17 years before moving east in 2000, my favorite "good eats" restaurant is Tai Chi. It helped that I lived on Lombard about a 15 minute walk from this place.

I remember Herb Caen's review of General Tso's chicken and from the first bite, to the last bite I had a few years ago when visiting, I was in dreamland. Simply the best. Service is always quick. I have never had a dish that I was disapointed with. Portions were always very generous, and usually enough for leftovers the next day.

Now living in South Florida I can only dream of this oasis on Polk. When I had friends visit me from out of town, I would take them on the wharf, twin peaks, GG Park and elsewhere tour..but the last part of the tour was when I would tell them that they are about to taste the best Chinese food they ever had. And you know what...no one ever disagreed.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Oh thank god. Finally a chinese restaurant that serves flavourful food and not some deep fried gunk that most chinese restaurants pass on as 'chinese'.
The spicy shantung beef kicks ass. Period.I love you!
author: Roshomon P.

description:
Delivery is very quick and convenient.  I work at the Wharf, and I've ordered food from here at least a dozen time.  They are very accurate on the delivery time, if not ahead of schedule.  

The food is always still very hot upon delivery.  Just be sure to ask for plates and utensils if you need, they don't generally provide unless asked.
  
As for food, I love their pot stickers.  The dough is nice and chewy, and they are stuffed with a good amount of meat and veggies.  Definitely use their sweet chilli garlic sauce that they provide for dipping.  Screw all those other places that just give you soy sauce.  Tai Chi's special sauce is the best!

Get the Chicken Corn Soup as mentioned by my fellow Yelpers.  It's nice and thick with corn, egg, and chicken.  Definitely very reasonable size for the price.  

Try the Tung-An Chicken.  It's sauteed, in a spicy garlic saice with zucchini.  Chicken is always cooked perfectly, nice and tender.  

It's nice to have a Chinese restaurant that serves brown rice now a days. Definitely take advantage of it while enjoying Chinese food.  You are getting enough grease from everything else, you don't need to add to your gaining weight by eating white rice.  While I'm Chinese and love my rice, I love my health more! Balance your meal with brown rice. 

Simply stated, Tai Chi is GREAT for deliveries.
author: Cass J.

description:
Super good, super fast, and reasonable! 

Cashew Chicken and Shrimp fried rice were good. I'd order them again.

Their version of pot stickers were just OK. 

All in all worth looking into.
author: Amber F.

description:
I wish I could give them 4 and a half stars because this is honestly the best Chinese I've found in the city so far, but it wasn't quite perfect, I've had better in other states.

I was definitely impressed though, after going through about 6 or 7 Chinese Restaurants in the area, the food I got from Tai Chi's was piping hot on delivery, surprisingly un-greasy for Chinese, and delicious.  

Crab Rangoons, which they amusingly had listed as "Crab Cheese Cake" was very good, came with some tasty Sweet and Sour sauce.  Not as jam-packed as I'd prefer, but had some nice chunks of fresh crab in there.

Vegetarian Spring Rolls were tasty, not the least bit greasy.

General Tso's was pretty mouth-wateringly savory.  Just the right amount of sauce, great blend of flavors, I've had some that come out too sweet, and you can't eat too much without getting sick.  Not the Tso's here, it was pretty amazing.  It's just straight chicken though, some restaurants I've eaten at had actual peppers cooked in, and the Chicken sat on a bed of broccoli, I like having the Veges to cut the flavor, but still one of the best I've had.

My fiancee had the Mu Shi Vegetables, which she liked a lot, I snuck a few bites.  They are a little stingy with the rolls, and they fell apart a little easily, but good otherwise.

Only other real complaints is that they kind of skimp you on the usual goodies you get in your delivery bag.  Absolutely no Soy Sauce, no Fortune Cookies, no utensils, chopsticks or Fortune Cookies.

Definitely recommend them, they are my go to restaurant for urgent Chinese Food delivery from now on.
author: Tyler D.

description:
Pls notice the newspaper article in the front window.  My dad whom is an uber food snob noticed this and said let's go in.  It was a Saturday afternoon and I have never eaten better.  WHO cares if the walls are bare, not I!  We had the beef w/ bamboo and mushrooms.  It was as though we had a wee bamboo tree in our plate and also the spicy shrimp.  I  am loving life along w/ the steamed dumplings.  Oh my god, orgasmic.  GO, this was sooo fine, I have never had better.  Also was we walked out I pointed out to my dad that the article of praise was dated 1980...  Good things always last!!

Just as an update 12/03/07.  Had the general Tso chicken and let me tell you, OMG my socks we knocked off!!!!  Fried yummy deliciousness along w/ the green beans and prawns.  If there is a heaven, pls serve these dishes!!
author: Nicole F.

description:
I've been eating at this restaurant for 7 years now and I try and go as often as possible.  I was lucky enough to be taken here by a friend who lived in the neighborhood and i've been hooked ever since!  With my continued business i've seen it grow in size and stature, evidence of its success.  Now that they've expanded into the business that was next door (knocked a wall down) there is a good amount of seating and the decor has improved immensily.  The staff is pleasant and quick, you won't go hungry for too long at Tai Chi.

Now the food.  The General's Chicken, Sizzlin' Shrimp on the hot plate and Beef & Broccoli are my favorites.  The General's chicken is famous here and can be spiced up if you ask.  Nearly everything i've tried on the menu has been delectable and the best part, it is very inexpensive.  I take family, friends and any visitors I have in SF to this restaurant.  Awesome!
author: Joel S.

description:
Average food, but fine in a pinch, as long as you order carefully.

The pretty good: walnut prawns, prawns with asparagus, veggie chow mein (although I'd like thinner noodles, the veggies were fresh and good!), brown rice, hot and sour soup

The bad: spicy eggplant (so much oil I felt like I was drinking it), chicken with vegetables -- veggies okay, but the chicken was awful and scared me far far away from ordering any meat here except the prawns, the wonton soups are kind of gross
author: Melissa G.

description: I was recommended Tai Chi for delivery and decided to try it out for myself.  The delivery is free after a minimum $15 order, so ordering it for an individual meal will be too much.  The food is very fresh and delectable compared to other Chinese restaurants in the area, and you can really taste the technique and freshness of each bite.  The only downfall is that in delivery, please remember to order a side order of rice, as what you order is exactly what you get.
author: Min P.

description:
Yelpers giving this restaurant less than three stars are ordering the wrong dishes! Here is a complete $25 meal that feeds 3-4 ppl that will arrive at your door in less than 30 minutes:

- General Tso's Chicken
- Chicken Corn Soup
- Any Vegetables with Garlic Sauce
- White or Brown Rice

Corn Soup is perfect for cold & foggy weather. General Tso's Chicken is frightfully addicting!

Online ValPak coupon will get you a free seaweed salad or eggroll or steamed dumpling! http://www.valpak.com/coupons/display/TAICHIRESTAURANT/94109/820303/819326
author: Desiree O.

description:
Definitely try the Almond Chicken Chow Mien.  Tai Chi is great for delivery if you live in the area.  They are quick and at a good price.  I think that my favorites (aside from the aforementioned Chow Mien) is the Fried Rice and the Shredded Pork in Brown Sauce.

It's just solid Chinese food for the neighborhood.
author: Brian L.

description: We have been going to Tai Chi since 1982. While the decor isn't great the food, service and friendly staff more then make up for appearances. We made a reservation for 14 last night when we flew in and our kids drove up to meet us for a family reunion and of course we all met at Tai Chi for the best dinner ever. We shared dishes from vegetarian to sizzling beef....all delicious. Parking is always a challenge but that's just San Francisco.
author: Rosemary L.

description:
Beware! The general's chicken gave me food poisoning. It might have been just a bad piece of chicken. The food tasted very artificial.

The food arrived on time though. One star for that!
author: Jin J.

description:
This is the best general chicken is San Francisco. 
Texture, spices and portion size are just right. 
I would order take-out, unless it's late at night .
author: Joe C.

description:
I last ate at Tai Chi's over 20+ years ago. And it's still here and popular as ever.  That says something about this restaurant in our City where there's a lot of options to choose from. I actually ate here again in January and enjoyed my order. And I didn't wait long at all for my order.

I had the popular General Tsao's Chicken which had a flavor of it's own and better than at other restaurants for the same dish. A little sweetness to it. The pot stickers were major plump/huge and cooked just right, crispy fried on one side in watered pan. No grease. I had the Moo Shu Beef. And I ordered Moo Shu Vegetarian to go for a friend. Both of us enjoyed our Moo Shu. I only wish they gave more of those roll up pancakes, because of the generous helping of Moo Shu. This is one of the few places that serves Moo Shu that's not just pork.  And Tai Chi's menu has a lot more to offer/order in it's selection.

Well, I won't wait another 20 years to go back to Tai Chi's. I will definitely go back to try other things on the menu. I do remember having onion cakes from way back and that was still on the menu. That's a dish from another region of China. Tai Chi's has quality food, a wide selection, and at reasonable prices. Really worth trying out, if you haven't already. 

Easy to park in the area during the day. Am sure it's more difficult to find parking at night, being so close to Broadway and the trendy spots of that area of Polk Street. They do offer take-out/pick up orders and do deliveries.
author: Roger S.

description:
OK. Just finished another WICKED sampling of one of my favorite (and always cheapest) Chinese food joints in SF!  The food is always soooo hot and just right.  You always get MOUNTAINS of food and fresh vegetables and ingredients in all of their dishes. 

I DREAM ABOUT THIS PLACE!  

The speed of the delivery guys is almost unnatural but how can't you love that?!?  If you want Super cheap, really good and some of the best Chinese food on the hill, check this place out.

*Sometimes the Almond Chicken Chow Mein has like 3 cubes of chicken and other times it's aaaaaall chicken, but whatever the dish still rocks :)
author: Patrique R.

description: Back down to a 3 because their soups were disappointing. Their fried rice is still amazing but their meat dishes were unspectacular. Oh... that fried rice. Order it extra spicy and you'll get so much crushed pepper that the rice will take on a crunchy texture of fried goodness. The day after is another issue as all that pepper starts to leave your body with revenge.
author: Dominic C.

description: The food was a solid 3-stars, but I give it 4 for good service and giving us a TON of food for a great price. We did the set meal at $14.50 per person.... SO MUCH FOOD. We had like 3 meals worth to take home afterward... soup, giant egg rolls, 2 beef dishes, 2 seafood dishes, a chicken dish, and probably other things I didn't even get to! Sooooo much fooooood (I felt the need to say it again). I'd go back when hungry.
author: Katie B.

description:
There are many things I don't understand in this world.  Like how my rice got infested with little bugs or why American Gladiator is on TV.  Another mystery is why Tai Chi has so many good reviews.  I ordered delivery for 10 people in the office on a Friday night, and they were very prompt (within 30 minutes) and didn't forget anything and the food was hot.  But it just wasn't very good.  The chow mein was kind of mushy, the pancakes for the mu shu didn't look like they had been cooked, and some of the dishes weren't that flavorful.  The veggie spring rolls were good though.

Really, though, I was at work at 8 pm on a Friday and just wanted something to eat fast, so I guess Tai Chi fit the bill.  And they gave us a free calendar.
author: Gina K.

description:
Tai Chi is a rarity in San Francisco - a reasonably priced, authentic restaurant in a well-trafficked area. The Szechwan style tofu was great, very spicy but not overpowering. The hot and sour soup was delicious, they didn't skimp on egg, tofu, or mushroom. The Vegetable Chow Mein was also very good, especially the noodles - tender and cooked to perfection. 

The waitstaff was very nice and attentive, even on a busy Saturday night. The restaurant is not too upscale, but ambiance doesn't really make the food taste any better :)

The biggest surprise was when the bill came - it was so inexpensive! 3 people ate many dishes for around $30. Tai Chi is my new go-to Chinese restaurant, without a doubt!
author: Jay S.

description:
Excellent take away spot. Quick preparation, good value. Fried rices are great.

Will definitely go back.
author: Yo D.

description: food is cheap and decent.  service is fairly terrible, but for a $6 lunch, the expectation is low.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Probably not the fanciest place in the city, but the food definitely makes up for decor.
Gotta try their curry, sweet & spicy soup and sizzling rice soup.
Wonton is pretty damn good too.

1 thing to highlight: had a waitres almost slamming a plate of soup on our table and rolling her eyes, cause we wouldnt wanna order anything else.
BUT, she must have been REALLY exhausted, so we let it slide ;)
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description:
I have walked past this place time and time again and I see a "MIchelin 2007" rating plaque in the window.  I think.. seriously??  So I finally gave it a try.  My impressions and thoughts are as follows:

First time...I'm not especially impressed but think maybe it's an off day.  Greasy soggy eggrolls. So very blah velvet chicken.
Second time...still not particularly impressed and who the hell makes chowmein with spaghetti noodles?  Worst chowmein EVER!!  It was so bad I don't even remember what else I had.  The bad just overtook everything else.
Third time...It's just not going to change no matter how much I wish the Michelin rating meant something.  Sizzling Rice soup with no sizzle??  Beef and scallops iron skillet - fair but not traditional.
Fourth time...Ok I can live with the cheap-lunch greenbean & beef rice plate.

I give them 3 stars.  1 for the greenbean & beef rice plate at lunch time (cheap and lots of food), 1 because its conveinent and 1 because the staff are freindly, speedy and I love that they have the flat panel tvs in the first dining area tuned to an asian channel playing asian soap operas.  I don't know what the hell they are saying but it's great.
author: Kathleen K.

description:
Decent. Nothing spectacular.

I had the lunch special to go, and while it was filling and ridiculously cheap (5.85), I wasn't too thrilled.

I've been looking for a good neighborhood Chinese place, and I will continue to look. I'm sure I'll be back, but while looking around the place, they could've taken some time to maybe clean up?

There are boxes stacked up at the back of the restaurant, the tables aren't cleared regularly, and while I had lunch to go, I don't think I'll be back for a seated meal.

Staff was friendly, and the food was finished quickly, but overall, a very strong C+/B-.
author: Mike K.

description:
I tried this place for the first time last night. We ordered takeout for a movie night the bf & I were having at our friend's house. 

We ordered the following: 
green onion pancakes
salt and pepper pork chops
salt and pepper prawns with no shell
beef chow fun
dry braised green beans
tomato beef chow mein
basil chicken
rice

The only thing I was really disappointed by was the green onion pancakes. They seemed much too crispy and there did not seem to be much in the way of green onion in them. Not very pancake like, more like a cracker it was so crispy. The other food was yummy, and tasted fresh. The pork was juicy. Nothing worse than overcooked pork. I would have liked the salt and pepper items to be a little more spicy, but still delish overall. The beef chow fun had a lot of veggies in it as well, and the green beans were spicy and tasty.

I will definitely order from them again in the future.

As for the movie, we watched Equilibrium because our friend Joseph had never seen it. That was a hit with him. For me as it has Christian Bale, enough said.
author: Maria M.

description:
Amazingly, the recent order that the BF and I got from Tai Chi was the first time either of us had EVER had Chinese food delivered! I mean, come on, if you live in San Francisco, in most cases you just walk down the street and there's a Chinese restaurant there... you don't really have to have it delivered.

But Tai Chi could very well change all that. We ordered the General Tsao's Chicken and the Garlic Shrimp with brown rice, and were so, so, so happy. The portions were generous and that frickin' General Tsao's was just to die for. Classic American Chinese food. And yes it's true, the delivery is wicked fast... even if you live more than 10 blocks away!
author: Andrey C.

description:
The food is really just a tad above average, but their delivery system is good enough to win anybody over. I can order over the phone or even online (when I'm in SF), and my food will be at your door in ten to fifteen minutes!

My favorite is everybody's favorite: the walnut prawns. The dressing on the prawns (get them on the side) is mayonnaise based, with just a hint of sweetness, and the candied walnuts (or pecans) give the dish an extra crunch. The prawns are lain atop a bed of shredded cabbage, which usually is still fairly crisp by the time the food arrives and a great accompaniment to the richness of the prawns and walnuts.

I was disappointed by the kung pao chicken: bland, not spicy enough, small, sparse bits of chicken. The large chunks of zucchini are especially annoying, as they hardly get cooked with the flash fry.

Their fare is mostly standard Americanized Chinese dishes, but they're done well and delivered at lightning-fast speed. I wish Berkeley had some restaurants like these.
author: Nuri K.

description:
Tai Chi- the term brings to mind relaxation and an awareness of ones balance and what effects it however, the fare at this Polk street establishment of this very moniker lacks all the aspects that make for excellent Chinese food. 

We were a party of five with a hunger for Chinese food and chopsticks in hand. The waitress promptly took all of our orders and returned shortly with the tea that we had requested. A moment later, she brought the brown rice, scallops with bokchoy in a garlic sauce, and some other dishes that looked very good, indeed. 

A few bites later, the realization set in- the food looks good at Tai Chi but it lacks the flavors associated with the pungent aromas of garlic, ginger and onion, The items we ordered were a fair sampling of seafood, vegetable, poultry, and noodle dishes so we were able to adequately asses the overall quality of the cuisine they serve at this Polk Street Chinese food establishment. The service was fast and efficient but the food was a flop.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Eh, didn't see what the big deal about this place is.  Maybe it was what I ordered, but it was just like any other asian places, but very plain flavored.  However, good upside, no hint of MSG.

Alright, so here's the deal, wednesday night, hump day, got home after 7pm, tired, hungry, feeling for some asian.  Let's see...hmm, good reviews at Tai Chi.  Alright, let's do this.  I'll get the beef and broccolli, and mushu pork.  I have a thing for mushu pork, don't ask.

I pick it up.  Damn...the box for the mushu pork is HUGE.  I mean, they had to double box this bad boy to keep it from gushing out.  What yummy asian greasy goodness could be locked up in here??  Quick flip of a finger, lid opens, and bam.....

cabbage.....lots of it.....i mean......where's the pork??

This thing was 99.99999999999% cabbage!!  I dug around for the pork, but alas, nowhere to be found.  I found a couple strands of pork in there like stowaways on a pirate ship, desperate and alone.  You mean this entire gigantic box is just full of cabbage?!?!  Looks to be.

Alright, so maybe the beef and broccolli will cheer me up.  It's decent, but very plain.  No real flavor...just....soy sauce.  I'd give it another star if the prices were lower.  They ain't bad, but not for what you get.

Maybe I'll come back here some future time and try their potstickers, but for now, no thanks.
author: Tadd L.

description:
I went here with a large group last night.

The service was terrific very friendly and attentive - 1 star

The prices were decent, low to mid range - 1 star

The food was a bit of a disappointment, most everything we got had a lot of gooey sweet sauce, with some extra gooey sweet sauce thrown on top.  Things could have been fresher, or maybe less swimming in goop.  Spicy dishes were not, although they were happy to bring the chili when you asked for it.  The hot and sour soup was lack luster.  We took no left overs home.  All and all the meal was not awful so 1 more star...but barely passing.

With all the amazing food we have in SF maybe I'm spoiled but it's all relative.
author: E R.

description:
Bonus points for prompt delivery! I think I waited about 20 minutes for my meal. They also take credit cards over the phone. You can even add your tip onto the credit card!

The food was good, but honestly what Chinese American food isn't. I got the General's Chicken (spicy but could've been spicier) and the Pork Chow Mein (which was good, but a little bland).  A notch up from Panda Express, but not as good as some as the little places you can find in China Town.

The portion sizes are HUGE! I have to cut this up into 3 or 4 meals!!

I would order take out from them again, but don't plan on acutally eating there.
author: Rana A.

description:
I live in the NOPA area... and I cannot tell you how happy I am that Tai Chi delivers to our area. 

I've been experiencing some extreme Chinese-food deprivation living in the neighborhood that I'm in. So much that I was beginning to miss my old neighborhood - way out by the beach - which would generally take me an hour to get to work on Muni every day... yea, I was experiencing severe Sunset blues.

Anyway, that feeling has since passed, and I have Tai Chi to thank for that. What can I say, I love food - and move over Kolonel - the General's Chicken is in town! (Heh... sorry, I had to!)
author: Jane H.

description:
It was my first time at this Chinese establishment so i had to conduct my "first time test" and try their Mongolian beef...its is the true test to see how legit the food is

Mongolian beef...actually spicy! (you wont believe how many places have that little chili icon next to their Mongolian beef and it turns out to just be salty)

fried wonton with crab cheese inside...my favorite appetizer...i could have 10 of these little babies for dinner!!

...another gets added to my fav. local spots =)
author: Gladys D.

description:
Probably the last divey place on that side of Polk. I order this once once or twice a week.Super quick and pretty cheap for where it is. 

What's amazing is the Crispy Drumsticks, the Hot & Spicy Eggplant, Mongolian Beef is ok, the Shrimp Wonton soup is really good and I'm only writing to see if anyone has reviewed the sizzling rice soup while I watch the debate. 

Also I may add that this is better than anything I've had in Chinatown, but Yee's is pretty good.
author: Crutonic L.

description:
This place is consistently good every time we get take out. They are always at our house in 30 minutes or less. 
The best foods we get are the pot stickers and the spicy chicken and fresh vegetables. So yummy!
I will always get Tai Chi when I am in SF.
author: Lauren H.

description:
This place has been in my blood since I was a young'n.
Straight up the best Chinese food I've found.

Do it!
author: Plague Eater X.

description: I thought this was uber-respectable chinese food for lunch - beef with tender greens was more delicate and less oily than normal. better than a lot of places in chinatown. I came back to dinner on the Chinese New Year and had lots of wrappy things. Everything was flavorful, hearty and tasty!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Dropped by for a solo lunch one sunny Saturday afternoon and was pleasantly surprised.

They don't offer the lunch specials on the weekend, so I just went with a plate of smoked pork with veggies over rice.  It was really quite good and the pork tasted, well it was definitely smokey.  The spice to the plate was just right, enough to get my nose running a bit.

The service was fast (place was practically empty) and really friendly.  With free tea and water, I was out for literally $7.50 including tip.

The decor is a little iffy--the walls next to the tables could use some help.  Looks like peeps have wiped their grubby little mitts on them or something.  Kinda nasty to look at in the daylight.

Other than that, I'll definitely make a point to stop by again and sample some of their other goodies.
author: Daryl E.

description:
Pretty darn good food for a night in or take-out. Food was good, a little greasy (ie: sweet and sour pork), but satisfied my Chinese Take-Out needs for the night. When I get a hankering I will definitely be calling them again but as for the search for the best Chinese food in S.F., I am still looking!

If I could give this place 3.5 stars I would!
author: June Bug M.

description:
The food is covered in Monster Slime. No joke, the sauce covering my chicken looked like something hanging from the Creature from the Black Lagoon. 

That being said, it's actually pretty tasty. I just don't think I can get over appearances to eat there again!
author: Kelly C.

description: If I could give this place more stars I would. Let me first say O-M-G. I remember the first time I went to this restaurant, about 8 years ago. I didn't think it would be anything special because I was being judgemental I guess. It looked too casual so I just assumed it would be like any generic chinese restaurant. Was I dead wrong! I had the beef chow fun and the walnut prawns. There will never be anything equal to these two scrumptious meals--EVER. I took my sister who lives in So Cal about 7 hours away. To this day (years later), her mouth waters thinking of the food. I wish I could have their recipes. They're very nice, great service, and even if they were mean and had crappy service...it wouldn't matter because their food would override any negative aspect.
author: Hi H.

description:
I am maybe one of the four people in the entire city who DON'T like Chinese food.  I have tried tons of restaurants, and can usually muster a review no better than "it's okay."

After much prodding by my fella and many walks by the restaurant where an admittedly delicious odor was wafting out, I finally agreed to eat at Tai Chi.  And to my surprise, I really liked it!

I now have a minor addiction to the Spicy Salt & Pepper chicken and the Shanghai chicken was surprisingly tasty as well.  I still will almost always opt for Thai or Vietnamese food over Chinese, but at least I now have a place I like when someone I know really wants to eat Chinese.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I've been on a Chinese food kick the past two weeks. Maybe I'm celebrating the new year? Who knows.

Anyway, since I live right down the street from Tai Chi I thought I'd give it a go. This only applies to take out orders, mind you.

The service is quick, friendly and efficient. The restaurant itself is totally bare bones, so I don't know that I would ever eat-in.

The food for me has been hit or miss. The biggest hit was their Eggplant House Special with chicken, shrimp, and lots of veggies. YUM.

Their chown mein has been OK. Nothing super special.

I've been totally thrown off by the chicken dishes, though. The Sweet and Sour Chicken and the Cashew Chicken were pretty blech.

Still, it's convenient if you live in the hood. Especially if you're drunk.
author: Ava S.

description:
Feeling slightly under the weather last night, I stopped by for some hot and sour soup. I ended up ordering some Szechuan Tofu too since I was headed to my friend's election party and wanted to hoard the soup all to myself. 
The soup was good - eggy, spicy, hot, sour. $5.50 is a deal. Other menu items were well priced too from $3.75 for appies to $10+ for special entrees. Most were $6-9. 

No one ate the tofu, so it's going to be my dinner tonight!
author: Elsa E.

description:
I have been a huge fan of Tai Chi for 16 years now. Most of the dishes are excellent but my favorites are the General Chicken and Combination Fried Rice. 

On my last visit the pot stickers were rubbery but that is the first and only time that has happened in easily 50 visits.
author: Mike L.

description: I was not very impressed with this restaurant. It was clean and the service was quick, just what I was looking for. I knew I needed a good meal, because I was going for some big badges tonight. In San Francisco just for the night, need to take advantage of being in the city. I ordered the "hot and spicy" Twice cooked pork and a bowl of steamed rice. The food came quickly, good nice sign. But down hill from there. It did have a nice flavor, but the only thing hot about it was the temperature, I almost burnt my tongue on a few bites. NOT spicy at all. The pork was cut wrong, so much of it was very tough, some even tasted old. during my meal I was never asked if the food was alright, or even if I would like anything else. When I was ready to leave, I guess they saw me get my wallet, that was their cue to bring the check.
author: Steve A.

description:
I just moved to the city and have been using yelp often to help me decide where to eat. The reason I chose this place was because yelp gave it 4 stars. Yelp steered me wrong this time. 

How anyone could give this place more than 3 stars blows my minds. 4 out of the 7 dishes we ordered were unforgivable! yuck! 

I should have left as soon as I noticed there weren't any Chinese people eating there. 

To begin with the cleanliness of the place is the main reason behind the sad star. The lazy susan had dirty oily streaks all over it, one plate had left over rice grains, 2 glasses of water had a lip stains and another had black speckled crust on the rim. One chopstick had a piece of wet paper stuck on it. 

I know when it comes to Chinese restaurants the rule is if they're not rude then it's not right. That much I expected. But when you have to ask for everything twice and still not get it then then it becomes a problem. "Hot tea please...excuse me can I have hot tea?.... HOT TEA!!!!" Finally the tea came, we also asked for another set of chopsticks and black pepper....it was like pulling teeth. The worst part was they weren't even busy. 

As far as the food goes I ordered 

Hot & sour soup - I've had a lot better but this will work if you don't know what you're missing. 

Sweet & Sour Shrimp (I think that was the name of it)- it's shrimp that's been deep fried in batter and comes with sweet & sour sauce on the side. - 2 stars 

Pot stickers - undercooked 

Salt & Pepper ribs - too salty 

Sizzling beef & scallops - disgusting! the beef is foul. The texture of the beef was unusually soft. The scallop and beef combo is just strange and didn't go well together. 

Three Ingredients Seafood with garlic sauce Chow Fun - Ewww...There was a strange ingredient that I've never seen added before to this dish...sweet & sour sauce! WTH! 

Garlic Shrimp -This is the Only dish I liked and it wasn't anything to write home about either. The broccoli should have been cooked with the shrimp but it wasn't. It looked a little sad sitting around the side of the dish with no flavor. 

Something that added to my dislike for this place is after ordering all these dishes they ask if I want rice. I hate when restaurants do this...Why wouldn't I want rice? What am I going to eat garlic shrimp and sizzling beef with? 

I guess you should order out to avoid being disgusted with this place if you still are planning on eating their food.
author: Jamaree C.

description:
Love for many reasons, apart from the great flavor and brown-rice option:

1. No corkage fee, but if you forget, they have a great selection of wine wines.  And yep, they have the right glasses.  

2. Chris, the owner, rumbles with the kitchen crew.  Love watching him toss bok choy while walking around the kitchen island and taking orders on the phone.  Yes he can.

3. Best-tasting won ton soup.  

Delicious Chinese food translated for the rest of us.

Go!
author: Amelyn C.

description: Quality food, fresh vegetables, overall Tai Chi has some pretty sound ingredients for the price. Tea was a little weak, but only slightly.
author: Ron W.

description:
Tai Chi restaurant?  What the hell is that.  Its Chinese food.  Its lunch.  What else is there?  I had the Sweet and sour pork lunch special.  

The food was decent, the service was pretty attentive, but can't give a restaurant named "tai chi restaurant" 5 stars.  There was nobody doing Tai Chi inside.
author: patrick o.

description:
Surprisingly good!  I always avoid places like this - you know, the Chinese delivery places that are coated in grease.  But one day, I was walking home from the bus, and I wandered in.  I requested that my shrimp and broccoli not be made with too much oil, and they were happy to comply!

I wouldn't call it gourmet - although, to be fair, I've only eaten here when I've had a hankering for Take Out Chinese (you know what I mean!) and not their specials.  But still - quality seafood, fresh ingredients.  I like, I like.
author: Serena Y.

description:
Fast delivery and decent food. Its a solid place that has been aroound forever, so you know it has to have some signature dishes that pass muster. I've got a sell rating on the crispy chicken wings, but the shanghai egg rolls, chicken with broccoli, veggie fried rice, and spicy tofu is where its at. Ask for light sauce if you are like me and hate the goopy brown sauce that covers everything.
Prices are reasonable - around 8-10 bucks an entree. I found myself in a food induced coma on the couch soon after my MSG laden indulgence - covered in crumbs and dipping sauce. Watch out for that side effect.
author: Stacy T.

description: Some of the worst food I've ever had in SF--anywhere--ever.  First time was home delivery several months ago--virtually inedible.  Gave it one more try for carryout last week, in a pinch, at 10:15 at night.  The kitchen was appalling and so was the food. Never again.
author: James B.

description:
Tai Chi is the shiznit. Period. Everything you can ask for in Chinese delivery. 1) Fast as hell. I think they tell everyone 30 minutes. But if you live in the hood that means 5-10 minutes. Crazy quick. Delivery guys are always cool too. I was once short on tip and walked it over later beacuse he was so cool about it. 2) Hot. I'm always impressed when Chinese food can be so incredibly hot but it's flavor remains in tact. And it's DELIVERY. Very hard to do. 3) Off-the-hook good. Never tasted better Tomato Beef Chow Mein. 

Even when I pick up or dine in they're just super nice people. Reason enough to go back.
author: Jackie B.

description:
What can I say...one would think there would be better Chinese food in San Francisco but let's take a step back and look at where I live... If you live in the Russian Hill/Nob Hill area, this is a good solid place to go for Chinese food and/or takeout. And it's way better than Andy's if that even says anything. 

Because the weather was wet and rainy outside, we started off with the won ton soup. I usually get this if I'm ever sick and it's really tasty. The broth is excellent and the won tons are big. The potstickers are also a generous size. The mongolian beef and sizzling beef and scallops were also great. The meat was tender, juicy and very flavorful. Watch out for the sizzling plates though. You might want to ask them to  sizzle it in the back, otherwise be prepared for oil splatter all over your hands. 

They also offer a selection of beer and wine at very reasonable prices.
author: Josephine H.

description:
I originally gave this place five stars.  However, after eating from here a couple more times, I realized most of their stuff is done with the same brown sauce, and everything was drenched in it... no matter what I ordered.  It was okay for a first taste, but after a while definitely gets old.  

However, my order came in under 20 minutes 7:00pm - 7:20pm, steaming hot!  This is definitely a nice break from my last week's North Beach Pizza order which took 1.5 hours. 

Don't think I'll be ordering from here anytime soon again, but it might still be good once in a while.
author: Amy L.

description: Just plain gross! Mongolian beef was tasteless and really wierd texture. Wonton soup was horribly salty and had very gross pork inside the wontons... it was overly fatty and had mystery crunchy things in the pork wontons. I would give negative 1 star if I could. So bad... DO NOT EAT HERE!!
author: Ryan W.

description: All the other reviews are pretty accurate; the delivery is fast, the food comes piping hot and the price to quality ratio is solid. The crab rangoon (bafflingly called crab cheese cake) are excellent as is the hot and sour soup. The pork fried rice was good, but nothing to write home about and the general tso's was disappointing only because of the rave reviews given by other yelpers. Overall though this is, by far the best chinese delivery i've had in the city.
author: Jillian M.

description: 2 hour wait for delivery. Unacceptable. Plus, food was very bland and not good.
author: Johanna W.

description:
"Quite Possibly the worst Chinese Food I have eaten in San Francisco"
If you look on the outside window of Tai Chi, there is a "michelin 2007 recommended", well I give it a "plastic big wheel tire 2010" not recommend. I ordered the cashew chicken, and the sauce tasted like it had 1/4 cup of salt in it,  it also had way too much corn starch added to thicken it. Blehhh. 
The worst was to come, I than was delivered my Tomato Beef Chow Mein, the noodles were so overcooked they were stuck together, and mushy. I asked the server if that was how they served it, as  I smashed the noodles into a paste, I said . "I think these noodles are overcooked" . He said, "yes that is how we serve it" and he walked away. As I paid for my bill from another server, she asked was everything alright, I said. "no, the tomato beef chow mein was the worst I ever had". She said, "oh". 
Why this place has a four star rating, makes me all the more skeptical about the people who review on Yelp. You have to take it with a grain of salt, in Tai Chi's case thats 1000's grains.
author: Kool K.

description: It's been a few years, and I can still remember the walnut prawns...gotta get back to san fran, i left my heart at this restaurant.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Update:  I was a fan of Tai Chi until I got food poisoning last year, so I'm downgrading the stars.

Best general tso chicken I've tasted in the city.  Chicken corn soup, chicken chow mein with almonds, spring rolls, walnut prawn shrimp, chicken fried rice, and scallops with greens are all great.  The list goes on and on.  Prices are reasonable and they expanded the dining area... remodel looks great.  Always take my out of town guests to this place.
author: Angelique B.

description:
Their delivery was SO FAST, I nearly pooped myself.

However, if a Chinese restaurant doesn't have good sweet n' sour pork, then it might as well not exist to me.  Their pork was full of fat chunks and quite flavorless.

Pot stickers were mediocre but the wanton soup was quite good.

I probably won't order from them again since there are better options.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
The reason it gets 3-stars is at least it's free delivery with purchases over $15.

I grabbed a variety of things from there, and it was just "average", nothing really to write home about, and in all honesty, you could probably find the same thing anywhere else.  The reason I ordered from there specifically is because it was on the Michelin approved list, and consider the value for the rating, (usually a Michelin rating comes with a high price tag).

Anyhow, the service was great on the phone and certainly speedy delivery, but for quality of food...save your money.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Best delivery in the city! We order in about once a week from Tai Chi! They are fast, yummy and cheap! Also, the food has no MSG so you don't feel sick after. Great leftovers too. 

We love the sizzling rice soup-super good when you aren't feeling good, are cold, or just in the mood for yummy soup. ;-) We also love the shrimp fried rice (the combo rice was great too but we aren't big fans of the pork so we get shrimp, beef or chicken fried rice instead. The pork in the fried rice bbq-not bad-just not our taste). The General Tso's  Chicken over white rice is really yummy. It's best when it's really hot! :-)
author: Alexia P.

description:
When you are driving down the fwy in the middle of the night Taco Bell or In n Out are visions of beauty.

When you are on the couch watching Monday night football a slice of a tasty za and a cold beer is a good night.

Tonight I needed some feel good food- Tai Chi delivered quickly (30 mins) contrary to other reviews.

I ordered the Beef Broccoli, Mongolian Beef, Fried Rice, and Chicken Chow Mein.  The quality of the meats were good...very tender in fact.  Vegetables were fresh as well.  I was surprised as I have walked past this place many times in the past and not been interested....although they always seem busy.  All dishes came piping hot and tasty...should be good for my next 3 meals!

When I am needing Chinese take out- I will be calling Tai Chi.
author: Rob C.

description:
I had not ordered from  Tai Chi in 10 years, but we were tired of the drab food served by the other Chinese places near us in the marina and decided to give it a try. The food  was great! First , the portions were huge , we still have half the food left over. The general's chicken was excellent , but very rich. the pot stickers were delicious! My beef with snow peas was prepared perfectly with the peas crunchy and the beef very tender in a wonderful oyster sauce. Delivery was under 30 minutes!

If you are tired of Andy's , Hai sunor Ho's,   try Tai Chi  you won't be disappointed.
author: Brad S.

description: We called in for pick up on the way home and were quoted 15 minutes. The food came out of the kitchen right when we arrived. The green onion pancakes are the best I've had in the city so far. They were flaky and crispy and not too oily. The dry fried green beans were crisp, fresh and covered in garlic, so good! I like that they have brown rice and love that they accept credit cards. I'll definitely be going back for more.
author: Caitlin C.

description: If I have to eat Chinese food, this place is pretty good. It is no House of Nanking, but it is decent and it doesn't have MSG. Will I crave food from here anytime soon with all the other fantastic restaurants in the city? Doubtful. But I hardly ever crave Chinese food. Not Tai Chi's fault, I blame my taste buds.
author: Susie D.

description:
I love chinese food and was surprised that it was better in NYC than in SF...until I discovered Tai Chi a few years ago. All the dishes I've had dining in the restaurant or as take-out has been consistently good, including the general tso's Chicken, mu shu pork, shrimp with broccoli (sometimes skimpy on the shrimp), and fried dumplings (the dough is not too thick and it is crispy on one side, which is how I like it). 

I no longer live within walking distance to this place anymore, but am willing to take a 20-30 minute bus ride from the Mission to eat here.
author: Nancy B.

description: Wow. I cant believe all these critical recent reviews.  I was a long time delivery customer for the old Tai-Chi and last night i had the new Tai-Chi for the first time.  I think it is better than it was before. The Szechuan Chicken with Veggies was much better, surprisingly so was the rice.  The eggrolls were a drop in taste but I was trying to figure out how to stop ordering them anyway given they arent the healthiest option :) I am looking forward to trying other items soon.
author: Courtney M.

description: Unfortunately, with the retirement of the previous owner...so went the good food. Ordered my standard...orange beef and it was horrific. Clearly the new owners fired all of the chefs and brought in their own group. First time ever that I threw the leftovers to the garbage disposal. End of an era. It was a good run.
author: Robert K.

description: Placed delivery order again tonight, but one of the order was not correct. We didn't bother calling them, because it would not be worthy.
author: Lianna D.

description: Not nearly as good as prior management.   Usual items ordered and not nearly as good.  New operator either paid too much for the business or is trying to squeeze more profit than prior owners;  cutting corners everywhere.  Example:  one of their most popular dishes, Walnut Prawns .... serving size is half as large and the quality of the shrimp on the dish is downgraded to smaller shrimp that overcook and get rubbery - did they think no one would notice?   Egg Rolls are cheaper, all cabbage and they're calling them 'vegetarian'.  Plus they've raised prices.  I'll be looking elsewhere for my standby Chinese - this one has been ruined by new management.
author: M G.

description: Over all i would recommend  this place great prices and the food is so fresh.  We had to wait a while for everything but it was wonderful.  portions were huge (like most Chinese) and prices were fair.
author: Morgan C.

description:
Best Chinese take out in the neighborhood.  They deliver very quickly.  This General Tso makes excellent chicken.  I really don't get how it can be soft and crispy at the same time, and to be honest its a little spicy on my gringa tongue but when I have it I find it extremely difficult to put down.

I have not as yet been disappointed by anything I ordered.
author: Flemm F.

description:
This and Houuse of Nan King are the best Chinese places I have been to in SF.  They will make custom dishes for you and their Mongolian Beef is the Bomb.  Also great Hot N Sour soup.  The Chicken Lettuce Wraps are also very good.  Definetly a great place especially for lunch specils and dinner is great also.

The Mongolian Beef has gotten way worse.  The meat is alot cheaper and just has tasted terrible 4 of last 5 times.  I cannot order it again and woudl stringly suggest against it.

Instead of 5 stars I would switch to 3.5.  Still good on soup, lettuce wraps and my tofu dish.
author: Harry E.

description:
I've eaten here a few times. Nothing remarkable but I would certainly come back. Of course, I didn't try to order anything interesting either. It was a "I need something to eat before I start my day" stop, and hence, I just went with chicken and broccoli with rice.

Maybe next time I come I will make it a proper eating experience.
author: Stu M.

description: Delivery was very quick -- it arrived about 10-15 minutes after I placed my order online. (I do live only a few blocks away, however.) The bean curd and General Tso's chicken were delicious. Price was reasonable and quality was good for cheap, quick Chinese food.
author: Jackie C.

description: Tai Chi has long been a neighborhood favorite, though I hadn't been there for some time.  I was surprised to see that the space had been renovated, but it seems that the new owners focused on the color of the walls, not the quality of the food or the service.  I won't be returning.  I tried them for take-out lunch recently and was sorely disappointed, but tried again.  The food was mediocre, the servings of sauce were tiny, the overall portions were much smaller, and the service was appalling -- we waited 30 minutes for one dish in an empty restaurant.  The appetizer (green onion pancakes) was bland and tasteless and the mu shi prawn was overcooked and pretty bad.  It is so disappointing to see a great restaurant become a terrible one.  I hope the new owners focus on food and service before the place loses all its business.
author: Rachelle C.

description: My favorite Chinese restaurant in the area.  They even deliver to the Marina.  My favorite dish is the green onion pancakes.
author: Emily L.

description: I'm SOOOOOO disappointed that my once favorite Chinese food in my hood has new ownership and do not know how to cook. The food is tasteless and they didn't even put chopsticks in my bag requested. Needless to say, they've lost my business. Today is a very sad day in Russian Hill. Signed, Disappointed!!
author: R W.

description:
I ordered on citymint.com  It was really easy and I opted to pick-up since I didn't make the $15 delivery min.

Tai Chi called to confirm my order which was awesome.  I ordered:
-the vegetarian spring rolls
-Hunan Tofu
-vegetable lo mien

I know, boring, but it was my first time at Tai Chi and I didn't want to end up hugging the toilet.

The place was empty when I showed up at dinnertime on a Friday night. Hmm, must be the economy, right?

Anyways, here' the important part:
1 order of veg. egg rolls= FOUR rolls! 
The Hunan tofu had chili peppers in it but it was NOT spicy at all (2 on a scale of 1 to 5)
The chow mien was good.  But it's chow mien.  And all of the vegetables in both dishes were not cooked at all.  Kind of disappointing.

Overall the food was average, not bad but not amazing (maybe it's what I ordered) but you get A LOT for your money.
author: Jennie A.

description:
Tai Chi gets a solid 4 stars -- probably closer to 4.5. I've been going here for more than a year now, and I keep finding new dishes that I absolutely love. The Shanghai Chicken is delicious (and comes with fabulous, crispy-fried/baked greens) and Spicy Chicken With Fresh Basil is just as amazing.

Great delivery service as well. Portions have been downsized a tiny bit lately, but no real complaints. Call them!
author: Nob H.

description: It looks to me, too, like they're under new management.  But whether they are or not, the food is still very good to great.  Service is fast and friendly.  I prefer the freshness of eating in, but they're also my number one choice for home delivery.  Not an appealing atmosphere for dining out - as others have said.  Almost grim.  But more than made up for by the excellent food and rood prices.
author: Brad P.

description:
Like everyone says, get take out and get the General Tsao's Chicken.  Good value, great food and very quick delivery.

Been around for over 2 decades according to my neighbors, who've been here for 30 years!
author: Jacob J.

description:
Quick, reliable, consistent, comprehensive.

I live a handful of blocks away from the restaurant and although i cant say ive ever actually eaten at the restaurant, ive never had to.  

Their delivery service is excellent.  The food is always properly packaged, hot, and clean.  They have a vast menu including the heavy, sweet, fried dishes to appease the american palate as well as the more traditional lighter dishes to please the chinese crowd. 

Only complaint is that ive gotten my food a couple times, got into eating position..only to not have any utensils in the bag.  

In football terms, a methodical, pound the rock type drive with the occasional play action pass that ends in a dive over the goal line.  The occasional missing utensils are a missed extra point here and there.
author: Hansen S.

description: It was sad day last week when I learned that Tai Chi is closed and there is ownership change pending. Not sure what that means but I hope new owners are keeping the same quality of the food.
author: Enes C.

description:
Tai Chi is like a 90 yard kick off return in football that gets tripped up right at the 1 yard line.  It's good, but not quite unique or delicate enough to be awesome.  

I recommend it for take-out or a quick fix for Chinese cravings.

Favorite dishes include General Tso's Chicken (savory!), Beef and Tomato, Fried Rice, XO Lamb, Orange Beef.
author: Nelson W.

description:
I discovered this place back in the 70's   and have tried  a number of Chinese  restaurants in the bay area... this is still  NUMBER ONE.
My favorite is the General Tso's Chicken  and spicy green beans..and all the soups...
The service is Very Good...including  to hotels in S.F.
author: William B.

description: The low down Walked in with my gf. She had been there and its her fav. chinese place in the city. Seems like a regular spot when ya walk in. Promptly greeted. placed the order. OK. OK. so i was a bit over zealous and excited about the chance of a new favorite Chinese spot. steamed dumplings are a must try. Egg rolls were ok. General tso's Chicken BEST I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!!! Beef chow mein was awesome. and the.............. crap I forgot but it has plum sauce and ya get a crepe thing to make your Chinese burrito well it was fantastic and if I remember i will edit this review. This place is awesome and all for under $40.
author: Chuck G.

description:
Ordering from a new Chinese place can be scary - but Tai Chi was a dream come true. What makes them so great? 

1) I can order online through delivery.com 
2) The food is reasonably priced 
3) It arrived super fast 
4) It was piping hot upon delivery and 10 minutes later 
5) Large portions 
6) Very little grease and excessive sauce 
7) Big pieces of lean meats (beef and chicken) 

Will now be using Tai Chi as my go to Restaurant for Chinese food delivery!
author: Abra A.

description: This place sucks not only did they tell me the wrong price over the phone and it was more when it came to the door the deliver driver was rude and cussing at me in chinese when I questioned the price the food was terrible overcooked shrimp and chow mein use to be good beef was tough and the plate didnt smell good ...my dog who eats everything wouldnt eat the meat ....this place is disgusting rude and no forksor soysauce delivered..I was told by the lady you have to ask only chinese restaurant you ask to ask for soysauce and forks on delivery....the prce on the website is diffrent from when you get your order gross gross gross this place needs a nnegative zero
author: Summer S.

description: The chow mein didn't suck, but the msg stomach ache sure did.  Quick delivery.  Easy online ordering.  General Tso's chicken was alright.  Potstickers were delicious.  All in all, meh.
author: Christina S.

description: Fast delivery, great food, and awesome prices make this the best Chinese place in Nob Hill. I love their wonton soup, and their standards such as beef and broccoli are the best I've had in SF. And almost everything is under $10, so you can't complain about that.
author: Henry S.

description:
actually, make that 3.5.  there is A LOT of crazy dreadful chinese food out there and this place is pretty solid.  i would usually chose thai/vietnamese/japanese/korean over chinese when it comes to all things asian food but the boyfriend doesn't always agree.  and when one is being lazy and ordering delivery, well, chinese options abound.  of the one's i've tried, tai chi delivers rather decently.

things i've tried include general tso's (average); young-see river shrimp (in my opinion, one of their best offers); kung pao shrimp (eh); seafood medley (average) egg rolls (average); eggplant (pretty good).  

we order from them often and will continue to do so.  their delivery service is fairly efficient and i much prefer it to dining in.  restaurant atmosphere, though cleaner than many chinese spots, is pretty bland.
author: Amy M.

description: Decent but took about 45 minutes and the general tsaos chicken was soggy rather than crispy. Crab rangoons were quite good. Mongolian lamb was pretty bland. Also rather pricey for delivery chinese.
author: M L.

description:
I placed a take-out order from this place after a friend's recommendation.  They promised a quick turnaround- about 10 minutes.  I got there after 15 minutes and still had to wait a few minutes before getting my food.  Not a great take out experience, but I have seen worse.

FOOD:
-Shrimp Wor Won Ton Soup - EXTREMELY SALTY!  The wonton soup tasted like it had been cooked in sea water.. it was amazing how salty and artificial the soup tasted.  The shrimp and won tons might have been better if they weren't in the super-salty solution... but unfortunately they were.  Do not recommend at all
-Tempura Shrimp Stuff Jalapeno - this was meant to accompany my soup, but since the soup was so bad this was the only thing I really ate. The jalapeno is stuffed with well-seasoned shrimp and then fried tempura-style. It has a nice kick, but it not overwhelmingly spicy.  I do recommend this dish

If I only had the soup, I would NEVER come here again.  However, the stuffed jalapeno was good enough that I might dare venture back...
author: VL K.

description:
Ordered delivery tonight from Tai Chi. My girlfriend and I spent about 30 minutes searching through all of our fliers and yelp reviews looking for something that pinged our interest. We were stuck between walking to pick something up or sitting on our lazy butts at home waiting for someone to bring food to us. We went with the latter and, since most delivery is either pizza, Chinese, Thai or Indian, we went with Chinese.
