We've had a ton of different Chinese places around Nob Hill - some fantastic, some just okay. 

Tai Chi is great for quite a few reasons - first, the delivery was fast. second, the menu had some unique sounding dishes  (compared to your general fried rice and broccoli beef place), third, the food tasted great except for just one item, which I will go into later on. 

We ordered pork fried rice, shanghai chicken, crispy chicken wings, potstickers and curry beef chowmein. The shanghai chicken was cool - it came with a pile of small chunks of chicken in a tasty sauce with a side pile of "crispy greens." This dish was unique. It looks like they crisped up some kind of herb, not sure. It went well with the friend rice. The crispy chicken wings were AWESOME. They are definitely a MUST get. My favorite dish was the curry chicken chowmein. I have never seen a Chinese place serve a curry chowmein. It worked as a great contrast to the typical take-out Chinese flavors. It wasn't heavy in curry, just lightly coated for noticeable flavor enhancement. 

There were a few bad points though - the pork fried rice was just okay. Nothing special about it. The pot stickers sucked MEGA! They weren't crispy at all and the filling was bland. Just go for the chicken wings.
author: Matt S.

description:
don't know what all the hype is about

kung pao chicken - i don't know if it's processed, but the chicken tastes like it is
tender green beef - better but still average

it is cheap i guess
author: Sanjiv P.

description: Went to order food from here, like we normally do 2-3x per week, and was told they were closed but would be open tomorrow. Who closes on a Friday? So hubby & I are walking down the street, pass by the restaurant, & tucked into the bottom corner of the window is a notice from the SF Health Dept. saying it was closed due to VERMIN INFESTATION! We talked to the owner about it, and his laissez-faire attitude toward the closure was even more disturbing!! We love this place but will never return again. :( Guess it's time to hunt for a new fave Chinese that delivers!
author: Karen J.

description: One of the nice bits about this neighborhood is that we get a little bleedover from Chinatown over the hill.   This is a very good, high volume Chinese restaurant, but it's not one you'd take a date to or anything like that.  The decor is clean but utilitarian.  More often than not I use this place for takeout and pick up a drink at Wine Jug across the street on my walk home.
author: Beau G.

description: The food is still very good, but the last time I ordered (delivery), it took a whopping one and a half hours (and three phone calls) go get it.  I'll keep trying, but am daunted--and don't daunt easily.
author: Scott W.

description: This is not a fake review, unfortunately.  Tai Chi was a very good restaurant until the building was sold and it was placed under "new mangement" ...I used to either go there or have food delivered at least four or five times a month over the course of 14 years.  The food is delivered cold and is not of the same quality ... more importantly they don't care anymore either.  Not only has the food suffered but the friendly attitude is gone ... This restaurant is trying to live on the reputation it earned in the past, food was good not too pricey and the people were very nice.  Now the food is cold, no one cares anymore .. it's not that it went from a fun experience to a so so experience; it went from a fun to a very bad experience.  You are wasting your time and money coming here.  Plenty of good Chinese restaurants in the city ... go somewhere else and let them learn the hard way.  These new people are arrogant and have no pride in what they do ... SAVE YOURSELF FROM AN UNPLEASANT EXPERIENCE ... GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.
author: Francis S.

description:
I have been eating at this restaurant for over 30 years and always thought the food was great!  Especially their General's Chicken and Mushi Chicken.  Anyway,  after their remodel I had high hopes they would keep the place cleaner but it gets progressively dirtier and my last time I was there last weekend with a bunch of friends, someone had tagged the wall beside the front door and it did not look like it was recently done!  The wall inside are filthy as are the bathrooms.  It needs a paint job and needs to be maintained!    
Chris, the owner has no interest in maintaing the places cleanliness and it is very disappointing.  Sitting there, eating your meal and looking at the walls is really gross!  I told the waitress the last time I was there that IT WOULD BE THE LAST TIME I GO THERE!!!  How sad!!!
author: Craig A.

description: This restaurant helped me diagnose my friend with dyslexia, as I said, "Let's go for some chai tea," and he brought me here. "Oh, you're hungry for Chinese?," I inquired, wherein he insisted it was MY idea. Regardless, the food was rather mediocre -- the hot and sour soup was really nice, but the General's chicken (which is hard to mess up, IMHO) had an odd texture. I might try them again, but would definitely order something entirely different. As for that Indian tea craving, I suppose the next time I want some, I'll suggest to my same dyslexic friend that we go sign up for a tai chi class and then see where we wind up.
author: Gregor G.

description: We had chicken won top soup and chicken asparagus.  Both were pretty bad.  The place is not so clean either.  Will not come back.  Two stars for free tea.
author: V s.

description:
We found this on Yelp and stopped by one night about 15 minutes before they were closing.  Yes, we were those people, but they were so welcoming and fixed our order up in a jiffy!!

We ordered the General Tso's and the Eggplant Special and loved them both.  We have also had the Sweet and Sour Shrimp and the Won Ton soup and would highly recommend all of it!  This place definitely knows how to fry their chinese food.  
I was never really a fan of chinese food, or atleast didn't seek it out.  Now, I crave chinese food from Tai Chi. YUM!
author: Cathryn L.

description: Was very impressed with Tai Chi.  Have had it a few times now. The delivery times varies from 15 minutes to an 1 hour but the food always arrives hot.  The portions are large and well prepared.  Ordering through the web is a great feature.
author: Brandon B.

description: All I can say is that I wish there were a restaurant like this in Orange County, Calif.  Satay beef was awesome.  I was there with bf who is limited in what he likes to eat.  I'm sure their other dishes were equally good, as I saw them on others' tables.
author: Nikko V.

description: This place rocks! Quick delivery, always very fresh veggies and quality meats. Crab Rangoon was awesome. The only item I was not impressed with was the mixed veggie chow mien. Everything else was Yum-my!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Oops I did it again, I ordered with my stomach and not my brain. Now I'm sitting here typing this review with $40 worth of uneaten chinese food. I LOVE the crab cheese puffs (crab rangoon to me). That's all I ate...all 8 of em. Yummy fried wonton with fake krab and cream cheese. What am I to do with the General's Chicken, Spicy Eggplant, Sweet and Sour Pork, Brown Rice, Chicken Wings and Green Tea Ice Cream? I'm full. The Generals Chicken smells good...maybe my neighboors want it.  Why do I do this? I should have heated up some Trader Joe's Canneloni and been done with this. Ugh. Don't ever order with your stomach...it's not worth it. Oh but go here...Tai Chi is really worth it. Food coma time.
author: Sherie R.

description: Incredibly good Chinese food in a great, fun neighborhood - especially if you don't want to trapse over the hill to Chinatown.  It's all good.
author: R F.

description: Major meh...  Took an hour and 10 minutes for delivery.  The much touted General's chicken and spicy eggplant (not spicy in the least) were both gooey, sticky, syrupy sweet and not yummy after the first few bites - in other words, like 90% of my Chinese food experiences.  Why is it that most Chinese food I think I'm going to like is really candy masquerading as food?
author: Esther R.

description: Hands down best chinese food in the area, delivery is just as good as eating in! Really Really good stuff!
author: David R.

description: I flipping LOVE Tai Chi - best beef broccoli and vegetable fried rice this side of Compton.
author: Catrinel A.

description: Always fresh vegetables, and they're proportionate with their vegies and meat dishes. It's great when a place has fresh vegetables, but if I order the Beef and Broccoli I'd like some beef to go with that.They are also generous in their portions, so that when you are hungry again an hour, you have some leftover. :) Oh and they deliver, but with the new decor (for any who have been before) your more likely to stay and sit, there is plenty of room for big family gatherings and the noise level is comfortable enough to wear you can be intimate or casually conversate with your party.
author: Layne C.

description: BBQ pork with Chinese vegetables is excellent!  I enjoyed it with brown rice and walked out the door for around $10.  Of course I had leftovers in my hand for dinner that night.
author: Corey V.

description:
WORST Chinese food I have EVER had and I have had some bad meals in the past.  I was SO excited after reading the positive reviews and ordered some delivery.  Then I proceeded to wait. And wait. And wait some more.  After being told 30 minutes for my meal to arrive it finally got here an HOUR later.  And the delivery guy went to the wrong apartment first.  So I'm ravenous at this point and hoping that the food is worth the wait.  It wasn't.  Ugh. I've NEVER had Chinese food leftovers that I haven't been happy to finish the next day.  I'm tossing these suckers OUT.  I ordered the pot stickers, honey glazed prawns, broccoli beef and pork fried rice which all came to $30.  The pot stickers were clearly not made the way they are supposed to (a day early and fried the next day) and were tasteless and doughy.  The pork fried rice was too salty and the broccoli beef not salty enough so that it was oddly nearly tasteless.  The honey glazed prawns were not even glazed but merely fried with the glaze on the side. WTF?!  That's not even the SAME friggin' thing!  Even the fortune cookies were nasty and bland.  Irony: One of the cookies' fortunes read "You will get your heart's desire"  Apparently my "heart's desire" was not a good dinner.
NEVER, NEVER again.
author: Jill D.

description: This is probably the best chinese delivery place I have ordered from in SF.  They give you a ton of food and its reasonably priced.  The shrimp with garlic sauce is really good.  The fried chicken wings were also pretty good.  Its pretty much classic chinese fried chicken with ginger being a key ingredient.  There were probably 6-7 large wings in the container.  I was impressed because I couldn't finish it.  Definitely give this place a try for delivery.
author: Fatty A.

description: This Russian Hill establishment provides an easy going atmosphere with friendly service. Prices are typical hole in the wall Chinese, but the portions are quite large. I'm always sure to order their signature dish, General Tso's chicken and most everything else on the menu is full of flavor. Tai Chi does a great take-out business, which is needed, as they'll often have a line out the door for table service.
author: Philip M.

description: I was delightfully surprised with Tai Chi Restaurant's excellent service. The food was quick and delicious and the portions are generous, making it worth the money. I was overall very pleased.
author: Sueann W.

description: The best Chinese in the city.  I order from them once a week.  Before moving, we actually called to make sure we were still in their delivery zone!  Lightning fast delivery.  Try the green onion pancakes, basil chicken & sizzling scallops & chicken.
author: Ken H.

description: Great delivery, wonderful general's chicken. Almond chicken chow mein is also good stuff. Probably my favorite Sunday hung-over, don't want to leave the house food.
author: Noelle Q.

description: delish. they delivered in 20 minutes, made a special dish that i requested and were so accommodating despite ordering as the resto was closing for the night
author: Jennifer L.

description: We ordered from here for lunch one day at the office. The food was good which deserves the two stars.  But it only stays as two stars because 2 hours later, the three of us that had the food from there ended up with a killer stomach ache.  I'm too scared to try it again.
author: Anne M.

description: Tai Chi.  What more can I say.  I would have given them another half star but they frequently get cited for minor health code infractions.  I've never seen anything obvious but the other reviews here are spot on.  Generals Chicken - once or twice a month.  Crispy Tea Smoked duck is quackalicious.  Never had a bad meal or so much as an ill belch from eating here.  And I swear they have THE fastest delivery time in all of the know universe.   When we have time to kill, we order from NB Pizza and wait, when we are famished and need our fix of house fried rice and pot stickers, we dial up Tai Chi.  Been eating here for over 10 years on an almost monthly basis and they are consistently one of the best places in SF for yummy Chinese.
author: Rob K.

description: I know I have found a good chinese restaurant if I like their Hot & Sour soup and I love their's!  Always fresh, great service and a decent wine list that is really really cheap!  And I always find parking...what more could you ask for?
author: Lisa R.

description: You can order online at their website (via eat24hours) and if you live in the TenderNob, it'll literally arrive withing 15 minutes, piping hot! The General's chicken kicks ass as does the fact that they serve brown rice, ya know to keep ya regular and offset the badness of deep fried chicken! Tai Chi is my new goto for Chinese delivery. 5 Stars!
author: I. O.

description:
i've driven by this restaurant many times in the past and after reading the positive reviews on yelp, i decided to give it a try for dinner tonight.

we ordered the bok choy w/ garlic, general tsou's chicken and fillet w/  string beans and black bean sauce. 

I'm not a big fan of ginger and they had a lot in the bok choy so i wasnt too thrilled with that..the ginger killed it for me.
the chicken was deeeeeeeeeelicious and the fish w/ string beans was pretty good too - our delivery guy showed up within 30 minutes and the food was hooooooot..not warm..but hoooot!

i'm excited to try many of their other dishes they have..their cooking style is definitely good..thumbs up!
author: M W.

description: When my wallet has not a lot of money left in there but I'm starving and craving some Szechwan dish, I come here. I love their pot stickers here. So juicy and delicious. But any of the Chile-infused dish like dry fried long beans with pork or Hunan style preparations will be a great choice. The prices here are really cheap so I always have a couple bucks left to live on for the next couple days! YAY!
author: Juliane N.

description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet.  It is retardedly good.  Sometimes I just get a craving for greasy chinese food and this is the only thing that hits the spot.   Their chow mein is by far my favorite of any Chinese place.  The tomato and beef one is soooooo yummy!  I like to mix that with the entrees instead of white rice - since I am so health-conscious, hehe.  Everything I've had is pretty good - I like all of their pork and beef dishes, esp. the Schezuan pork and the Mongolian beef.  I need to be careful with their chicken dishes though - sometimes the dark meat is tough and grisley ... I prefer the dishes that have white meat chicken.  Their delivery is ridiculously quick too - I swear most of the time it's less than 20 minutes, and I'm a good 15 blocks away.... oh and you can order online at delivery.com - you know I love me some of that!
author: A B.

description: Delivery is definitely the preferred method, but after dining in one night, the service is actually very good. (At least our server was very polite even after my friend yells, "Is there fucking egg in that soup?" right as she places the bowl on the table.) The hot and sour soup wasn't very hot with mostly a gelatinous sour flavor, but the steamed pork dumplings made up for the disappointing soup. The General Tso's chicken was really good, but the half crispy duck, not so much. There were a few good, tender pieces, but most of it was too crispy and dried out...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Never actually ate at the restaurant but they have a great takeout service. For 20 bucks you'll have enough food to last you for days. I love the General's chicken (best to get rice with this so you can soak up the delicious sauce), the hot and sour soup isn't the best I've ever had but they give you a huge serving for just 5 bucks. Delivery is fast as hell so don't leave the house to go get some beer or something after you order because you just might come home to an answering machine full of angry messages from a Chinese delivery guy (sorry again, dude).
author: Tommy P.

description: Love this place. It is not fancy. I usually get it delivered because of the ambiance. It is always good. Never any issues and the food is consistent. Hot and sour soup, Dumplings and Chicken with Broccoli.
author: Doreen D.

description: This is the best tai place that ive been to they have really good garlic chicken and rice with an orange soda and your all good to go with the vegetables on the side very good 2 thumbs up!!!!
author: Shaniya C.

description:
Definitely as good as it gets in terms of delivery chinese food!

Consistent, fast, affordable and delicious!

My boyfriend and I especially like the general tso's chicken, pork fried rice, egg rolls, and crab rangoon...yum!
author: Julia J.

description: I like this place. I've been here a few times and every time it was good.  I came here with a party of 8 and sat at the back round table.  Great choice because the middle of the table spins for easy access to all the other foods. (Everything is served family style)  I really like the prawns with walnuts, chow mein, the hot and sour soup, the spring rolls, the vegetable fried rice, and the sweet and sour shrimp.  They deliver and the prices are cheap, cheap!
author: Courtney M.

description: When I first came here I didnt order anything because I was just meeting some friends while they were finishing their dinner. I walked in and ignored the woman at the register because I just assumed she didn't speak english, she doesn't know me anyway...I passed her in a flash and sat down at a table with my two friends. after taking my seat the waiter brought me a menu and failed to realize that my friends were nearly done with their food. I mean c'mon you really think im goin to make them wait while I scarf down what I didnt know to be the best general tsao's chicken ever? I ignored this person too. he just spoke Chinese. so I wasn't hurt when he frowned at me and waddled away. the language barrier helps alot when you need to offend people away from you. I didnt understand his body language even. 4 stars.
author: Cameron Scott C.

description: I took everyone else's advice and gave this place a try.  I believe this place to be the best chinese delivery that I've found in the 4 years of living in SF.  Most importantly, the food is fantastic (as mentioned 100 times before, get that General Chicken).  Delivery is prompt, and food arrives hot.  I doubt I'll try anyplace else now.
author: Raja B.

description:
i ordered delivery from tai chi last night and was pleased with the experience.  they were super-fast... they said 20-30 min on the phone, but it arrived in about 15.  i liked my food, overall i wasnt super impressed but i liked the freshness and quality of the food, and would definitely order again, i might just pick something else.  i had the steamed dumplings - kind of bland, but the sauce helped.  and i had the shrimp in black bean sauce- good, but too many onions.  
i will definitely try tai chi again - its close and convenient, and i would love to try new dishes on their menu!
author: Carolyn B.

description:
Tai Chi is my new stand-by for solid Chinese in my hood.  The food is fast, flavorful, and fairly priced - just as any good neighborhood Chinese restaurant should be.  They even deliver!

The food here is of better quality than most places around Nob Hill, and it is way more flavorful than the rest of them.  I spent the first 20+ years of my life in San Diego, and my family has been going to the same awesome Chinese restaurant for the last 15 years.  You have no idea how much I miss and crave that food almost every day.  But now, I am so happy I found Tai Chi because the food is almost as tasty.  My goal is to try everything on the menu so I can develop a big list of favorite items.  For now, the list is limited to General Tsao's chicken (the best I've ever had!), Garlic Beef with Mushrooms, and Honey Walnut Prawns.
author: t l.

description: Serious lunch special for under 6 bucks.  Comes with soup, an egg roll, plate of your choice, and rice.  Super greasy, but inexpensive and a great lunch spot.
author: Eric W.

description:
Tai Chi really is as good as it gets for Chinese delivery in Nob Hill, San Francisco. The food is consistantly really good, the portions are good, and the wait time is minimal. The staff is friendly and you can always get someone who speaks English well enough to understand your order. 

If you're not expecting a Gary Danko or Michael Mina experience from your Chinese delivery place, don't look any further. Tai Chi is perfect for a night in, relaxing in front of the fire...
author: cassandra v.

description:
From the street, particularly in the evening, the fluorescent lights' reflection on the white tile floors could scare away potential patrons. Too hospital room. Too unproven. Too bright. And the stark wall decorations and half-finished beautifiers leave a little something to be desired visually. I presume that it is for those reasons that rarely will I see Tai Chi at more than half its capacity - an ominous sign for a neighborhood restaurant. 

But it was recommended by a trustworthy source, and out of respect and curiosity I snagged a takeout menu on my walk home some time last fall. For a number of reasons, I was not disappointed.

The first of them is that the General Tso's chicken is nothing short of outstanding, in terms of price, flavor, and quantity. One order will handily serve two eaters with nothing but rice to complement it. The fried wontons are also not to be underestimated.

As a delivery restaurant, it is amazing to see them in action. These guys make the Beijing Opening ceremonies look amateurish. I have ordered, hung up the phone, and heard a knock at my door within 6 minutes from a kid on a bike with my food. No shit. It defies logic how fast these guys can show up sometimes. 

A fact that I resent about myself is that I love Panda Express. I literally lose control of my limbs and bee-line to the loving arms of orange chicken at its faintest scent (seriously, it's pathetic. For more info, see my review of Panda Express). I describe Tai Chi as a (slightly) classier, yet just as affordable, better quality, restaurant version of Panda Express. 

This may not sound like much to you. I wish it didn't to me. But damn that orange chicken and its tastiness! General Tso is the commanding officer to Panda's Orange. You heard it here.
author: Jake C.

description: You know, the food tastes good, but about 15 minutes later.....(ahem) every time, like clockwork. Hey, it's just my experience.
author: Jewel N.

description: I have never eaten in the restaurant, but the delivery service is great.  Quick and reliable.  We were at my bro's last night trying to plan on where to go to for dinner when I suggested we just order delivery and stay in...he had wine, beer, bumper pool and darts, which helped me out in convincing everyone.  We got tai chi and everyone loved the food.  The orange chicken was OH SO good, the beef broccoli was superb and the shrimp lo mein was pretty amazing.  We were all very happy in deed.
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: My husband and I stopped in here a year or so ago when we found our favorite place (Aux Delices) to be closed.  I honestly don't remember what we ordered, but we were really excited by the fact that the couple at the table next to us was going on and on about how fantastic the food was.  Our food came to our table in a decent amount of time, but it wasn't appetizing to look at and lacked in flavor.  We barely touched any of the food we ordered (which is insanely unusual considering we can normally tear through 3-4 dishes a sitting).  We haven't been back since and have always walked by, scratched our heads and wondered what the hype is about.
author: Chrys W.

description: I've never actually been to the restaurant but my friend has ordered takeout from here a few times. Yup they deliver.  Oh my gahhhhhh, GENERAL TSO'S CHICKEN. heaven. A little pricey though. I like my chinese food cheap!
author: C. Z.

description:
There are very few Chinese restaurants that deliver in such a timely manner and as good of food as these people. There have been very few good things to come out of China, i.e. the great wall of China, rickshaws, and Tai Chi. 

The food is incredible. The chicken chow fun with black bean sauce is way more fun than the name suggests and the other chicken dishes are very good too. 

The delivery is fast and easy. I can call them and after a bit of talk with them about what we want to order and where I live and arranging payment. (I would say that this is probably the trickiest part, because while they can cook like the devil, their English skills are lacking.) The delivery is always before the time that they say and the delivery guys are nice. 

This place definitely knows how to wok and woll.
author: Jarod A.

description:
Tai Chi is a great place, with very tasty food and it is an incredible value.  

Their beef curry noodles are tasty and plentiful.  The Kung Pao chicken is also tasty and the portions are very generous.  The pork fried rice is tasty and an incredible value if you are hungry.

I ordered those three dishes to go once.  The whole thing was well under thirty bucks, and it fed me for over two days.  Unbelievable.
author: Dave N.

description: I always order the Almond Chicken Chow Mein and the General Tsao's Chicken which is very satisfying and reheats nicely in case it's just me eating takeout.  Never tried the delivery, live a couple blocks away.  They seem quite earnest in producing good food.  Recommend the two dishes above, however the Chow Mein used to be more vibrant, more al dente.  I'll live with it ...
author: Terry A.

description: I love this place. I'm not giving it five stars because I'm sure presentation and food quality can be matched elsewhere. I will say, however, that I am ALWAYS in the mood for some walnut shrimp and this place by far as THE best walnut shrimp in the city. I order it every time.
author: Bryan E.

description: You won't find a better General Tso's chicken anywhere!!!  I am up from Los Angeles and I can't wait to get my fix.
author: sherri s.

description: I went here with a friend last night and I must say it was very good.   We ordered, egg rolls: made fresh, crisp and hot, not at all greasy.  mu shu pork delish, although not much different than most.  the general chicken which I order at every shinese restaurant.  Theirs was good, fresh, crisp. Mongolian beef, ordered spicy, got spicy.  and the hot n sour soup- my favorite soup - was delish as well. Prompt attentive service.  I would go here again although its a bit far to walk from my neighborhood and there's a place on lower polk that's closer to me that is also pretty good.
author: J T.

description: We have never eaten in the restaurant, so this review is for their take out service.  Man -- is it quick!!..  The food is always fresh and tasty.  It may not be the very best Chinese food ever, but it is quite good and the delivery is excellent.
author: Ed S.

description: Good, consistent, fast, inexpensive Chinese food. There's a lot of seating, they serve brown rice on request, and I they do not overdo it  with oil and sugar. Okay, if you get the General Tso's Chicken it's overdone with oil and sugar. But then you are getting what you asked for!
author: Louise L.

description: This is the place I order my Chinese delivery from. I think it is absolutely great for that purpose. It's decently priced, and arrives hot and tasting great every time.  My only complaint is that they tend to dice their chicken a bit too much in the Kung Pao Chicken. But other than that, I love Tai Chi!
author: Anna S.

description: I've only eaten in the restaurant once, but the service was great and the food was tasty.  I almost always get my food to go from here and take it back home, their Mu Shu Pork is fantastic! Be sure to ask for extra wrappers (I call them tortillas, the staff usually isn't amused) and extra dipping sauce.  The sweet and sour chicken is also very good.  Tai Chi isn't really anything special, but it definitely fits the bill when you're craving cheap, fast Chinese food.
author: Craig E.

description:
************NEVER EAT AT THIS RESTAURANT************************
I frequent yelp to look at reviews of restaurants but have never felt the need to post my own review until now. 
the other day i ordered delivery from tai chi (my first time eating at this restaurant) after looking at the yelp reviews it didn't look too bad..the food came promptly and we began to dig in, when i was almost through eating  a cup of hot and sour soup i slurped one of the last bites and felt a crunch between my teeth, i spit it out onto my my hand and what is it....A FINGERNAIL CLIPPING, i stared at it for a second not really believing that that's what it could possibly be, but soon realized it was upon inspection from my fellow eating partner that night. This has to be one of the grossest experiences i have EVER had with food which is why i had to sign up and write this review. never never never eat from this restaurant unless you feel like picking fingernails out of your soup.
author: sherri s.

description: Excellent chinese food - some of the best I've had in quite some time. The mu shu pork was very flavorful - not at all oily or greasy. The scallops were cooked correctly, unlike the chewy blobs you get at most restaurants. I liked how they brought out the food gradually, which gave us a chance to try each dish by itself. The decor wasn't much to speak of, but the service was good, and the prices were pretty reasonable ($10/person including tax and tip).
author: Dana L.

description: One day during a black out caused not by nature but by PG&E, I noticed all the patrons packed in Tai Chi, eating in the dark!  I thought, this place has got to be good if people are willing to eat here with no lights and no heat.  So, anyway...  today I tried the beef chow fun in black bean sauce and the General Tso's chicken.  It's not spelled that way but that's how you order it.  It's the best chicken I've ever had from a Chinese restaurant.  So good!  And the best part are the low prices!!!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Huge portion and decently priced rice dishes. I like the eggplant stirfry with chicken dish with rice....plentiful for lunch.
author: Yan M.

description: My favorite take-out Chinese joint hands-down. I'd never imagine eating inside though - it's almost depressing and the place has no character - very blah. Except for the Maneki Neko white cat staring at you as you walk in - although that sort of freaks me out (yes, I know it's there for good luck, but an upright cat with its paw facing me isn't the most pleasant thing for a person who has an aversion to cats). But, getting off the tangent, the food - mmm...good...yes...yum. Especially the eggplant special.
author: Dalia K.

description: Favorite Chinese restaurant....I love the potstickers, kung pao chicken, mongolian beef, and General Tso's chicken is amazing too!  All is full of flavor!  Delivery is EXTREMELY quick, food is still piping hot when delivered.
author: Lisa D.

description: Go-to Chinese delivery place in Russian Hill. The chicken with basil is something I dream about at work and order as soon as I get home, and they're the fastest delivery place I know. Barring the weekend, if you order and live in the neighborhood, you'll have your food in about 15 minutes. Can't top that.
author: Carla C.

description: Fast delivery! Good cheap food! Great for meeting low expectations!
author: Cody S.

description: The chicken with black bean sauce is awesome!  Salty.  Chicken chopped small.  Just the way I like it!  Serivce was prompt and friendly.  No waiting.  Customers were coming in and out for orders.  I'll be back!  And, for those of you adverse to MSG, good news.  Tai Chi is another fine non-MSG place.
author: Jack R.

description:
ehhhh.  that's how i feel about this place.  ehhhh.  it wasn't gross or anything, but it really wasn't anything that great.  i had the veggie egg rolls, cashew chicken and veggie chow fun.  everything was just sort of bland.  

i'd rather drive all the way to eric's in noe valley than succumb to the convenience of tai chi delivery again.  i mean, this is san francisco for christ sake.  why settle for unimpressive, uninspired chinese food??
author: Natalie H.

description: 3.5 stars - this place used to look even dumpier than now...walked by plenty times but just never drew me in.  My sister used to live just blocks away and convinced me to join her for lunch there - raved about their spicy soup noodles.  Well, I'm a huge noodle fan and all things spicy so I decided to give it a shot.  To their credit, the huge bowl of noodle was indeed tasty but it wasn't spicy enough for me...but it's most likely plenty or too spicy for most because I can eat extremely spicy food.  The noodle was not too soft and there were plenty beef and veggie...all for $6? I think.
author: Gloria H.

description: I recently just tried this place for the first time. I'm so glad they deliver before 5pm. Yay! Yummy chinese food for lunch on those rainy days at work. This place is wayyyy better than Ho's. They don't use MSG here which is a really good thing for me. You can usually tell if there's MSG in the food when you have to keep drinking and drinking. Reading some of the reviews for this place, I guess I caught them on a very good day.

I wanted decent, cheap, chinese food delivery.  Pretty much what I got.  I did the online ordering, through the affiliated website.  Easy access to the menu, and you get to pick a level of spicyness (mild, medium, hot), which I like, so I can control what I'm getting a bit.  I didn't read the reviews to see what to order so I just ordered some chow mein with pork and the General Tso's Chicken (which was marked as a favorite on the menu).  Both were pretty good, and I have plenty of left overs for $20.  Solid chinese food in the area for delivery.
author: Amit M.

description:
You can order online.
They deliver within 20 minutes. 
Their general tsaos is the best we've had in the city after trying 10 chinese places and continually being disappointed. 
Their chicken quality is good. Their chicken dumplings, egg rolls, and almond chicken chow mein are pretty darn good. Their portions are large and the value is awesome! For the general tsaos, almond chicken chow mein, egg rolls, and chicken dumplings it was $27 with free delivery. We still have tons of leftovers!
author: Molly B.

description: I got a carry out order of potstickers and general tso's chicken.  The service was friendly and the order was done very quickly. The potstickers were really thick and doughy, which kind of overpowered the filling. The chicken was good - a little spicy without being salty. The prices were average for the quality, but good for the serving size (enough for two people or two meals). It wasn't good enough to leave me really curious about the rest of the menu, but I wouldn't rule out trying it again.
author: T _.

description: I was quite satisfied with my meal here.  I didn't see anything that I wanted on the menu, so I asked them to make me a special dish of broccoli with black bean sauce, to which they happily obliged.  We had four dishes for four people, a little brown rice and I can honestly say that we were happy as clams (though no clams were eaten during the course of the meal).
author: Joanna S.

description: For quick (cheap?) delivery it is pretty darn good. I am a sucker for not leaving the house sometimes.  The over sweet general tso's is great hangover food. The potsticker rock
author: michael h.

description: One dish...duck salad...to die for... But, if you've crossed off waterfowl from your diet, General Tso's chix, deep fried prawns, and mongolian beef are excellent substitutes. Reasonably priced selections and awesome lunch specials.
author: Julia C.

description: I am a fan.  Just went for lunch, it was cheap, fast and friendly.  The food was crisp and fresh.  It is no Eliza's, but a great alternative in Russian Hill.
author: Elizabeth J.

description: This place uses no MSG.  The diced chicken in lettuce cups is simply delicious.  And they aren't skimpy with the lettuce, either.  One order gets you like half a head of hand leafed cups.   Also, the hot and sour soup is wonderful.  Won't leave you thirsty at all.
author: K W.

description: This is my neighborhood place, definitely my go-to take-out.  Their General Chicken does the job right.  Quick and cheap.
author: Chris Q.

description: Well the General's chicken is the signature dish to get here I think. I was not pleased with the Kung Pao chicken and the hot and sour soup was disgusting. And I love hot and sour soup. There are to many better places to eat in the city.
author: Jack B.

description: Just tried Tai Chi for the first time. You ever get that feeling that what someone has made for  you they really didn't care about it when they where making it. Dumplings, Szechuan, and Orange Beef. Pretty simple. Could not have been more mediocre to bad. Fairly unbelievable that someone would even serve it. The orange beef is terrible. Didn't come with rice and was so hard and had a strange flavor and texture. Like it was sauteed and then breaded and fried. Szechuan was the only good thing it was mediocre. Dumplings sub par. And last but not least the the fortune cookies where overdone. One hour, $27, and unfortunately no second time around. Maybe they are better in the restaurant but the delivery leaves plenty to be desired.
author: Justin O.

description: What happened?  I lived on Russian Hill for years (moved in 1993) and have been going to the Tai Chi since the eighties, when it still had the red wallpaper, pseudo-wood paneling and chinese lanterns.  Yes, that long.   I've recommended it countless times.  I've persisted through the renovations (I think I count four now), I've lived through the upgrades to the tables, cutlery and plates.  But, I am considering abandoning my long-time favorite, since the last two visits have been disappointing, the last one, yesterday, July 2nd, particularly so.   I always order the same thing:  potstickers, dry-braised green beans, and general tso's chicken, and always take a bunch home to eat over the next several days. The beans marinated nicely overnight, and the chicken was great cold.  Not anymore.  At the restaurant, the potstickers, usually a combination of soft and beautifully browned dough, were too soft, almost gummy  (though the filling tasted good), the beans were distinctly salty.  The chicken was the major disappointment --  the sauce had a harsh aftertaste of vinegar, and the batter was thick and chewy, not crunchy.  They served pre-packaged fortune cookies that were not worth eating.  Today, I tried the beans (they used to be swimming in a nice soy marinade by the next day) and they were OK, but only just that.  The chicken is edible but ho-hum.  I miss that lovely hot-honeyed sauce.  I have to conclude they changed chefs as well as owners.  Very sad.  Whereas I used to drive across town to eat there, I probably won't anymore.   I hope they can regain their footing.  It's a shame.
author: n r.

description: Delicious!  Fast delivery, decent dine-in experience (with absolutely no ambiance).  My personal favorites: veggie spring rolls, chicken wor won ton soup, prawns w/ asparagus in black bean sauce. Best Chinese...second only to Melissa's (no joke).
author: Melani R.

description: This place is a little inconsistent, and I don't like all the dishes, but overall I think this is pretty good food.  I really like their Shanghai Spring Rolls and haven't found rolls I like as much anywhere else.  This is one of the two or three places I'd order from in this part of the city.  Pretty fast delivery, too.
author: Kevin U.

description: Very mediocre Chinese food.  They claim not to put MSG in their food,  but then why did I have a sneezing fit (my typical allergic response to this type of substance) after eating an order of their Kung Pao Beef?!?! Also, I found a piece of red brick or gravel (???) in my food!    The food that I have eaten here has always been more on the sugary/sweet side.  Is that their solution to 'good' Chinese food- to just make it sweet to taste better?!  Their beef is always tough and the absolute cheapest cut of meat pounded to bits.  Don't eat here unless you want very mediocre, sweet Chinese food.  The only bonus is that delviery is quick.
author: M. E.

description: I always recommend this place for good chinese food when friends want to go out to eat. All the dishes are tasty and plentiful so don't be afraid to try new things and share.
author: Bill B.

description:
i'm not a huge fan of chinese food. 

but i liked this spot.

my friends and i ordered 4 different dishes on the menu -  a seafood, veggie, chicken and noodle dish.  

yummy, yum, yum.  

i'll be back.
author: Immer E.

description: I admit it, I love Tai Chi.  I've been coming here for 20+ years, and it's still great Chinese comfort food, but now you don't have to deal with cranky staff or sit in the weird back room by the refrigerator.  Despite the popularity of their tried & true favorites, they're still adding new dishes.  Once we'd tried the Hunan Chili Chicken from the special board, we were finished.  We actually have to order several when we come here with a friend because no one wants to share.  The food is tasty and just what you want on a cold rainy night.  Yes, their delivery is reliable and fast.
author: Jennifer F.

description: Great place to get delivery.  Their hot and sour soup is amazing.  They can actually understand you when you call in and explain your address, which thai and chinese places generally have a really tough time with.  They normally come withing 30 minutes, and have good prices.  The veggies that they serve are fresh and not frozen, and the meet is tender and succulent.  This is the only place that I will be ordering chinese food from in the future.
author: Ben K.

description: I'm generally not a big take-out kind of gal but Tai Chi rocks.  There are several other Chinese places in the neighborhood that I tried ONCE and only once before stumbling upon this gem.  It's meats and vegetables are always fresh, crisp and tasty.  Not to mention that it's never too salty or to greasy.  Done just right.  Friends who I've recommend Tai Chi to have thanked me for showing them the way :-)
author: kim m.

description: Best chinese delivery around Polk Street. Food is always fast, fresh and yummy. Problem is the order takers are "so strong" with the english. If you can get them to understand the order, you are in good shape...cuz the food is excellent.
author: Brian B.

description: I begrudgingly went here with my boyfriend the other night. After walking around Polk street scavenging for food we landed here. I wasn't in the mood for Chinese,  but  was pleasantly surprised by how delicious the food was. We order the green beans, and General Tso's chicken. I rarely eat fried foods, but I had to give in because it smelled so good. I will definitely be back.
author: Lindsay H.

description:
mmm general tsos was delicious! and huge huge huge servings. beef with green beans was pretty good, but the beans were a bit mushy...maybe better with asparagus. but, ugh, pot stickers were disgusting! super doughy and tasted funny. 

would have given it 4 stars for the tsos and fast delivery, but they charge extra for rice! what's up with that??? servings were so huge though, they'll make multiple meals. worth it for the price
author: Alex B.

description: I know when you get take out from a restaurant it isn't the same as eating there, but no one likes to make the "um...I'll be right back" ill-fated trip to the restroom from dinner. Perhaps a bad batch? Who knows. I'm giving them 3 stars and not 2 because I feel they deserve the benefit of the doubt on that one. Albeit, I was impressed that the delivery was extremely fast, online ordering super easy with a well built website, and the prices very competitive. BUT the food was fairly Americanized, ho-hum not ho-ho-sic! And I'm very much A in the ABC of things! I'm happy that they didn't waste any paper napkins and plastic forks on me. For that I give them kudos. I threw out the fortune cookies which were unfortunately stale. And with a big sigh my 3 year long search for a favorite Chinese food delivery place in the City goes on...either that or I need to get off of my lazy butt and walk down the hill to Chinatown for something more authentic. As my Chinese speaking friends have taught me to say, "Ai ya!"
author: Kira R.

description: Food is great, people treat us fantastic and the price is reasonable...what's not to like?
author: m m.

description: My favorite Chinese restaurant in the city. The lettuce cups and potstickers are out of this world.
author: A D.

description: I ordered delivery and I would say this place was OK. Nothing spectacular. They were very fast, which is a definite plus. The mixed veggie deluxe The general's chicken were pretty tasty, but they didn't blow my mind.
author: Gabrielle B.

description: I must say.. Im not a big fan of chinese food BUT I will say Tai Chi Restaurant is awesome!! I will continue to order from them from this day forward. Delivery was quick and the food was still warm and very tasty.. I highly recomment the crab cream cheese cakes, walnut shrimp, beef chow mein. I was very happy and pleased... :)
author: Dj J.

description: They have the best beef/broccoli I've ever had. The delivery is really fast and the food arrives hot. Its also good the next day.
author: Liz M.

description: This place has some great items on the menu, as well as a few daily seafood specials. Parking is tough, of course in that area. But if you get a chance, this is a great place to get some Chinese in the city. The prices are decent, and service is pretty good too.
author: Eric N.

description:
Having recently moved to SF from Asia, I've been missing 'familiar' Chinese food despite the abundance of Chinese restaurants here.  Somehow, the American version of chinese food where meat is flash fried and drenched in some sweet sauce does not appeal to my taste-buds.  That was until I finally stumbled upon Tai Chi at SeamlessWeb.com.  Oh, my tummy thanks thee!

My 3 favourite dishes:
1. Scallops with Chinese Vege - they are very generous with the scallops, the vege's always fresh with the right amount of crunchiness and the sauce, oh the sauce - full of flavor with that hint of ginger.
2. Tea-smoked duck - this was surprisingly good!!! The duck was perfectly crisp with the right amount of seasoning.  And the portion is huge!
3. Beef in black bean sauce - tender slices of beef in fermented black beans, as authentic as the ones I get back home.  Yummy.

This is now one of my favourite take-outs ever!  Food is always hot and NOT soggy when it arrives,  portions are huge and the prices are amazingly cheap, especially the lunch specials.
author: Karen Y.

description: Tai Chi is my favorite chinese take out restaurant.  I used to eat there all the time when I lived in Russian Hill.  Anyway, I order from Tai Chi and they delivered all the way to my condo at New Montgomery  and Third Street, in 20-25 minutes.  I can't even get most chinese restaurants from less than a mile a way to deliver and the ones that will delivery mostly suck!
author: Kevin D.

description: The best general tsao's chicken in the city. period. Cheap and excellent fast delivery (30 mins or less)
author: Craw H.

description: Ahhh, this place seemed so great when I first started eating here.  I really did enjoy the low mein, and we usually ordered another meal to fill the platter which satisfied.  But, after the last experience it may have been the last.  We got lo mein, and mixed veggies with chicken.  Oh yes... and the hot and sour soup.  When we opened everything up, I had a sip of the soup and it was too hot, so luckily for me, that was the last taste I had of it.  My girlfriend met another fate.  She had about half of a mediocre bowl of the soup, and came down with a case of the old food poisoning.  To say the very least, she had a miserable night.  I've heard that hot and sour soup has been known to do this, as certain places will just keep a bowl in the kitchen until its gone.  Letting it heat and cool repeatedly.  Until its gone.  So, after this experience I probably will try a new place and felt like I should probably fill in the masses as well.
author: William B.

description: My dad has been a chef for over thirty years and has eaten Chinese food all over the world. He swears that TAI CHI HAS THE BEST CHINESE FOOD ANYWHERE. I have been eating their stuff since i was a kid and would go there no matter where I am in the city. They do deliver also. You must go and get GENERAL'S CHICKEN!!! It is on the back in the chef's special section. Absolutely to die for. GOOOOOO!
author: Aaron S.

description: Born in Taipei, lived in Hong Kong, traveled extensively through China, family has owned Chinese restaurants:  I know my Chinese food.  However, 'chinese' food as prepared in the US is my least favorite cuisine b/c it's usually super greasy, MSG laden, flavorless gut buster.  I used to reserve it only as a hangover cure but after discovering Tai Chi several years ago, will actually choose to eat and ENJOY it from time to time.  I've sample them all and Tai Chi is hands down, the best Chinese (American) restaurant in SF--no MSG side effects and great flavor. Tai Chi's hot n sour soup is the best. They also do a great Moo Shu. The noodles are lackluster; I'd stick with main dishes.  I agree with other yelpers, the best test of a chinese restaurant is usually the fried rice (which I haven't tried b/c I prefer to make my own) and the hot n sour soup.
author: Linda Y.

description: i have been going here for 8 years now! the service is great and the food is wonderful. their green beans are to die for. parking is kind of a struggle but its worth it!
author: Chana S.

description: Hard for me to give a chinese restaurant 5 stars, but this place would be close. Everything is great here. I love getting take out because I don't really care for the surrounds and usually like to lounge and eat chinese food out of the carton. The one thing that I can't go without every time I order is the General Tso's Chicken. It is by far the best I ever had. This maybe my favorite chinese food in SF, which should say a lot.
author: David M.

description: The General Tso's chicken is really phenomenal.  Lean meat, delicate flavor, just the right amount of crispness.
author: Alexander K.

description: Every once in a blue moon Kelly E. stays in on a Saturday night (this moon was particularly blue - not reflective of my happy mood though).  The roomates were gone, I'd been wine tasting all day, basketball was on and I pulled up the trusty delivery.com to see what sort of junk food I could get delivered to my doorstep to put me into a food coma.  I had an order all ready for a couple of other places, then checked their Yelp credentials, only to find some disappointment.  Tai Chi had the best reviews, so I ordered some eggplant, tofu and chow mein dishes from there (to get to the minimum for the delivery, not cause I binge eat after binge drinking, of course).  I blinked, poured some water into a glass, and my doorbell was aringing!  The polite delivery man, gave me 27 pounds worth of Chinese food and I dumped a bit of each into a bowl (I'm a flavor mixer on occassion.  Spices things up a bit).  It was delicious!  Seriously, the eggplant was great, the tofu was a flavorful and the chow mein wasn't too salty (I love MSG, but am fully aware of the health risks associated with it, so try to avoid it and they leave it out at Tai Chi).  Plus, it lasted me 5 solid meals.  I'm glad delivery.com saves orders, cause I'll be back.  It did, in fact put me into a food coma.  I laid down for a "nap" at 8pm and woke up Sunday at 8am.  Not bad!
author: ellyk E.

description: ordered takeout on friday night as i was feeling under the weather.  it could not have been more bland or middling.  quick delivery is great--but only if the food is actually good.  very disappointing.
author: K H.

description: Why am I posting this, oh why do I share.  I don't even want to tell you about it, because I want to keep the prices low as the food is good.  Now considering the ambiance is not great, should you really take a first date here?...no you shouldn't...but you can take your girl friend here, because she is already putting up with all of your issues.  If she leaves you just sit down and order the Generals Chicken, if she stays get Mandarin Velvet Chicken and spring rolls. The most likely scenario is: you will have to go home and watch a movie. I realize you are thinking about make up sex, but that can't happen as you will be too full!
author: Niko P.

description: Delicious, fresh, quick and reasonably priced.  Tai Chi may be unfortunately named, but it is definitely a Chinese Restaurant that is clean and has good food.  I like the sizzling scallops and the fried basil chicken.  I am a regular.
author: The P.

description: Wow!  We just ordered (and ate) the General Tso's and some Pork Fried Rice.  Both were excellent and delivered piping hot in (literally) less than 15 minutes.  We asked for extra spice on the Tso's and they delivered, perfectly!  I'm already excited to order again sometime soon.
author: Josh M.

description: Been impressed by this place....quick and tasty.  They have good fried dishes for those suffering from a bad hangover....and actually some dishes that are a bit on the "healthier" side ....I definitely recommend the Mu Shu Chicken.....caggage is fresh and tasty!
author: Kaley T.

description: When I last lived in the City (early 90s) this place used to be great- line out the door at the weekends. I visited it yesterday and was very disappointed  to see how far downhill it had gone. Its still cheap but the place was dirty and the General Tsaos chicken (used to be their speciality) was no longer anything special at all. Just another cheap Chinese food joint now- plenty better in the Sunset.
author: Alex C.

description: Good news, bad news.  No MSG, but way too much salt! Ordered the simple curry chicken luncheon special & it was way too salty. Unfortunately I'm not going to return to check if other dishes are less salty and more flavorful.
author: D L.

description: so i tried this place after a a coupld of refreshing bloody mary's at the green sports bar. delivery was quick, only regret is that the hot and spicy eggplant was not hot or spicy enough, yes i did ask them to 'BAM!' my meal. but besides that it was tasty, hopefully it wasnt because of the bloody mary, but was better then the andy's something place..
author: jigi s.

description: I order delivery from these guys from time to time and they are good. Prices are decent and they give large portions. General Tso's chicken is a good option as well as the braised green beans. I am a tough critic though I think and since they haven't done anything spectacular, I'm refraining for giving a 5 star.
author: Richard C.

description: For delivery this is the only spot I consider. I love the velvet chicken, they use white meat and tons of veggies. Plus their delivery is faster than the take-out. I don't understand how that works but I'll stay home and enjoy.
author: Cbr A.

description: It's my go-to place for an inexpensive quick eat.  I'd give it four stars if they'd scrub the floors and the menus.  Why is the floor always so greasy?  The staff is really nice and they always recognize us.  They make me chicken w/ green beans - yum!
author: jessica d.

description: The food was very good, and the portions were very generous. The prices were reasonable, especially since you'll have at least another meal's worth of leftovers. The service was so-so, and the ambiance wasn't great, but it was definitely some tasty Chinese food.
author: Gregory G.

description: Consistently good Americanized Chinese food.  Inexpensive.  Fast delivery.  Bright, clean dining room if you choose to eat in.  If you prefer your Chinese food with more heat, though, this place is not for you.
author: Grace R.

description: This place is the BEST for chinese delivery!  The food is delicious, not too greasy, and the delivery is super fast.  Did I mention that it is also cheap and sends huge portions?  I can eat for days off of one delivery.
author: Lindsey L.

description: I have now found my new favorite chinese delivery! After many bad experiences with other restaurants, I found Tai Chi on yelp, and so thankful that I did!  Food came fast, 40 min, and was hot, super delicious, and cheap! My new go to for chinese.
author: Alexandra G.

description: surprisingly good chinese-- had the shrimp wor won ton (**excellent**) and the vegetarian Lo Han Chat special (but asked them to use fresh tofu, not fried -- again, really good).  I ate way to much and paying for it now.  I'll go back with more friends so we can try more stuff.
author: adam s.

description: great healthy chinese food that usually delivers pretty fast as well.  the green beans are great and so is the orange chicken.
author: michelle k.

description: As good now as it was when we first ate here about 30 years ago.  Love the war wonton soup! Huge portions; order half the amount you would elsewhere.  Service is friendly.  But it needs a good cleaning.  Had to sit on my hands or I would have starting cleaning it myself.  Very dirty walls. Three host/hostesses just waiting for customers--could have been kept busy cleaning a little.
author: Yella W.

description: Excellent quality Chinese food and superb service for take out (they figured out how to package each dish so that it arrives at its best - fried pieces of chicken were still hot and crispy when they arrived instead of steamed and soggy .  Yum!
author: Heather T.

description: you get what you pay for, and this place delivers for the price.  i usually duck in for a quick, CHEAP lunch, which is $8 at most by the time i tip 30%.  not the best chinese i've ever had, but good and cheap enough on the fly.
author: e w.

description:
+
general tsao chicken
tofu and pea pods
chicken wonton soup

-
service: 
a) slow even though the restaurant was not full
b) rude: told us they close at 9 that night, made us feel rushed
c) took awhile to get the waitress back to place our order
d) waitress forgot to tell us that the cook told her they were out of scallops;  she never told us and we waited on a dish that never came :-(
author: Henry F.

description: I'm completely addicted to the hot and spicy eggplant, I find myself eating it at least once a week. I ask them to add soft tofu to it and it's fantastic!
author: Elena A.

description: Hands down, the best Chinese food in San Francisco! I'd brave the ridiculous Russian Hill parking situation just to have the Shanghai chicken spring rolls (I don't think they're on the menu, but your server knows what's up). Every dish I've tried has been delish, the prices are very reasonable, and I love that they serve brown rice and don't use msg. My only complaint is that they don't deliver across town to Potrero Hill. :-(
author: Aisha C.

description: Great Chinese food and delivery, though slightly overrated. But then again, this is my least favorite of the cuisines of the Far East, so maybe my opinion is a bit biased. But overall worth checking out.
author: Jeremy J.

description: Tourists might like this place, but anyone who has been to more than 3 "american style" Chinese restaurants in SF will recognize this place for the mediocre restaurant that it is.  I ordered the egg rolls, General Tso's chicken, and Orange Beef to-go.  Egg rolls were not good.  They actually had this slightly stale/old/freezer burn taste to them.  Just as you would expect form a bad Chinese buffet, except freshly cooked.  The General Tso's chicken was decent, but it was over-battered, over-sauced, under-spiced, over-sweetened, and over-fried.  The chicken buried under all that batter and sauce was chewy from being over-fried.  The orange beef was the best dish.  Again a bit too much sweet sauce and not enough hot spice.  But there was a nice real orange flavor.  The meat itself could have been better quality (i.e. more tender).  I would not go back when there are so many better options just short blocks away.
author: Mark S.
